You can also take a look at the other nice and exclusive perks that we are offering to you.THE LAGARTEADA AS THE EXEMPLIFICATION OF THIS CONFLICT The surroundings of the Tempisque River are a region that was inhabited by the indigenous Chorotega people long before the Spanish arrived to conquer the land. For the Chorotegas the crocodile was a sacred animal and a symbol of fertility. They used to have a big celebration during the spring equinox in which they hunted crocodiles in order to harvest their fat, meat and blood, which in their view had magical powers. During the colonization they protected their tradition with the religious syncretism that many indigenous populations used in these situations: they merged the crocodile hunting ceremony with the Holy week of the Spanish Catholic religion.The historical records are spotty, but at some point about 200 years ago, when the Chorotegas were slowly being replaced by the "criollos", the mix between the indigenous and spanish races, a tradition started that resembles the ancestral one – the 'Lagarteada'.The local word for the Crocodylus acutus is "lagarto", which basically means lizard, and the hunting of the lagarto is what is called the lagarteada. For decades it was an extremely cruel activity. The animal suffered because it was captured using harpoons and after the capture it was killed with knifes and its meat and fat distributed in the community. After the government prohibited crocodile hunting there has been an effort to preserve the tradition in a way that doesn´t harm the animal. The community of Ortega agreed to change several aspects of the activity, for instance the modern lagarteada no longer involves killing these great beast. After capturing the animal they bring it to the town, where a special pool has been built. The community gathers around the animal. The next morning, the same group of men bring the crocodile back to the river and set it free in the same place where it was captured, alive and without injuries. It has been done like this for many years already.Then, in 2017 something went wrong: The animal died in captivity during the late night, causing outrage among environmentalists and conservationists. As a result, the community has been vilified, a national scandal erupted and environmental groups mobilized to prohibit the tradition. We are three months away from the next lagarteada and it´s not clear whether the activity will be carried out or not in 2018.In a sense, the largateada tradition is at a crossroads. While some people see in this a conflict that needs to be resolved by repression and prohibitions, for us the conflict around the largateada is an educational opportunity that has the potential to benefit both, the Crocodylus acutus and the communities living near it.OUR PROPOSAL: TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE CONTROVERSYIn May 2013, a group of scientist from the National University of Costa Rica conducted a research project in the Tempisque River Area. After hundreds of interviews they concluded that:
80% of surveyed residents said that they had not received any information about the crocodiles and approximately the same proportion said that they were interested in environmental education activities.
There was an inefficient communication process between scientists, environmental educators, Ministry of Environment, wildlife managers, and those who really need the information (being the communities).
Source: “Activities That May Influence the Risk of Crocodile (Crocodylus Acutus: Reptilia: Crocodilidae) Attack to Humans in the Tempisque River Area, Guanacaste, Costa Rica. (Iván Sandoval-Hernández, Alejandro Duran-Apuy, Jacqueline Quirós-Valerio y otros)” publicado por Revista Uniciencia (http://www.revistas.una.ac.cr/index.php/uniciencia/article/view/9040)We have being accompanying the community over the last three years. We firmly believe that there is a solution to this problem and that it has to do with awareness raising in local communities and on a national level. The key is the environmental education of affected communities and the reconstruction and protection of the habitats. Our ultimate goal is to save the crocodiles but this cannot happen without the cooperation of local communities.An example picture from Ñuku / The photo book.
WHAT WE NEED: THE PHOTO BOOK 
AND THE TRAVELING PHOTOGRAPHIC EXHIBITIONWe wrote a photo book about the traditional lagarteada of the community of Ortega, with 84 exclusive images of the event of 2017, strong and beautiful images that have the power to change hearts and minds. The book's title is “Ñuku” (crocodile, in the Chorotega language) and contains the opinion of scientists, important data about the Crocodylus acutus that everybody who lives nearby the rivers needs to know, some of the history of the Chorotega tradition, points of view of the environmentalist groups and the testimony and words of the people of Ortega. This book would be an extraordinary didactic material and a powerful resource to raise awareness.With this campaign we are planning to print at least 250 copies of the book together with 26 photographs (30" x 20") for the traveling photographic exhibition.HOW WILL THE BOOK HELP IN THE CONSERVATION OF THE CROCODILE?1rst. the recognition of the value of the culture and traditions of the Ortega community is an important step to generate an alliance that allows working with them in the conservation of the crocodile. Since the community is a determining factor in the protection of the animal, only if its needs are being taken into account, can a sustainable solution be found.2nd. the book seeks to be a bridge between the different actors of the country so that they can begin to listen to each other. It gives space to the community to express their points of view along with powerful images that allow a visceral access to the experience of the affected people. The book also contains information that will be more easily digested by the community because it is portrayed by themselves, respectful off their traditions and experience.3rd. the book will allow us to lobby and advocacy work before government institutions, private companies and environmental groups, with the aim of the conservation of crocodile habitats.4rth. the book is an important tool for fundraising in order to carry out the project’s medium term goals, reforestation and the expansion of natural habitats for the crocodiles in Costa Rica.A portion of the books will be donated to affected communities, schools and local government institutions, as well as private companies and environmental organizations in the context of the educational activities planned within this project: the traveling photographic exhibitions. The rest of the books will be sold and with the profit the project will continue to be financed.THE TARGET AUDIENCE FOR THE EXHIBITION OF THE PHOTOGRAPHSThe photographs will be displayed in the schools and colleges of those Guanacaste communities whose students reside in areas of coexistence with crocodiles (Rio Tempisque). The exhibition will be accompanied by environmental education workshops on the human-crocodile conflict that will be under the responsibility of Laura Porras, researcher and teacher of the Master's Degree program in Conservation and Wildlife Management of the International Institute for the Conservation and Management of Wildlife (ICOMVIS) and students of the Environmental Sciences career at the National University of Costa Rica. We believe that it will be easier for children and young people to feel identified and interested in the workshops if we start from images that reflect their own communities and cultural traditions.WE WANT TO RAISE AWARENESS BUT ALSO DO SOMETHING ELSE, WITH YOU ON BOARD.If we succeed and exceed the fund raising goal, hopefully by a large percentage, all the surplus money collected will be used in:
Printing more books (initially we were thinking of an edition of 500 copies).
Financing a reforestation program, in coordination with the School of Ortega, the International Institute for the Conservation and Management of Wildlife and asking for the technical advice of the forest nursery of the School of Forest Sciences of the National University of Costa Rica (which would also donate a first quantity of trees), in order to plant autochthonous trees in the margins of the river, to help rebuilding the nesting habitat of the Crocodylus acutus.
HOW CAN YOU CONTRIBUTE?We already have the content of the book and the exhibition, so what we need is to design, print, reproduce and distribute the material. The approximated coast of this initial part of the project is:Designing and printing the book (250 copies):                                              US$ 1000 + US$ 7000Printing the Photographs for the traveling exposition (26 copies):                                 US$ 1000Perks:                                                                                                                                                     US$ 1000Shipping the books and perks:                                                                                                     US$ 1000Total:                                                                                                                               US$ 11000An example picture from Ñuku / The photo book.WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN?If you contribute with this campaign we offer you many different kinds of perks, as a very sincere “thank you” for supporting this important project.Starting from US$ 25 you will be getting three really nice postcards of the lagarteada tradition. Those three photographs have been part of the international exhibition “ESFotoperiodismo 2015” that was traveling through El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras during a year, with the support of the Photography Center of the Latitudes Foundation, the Cultural Center of Spain and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of El Salvador.In the column on the side you can find out about the other great perks that we are offering to reward your generosity towards this awareness effort.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN COLLABORATEIf you can't contribute but you want to get involved anyway, there is something else that you can do: become our ambassador. Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tell your friends, relatives, coworkers or classmates, talk to all the people that you know that might be interested in supporting this campaign. The more people you tell the more chances we have to reach our goal.WHO WE ARE?Allan Barboza-Leitón / I am a documentary photographer with focus on social causes and human rights, founder member of the Costa Rican Association of Documentary Makers and also founder of the Action Center for Human Rights. I am vegetarian and I stand up for the animal rights. I am convinced that we only can change things in a lasting way if we trust in the capability of the people to grow consciousness and provide them with the information and tools required to grow awareness. I use my camera to help this goal and I am committed to make a contribution to leave a better world in the hands of the next generations.Gabriela Segura Umaña / I am a psychologist with experience working with different communities. I have collaborated with populations in vulnerable conditions and with groups of rural-coastal women in the Northern Pacific of Costa Rica, as well as with fishermen and farmers from the border between Costa Rica and Nicaragua. I am passionate about the histories of the everyday life of the humbled people, strongly motivated by the environmental causes and committed with the human and animal rights.

story:
Company Description

Gris Gris Gardens is a hydroponic farming company that provides fresh produce to the local food community in New Orleans, Louisiana. We will grow produce and herbs for restaurants and local apothecaries and aim to support the growing local food movement in New Orleans. The city lacks resources for urban farming and future programs that will lead to better nutrition for the community. With a container farm, GGG can convert an entire acre of food production within 320 square feet. What a great movement for our future?! 

Our world is changing. More people than ever are now living in tightly populated, urban areas, and there’s an increasing demand for locally grown and sustainably produced food. People want to know the story behind the meal on their plates and the products they use. And even city dwellers want their food to be fresh and full of nutrients, not pre-packaged and shipped from thousands of miles away.

Our climate is also continuing to evolve. Extreme weather conditions are becoming more common, and land and water are becoming scarcer. Large-scale food production and distribution has had a significant impact on the earth’s ecosystem, and it’s continuing to affect our water levels and biodiversity.

Transparency is key to understanding where and how food is produced and Gris Gris Gardens is committed to improving transparency in the restaurant industry by growing ‘hyper-local’ produce in one of the most innovative hydroponic systems available, Freight Farms’ Greenery.  Growing in the Greenery enables us to provide unparalleled transparency in all operations from seed to harvest and provides our customers with the certainty that they are purchasing produce grown via the best agricultural practices available.

Personal Connection to the Company 

Gris Gris Gardens has become a project of mine that aligns with my love for education. I have been in the teaching profession for 13 years and looking for movement outside of the walls of a classroom. I want to use the container farm as a source of income, by selling crops to businesses in need of fresh local produce. I am looking to set up programs to educate children/young adults (and possibly even adults) on the hydroponic growing system that can turn any person into a modern-day farmer.  It is an important mission of mine to contually connect kids to the power of nature. This would be through teaching young generations that they can make small movements to be more self-sustainable with growing food.  

Our Product

We will initially grow greens, herbs, and vegetables and sell it to local food suppliers.  This type of cash crop takes just a couple weeks to reach maturity and we estimate harvesting every month of the year.  

Our crops are hyper-local, meaning that our crops are grown in the community where it will be consumed, and is thus considered a premium and differentiated product by the market, commanding a higher price point that even organic foods.  This differentiation is what enables us to command the higher price as opposed to the general wholesale price.

Funding 

The funding of the container farm will allow me to set up this project within the New Orleans community and provide learning experiences that will benefit all ages. The funding I am looking for is the container farm itself, rental of urban land, transportation of the container, and additional start-up costs.

Let's CHAT

I am available to talk more about this project and answer any questions you may additionally have at this point. As you can tell, this is a project that fulfills a great need within our community.

story:
WHO’S IN CHARGE OF INTERNATIONAL GOVERNANCE OF THE CLIMATE?

Is it the UN? Is it the Paris Accords or the IPCC? Is it USA and China? Is it a world parliament? Or, maybe we are doing great jobs nationally in many countries, but not internationally. The answer to the problem might just be that no one person or institution is responsible or accountable at the global level to ensure we do not reach the climate catastrophe point of no return. GLOBAL PROBLEMS REQUIRE GLOBAL SOLUTIONS.

JOIN US at the CLIMATE DEMOCRACY & JUSTICE SUMMIT in Greece, this 22-26 July. We will start in the Island of Corfu, and move to the mountains of Epirus, Greece, for 5 days of seminars, training, and brainstorming workshops conducted with a panel of international experts on international law, environment, and global governance.

SUPPORT US to train youth climate activists into ambassadors. This year, we will be selecting two youth climate defenders from each continent plus the sinking islands, to attend the summit with their expenses fully paid and become our ambassadors. Armed with this knowledge, they will engage with people and national governments and to become stakeholders and representatives to the international institutions. They can fight for all of us to be represented in climate governance. Let "we the peoples," especially our youth,  govern the climate!

What We Need

We expect the entire seminar to cost about €100 000. Half of that will just be the costs of sponsoring the participation of the twelve climate ambassadors from around the world, and that’s what we want your help in raising. We have been talking to prominent youth defenders from Africa, the Americas, Asia, the Middle East, Europe and the South Pacific, incredible and passionate young people who want to come together to make real change. It can’t happen without your help to pay for the logistics – transportation, meals, accommodation, etc.

What do you get for contributing? In the short run, you get what we all get:  youth ambassadors that would represent us in governance of the climate, fighting to make all of our voices heard. In the long run you are supporting CUNCR in organizing more projects of this type, focused on global challenges such as nuclear disarmament and armed conflicts, human rights, and extreme poverty. When we are all recognized as global citizens, we can all come together to meet these challenges!

Other Ways You Can Help

Enhance our Summit by participating, as an expert, trainer, or just a concerned world citizen. Let's have our global village meeting this July.

Also, please introduce youth climate defenders in your community and region who can be great candidates to be trained as ambassadors.

Last but not least, spread the word. CLIMATE DEMOCRACY NOW!

www.cuncr.org

story:
I spend a lot of time in oceans around our planet.  I've waded through plastic bags to get to waves. I've watched entire eco systems disappear when our coral reefs bleach. I've shed tears when I've seen ocean animals emerge with plastic in their guts. Years ago, I realized that I could no longer revel in my ocean time, without doing something actionable to give back.  

Let’s leave a legacy of positive change for the oceans of past and future generations.  Let’s deepen our connection to each other and restore our bodies and hearts while restoring the ocean. Join me at an Eco Karma event or support us with a donation or purchase of any of our incredible, ethically made Eco Karma products!!!  I've created the hand drawn Ganesha surfing the waves of life, specially for this occasion and I am so stoked to share it with you. From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! 

What is Eco Karma?

I've always been inspired by Karma Yoga, which is about finding your higher self in service to others. These teachings helped me develop Eco Karma Yoga: devoting our selves in service of nature.  Since 2014, I have been bringing yogis to ocean shores in Florida, Bali, Australia and Hawaii. We've cleaned beaches, transplanted coral and restored native plant habitats.  In the process, we have realized that our yoga is so much more than giving back to our bodies. 

In 2019 we have eco karma projects lined up in Hawaii and Bali. We will remove plastic from the ocean, restore fish stocks and transplant coral. We will do it as a collective community, and commit to living our life with more awareness and kindness every day so we can reduce our impact on our planet.  

Why the Coral Reefs?

We are so intimately connected to the ocean. Every tear and every drop of sweat comes and goes from the ocean. Every second breath we take is produced by  plankton. Our oceans are the source of countless life forms. And within then, coral reefs are like the rain forests of the ocean.  They cover a mere 1% of the ocean floor yet are home to approximately 25% of all marine life!

Today coral reefs around the world are in danger.  Some estimates show how approximately 10% of the world's coral reefs are dead, and about 60% of the world's reefs are at risk due to human-related activities. By the 2030s, 90% of reefs are expected to be at risk from both human activities and climate change.

Connect to your Higher Porpoise!

The main work of my life is to make sure that Nature remains the deepest source of our mental, physical and spiritual health. I see the ocean as my temple and my playground.  Perhaps for you it's the mountains, or the rivers, or the lakes.  No matter what feeds your soul, I want us to connect our LOVE for ecology with both the physical yoga practice and selfless service of Karma yoga.  Thank you once again for fueling my birthday with LOVE.  

We so APPRECIATE YOU and are committed to living a life of mindful awareness so we can continue to leave our children and their children a sustainable home on which to dwell.  

With peace + aloha,

Eoin Finn.

Love is the Ultimate Renewable Resource!

And if you were wondering... what is BLISSOLOGY? 

Blissology is about tuning into the the wisdom of our innermost heart so we can stay connected to not just our bodies but to our personal relationships, to our communities, and to Nature.  There is a still place within, a source of infinite joy, love and bliss. When we are in touch with this place life ceases to be merely about us and we feel deeply connected to the well -being of our body/mind, our personal relationships, our community and nature.  Blissology is about deepening our awareness of this place so we can be a positive force in the world.

story:
Resumen

Somos, Alicia Arribas Moyano y Federica Frenda, guardianas de el Santuario de las Abejas fundado hace 8 años en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en Perú por Jerry Freeman, un maestro apicultor que sentía la urgencia de proteger a las abejas: animal  sagrado e indispensable para el equilibrio de la vida y en grave peligro y con ella, toda la humanidad.


Las verdaderas beneficiarias de la campaña van a ser 500 000 abejas.
La labor de el Santuario de las Abejas consiste en proporcionarles las condiciones ideales para su salud y fortaleza, dándose el aprovechamiento de sus productos como la miel, sólo en momento de mucha abundancia. 


Es un proyecto totalmente auto-sostenido por las actividades de sensibilización que organizamos trabajando con escuelas, creando eventos, con círculos de sanación y generando productos naturales de cosmética y medicina. También difundimos la importancia del cuidado de la abeja y lo hacemos concreto introduciendo colmenas en el hogar para que cada vez seamos más guardianes conscientes de la importancia de esta misión. 

Durante estos 8 años, hemos tenido que cambiar de espacio 4 veces. El terreno donde nos encontramos actualmente está en venta y sentimos, guardianas y abejas, que ya ha llegado el momento de conseguir un terreno propio para que todo el proyecto esté por fin seguro y pueda crecer tranquilo. 

Tenemos 4 meses para recaudar los fondos, tiempo que nos queda de alquiler del terreno. 

Las abejas y las guardianas estaremos infinitamente agradecidas por su apoyo!
Sientan el llamado de las abejas y apóyennos a preservar este ser indispensable para la Vida.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 150 000 $ para:

- comprar un terreno de 4950 m2 ubicado en Calca, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Peru 

-  desarrollar un jardín de  plantas melíferas, medicinales y autóctonas

- construir un taller donde desarrollar nuestras actividades.

 

Obtienes, como agradecimiento a tu aporte, una recompensa única y sagrada!!

 

El impacto

Conservar a la abeja implica muchos beneficios para la comunidad local y el mundo entero a distintos niveles:  

- la abeja es la polinizadora fundamental indispensable para el mantenimiento de la biodiversidad y de la que dependen el 70% de los alimentos que consumimos.
- la abeja nos brinda medicinas naturales de excelente calidad (miel, propoleo y cera).
- la abeja tiene una vibración que permite conectarse con el Todo

No todos podemos tener colmenas en nuestro hogar y cuidar directamente a las abejas pero, apoyando esta campaña,  todos podemos volvernos guardianes de este Santuario y de esta manera contribuir en la disminución de la extinción de este ser indispensable. 

El proyecto existe desde hace más de 8 años y está funcionando cada vez con más éxito. Lo único que falta es un terreno propio y una infraestructura que garantice la continuidad estable  del proyecto donde crear una escuela de guardianes de las abejas y de la biodiversidad. 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

El mayor riesgo del proyecto son las mudanzas a las que nos vemos obligadas por no tener un terreno propio, ya que es en estos movimientos donde las colmenas se ven impactadas y algunas no son capaces de sobrevivir a la mudanza, reduciéndose con ellas la población de abejas.

Nuestro mayor desafío reside realmente en el aspecto económico. Dedicarnos plenamente a la protección de las abejas no nos permite desarrollar muchas actividades lucrativas. Comprar un terreno en esta zona es hoy un gran reto. 

  

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Sabemos que muchas personas están sensibles al tema de la extinción de las abejas pero no todas pueden contribuir económicamente. En cualquier caso, ayúdanos a llegar a más personas difundiendo nuestra campaña en tus redes... y cultiva tus propias plantas melíferas!!

Recuerda usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
story_txt:
Resumen
Somos, Alicia Arribas Moyano y Federica Frenda, guardianas de el Santuario de las Abejas fundado hace 8 años en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en Perú por Jerry Freeman, un maestro apicultor que sentía la urgencia de proteger a las abejas: animal  sagrado e indispensable para el equilibrio de la vida y en grave peligro y con ella, toda la humanidad.
Las verdaderas beneficiarias de la campaña van a ser 500 000 abejas.La labor de el Santuario de las Abejas consiste en proporcionarles las condiciones ideales para su salud y fortaleza, dándose el aprovechamiento de sus productos como la miel, sólo en momento de mucha abundancia. 
Es un proyecto totalmente auto-sostenido por las actividades de sensibilización que organizamos trabajando con escuelas, creando eventos, con círculos de sanación y generando productos naturales de cosmética y medicina. También difundimos la importancia del cuidado de la abeja y lo hacemos concreto introduciendo colmenas en el hogar para que cada vez seamos más guardianes conscientes de la importancia de esta misión. Durante estos 8 años, hemos tenido que cambiar de espacio 4 veces. El terreno donde nos encontramos actualmente está en venta y sentimos, guardianas y abejas, que ya ha llegado el momento de conseguir un terreno propio para que todo el proyecto esté por fin seguro y pueda crecer tranquilo. 
Tenemos 4 meses para recaudar los fondos, tiempo que nos queda de alquiler del terreno. 
Las abejas y las guardianas estaremos infinitamente agradecidas por su apoyo!Sientan el llamado de las abejas y apóyennos a preservar este ser indispensable para la Vida.
 
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 150 000 $ para:
- comprar un terreno de 4950 m2 ubicado en Calca, Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Peru 
-  desarrollar un jardín de  plantas melíferas, medicinales y autóctonas
- construir un taller donde desarrollar nuestras actividades.
 
Obtienes, como agradecimiento a tu aporte, una recompensa única y sagrada!!
 

El impacto
Conservar a la abeja implica muchos beneficios para la comunidad local y el mundo entero a distintos niveles:  
- la abeja es la polinizadora fundamental indispensable para el mantenimiento de la biodiversidad y de la que dependen el 70% de los alimentos que consumimos.- la abeja nos brinda medicinas naturales de excelente calidad (miel, propoleo y cera).- la abeja tiene una vibración que permite conectarse con el Todo
No todos podemos tener colmenas en nuestro hogar y cuidar directamente a las abejas pero, apoyando esta campaña,  todos podemos volvernos guardianes de este Santuario y de esta manera contribuir en la disminución de la extinción de este ser indispensable. 
El proyecto existe desde hace más de 8 años y está funcionando cada vez con más éxito. Lo único que falta es un terreno propio y una infraestructura que garantice la continuidad estable  del proyecto donde crear una escuela de guardianes de las abejas y de la biodiversidad. 
 

Riesgos y desafíos
El mayor riesgo del proyecto son las mudanzas a las que nos vemos obligadas por no tener un terreno propio, ya que es en estos movimientos donde las colmenas se ven impactadas y algunas no son capaces de sobrevivir a la mudanza, reduciéndose con ellas la población de abejas.
Nuestro mayor desafío reside realmente en el aspecto económico. Dedicarnos plenamente a la protección de las abejas no nos permite desarrollar muchas actividades lucrativas. Comprar un terreno en esta zona es hoy un gran reto. 
  

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Sabemos que muchas personas están sensibles al tema de la extinción de las abejas pero no todas pueden contribuir económicamente. En cualquier caso, ayúdanos a llegar a más personas difundiendo nuestra campaña en tus redes... y cultiva tus propias plantas melíferas!!
Recuerda usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

story:
Let's create a global movement of people taking carbon-cutting actions

We have already had the movement of climate-awareness. Now it’s time for action.

Governments have failed us, 1m species are threatened with extinction, temperatures are rising, life support systems are breaking down, and we have only 8 years left to stop using oil entirely1.

We need all levels of society globally to start taking action to defend our living planet - to influence friends, family, celebrities, CEOs, politicians and policy-makers to help create change.

That’s where The Climate App comes in - the tool for the movement. Uniquely, The Climate App will make cutting carbon easy & fun, while providing a way for you to see what everyone around you are doing too! Action is easier when you're not alone.

All perks come with early access to the app and tree planting!

 

The Climate App

  • The Climate App (TCA) provides a fun & easy way to track & improve your carbon footprint with friends, family and others. Complete challenges that encourage and inspire others, creating a large community of carbon-cutters!
  • Complete fun challenges such as: Reducing meat / switching to green energy / buying a bamboo toothbrush / attending a protest / going car-free / writing to your elected officials / changing your workplace's habits, and many more - Duolingo style
  • Get helpful tips & direction for how to make change easy.
  • Share these actions and your own ones to inspire others & cause the multiplier effect - Strava style
  • See stats about your progress and collective action from your friends.
  • Win medals, unlock achievements and earn titles depending on your progress.
  • See the global progress and what actions have to be taken.
  • And most importantly - be connected with others in fighting the greatest challenge of our time!

The app leverages positive peer-pressure, the #1 reason for behavioural change3. Now we need your help to turn our designs into reality. Sneak-peek glimpses in the slideshow!

 

Our Story

Started in 2019 by Samuel Naef (NASA Research scholar, founder of 8Billionminds) after climate livestream events, the team now consists of 25 passionate environmentalists mostly in the US & UK (and 31 external helpers) that have come together to help solve the largest crisis of our time.
We have developed the alpha app, beta app designs, partnerships, social media presence, and this campaign - all with zero funding.
 

Our Team

We are experts from all over the world. Our experience comes from NASA / Sky / Rapid-scale start-ups / School for Social Entrepreneurs / Unltd / Princes Trust / Airbus / SEEsustainability / Psychology Degrees / Doctorates / 8Billionminds / the NHS and Extinction Rebellion.
To find out more on the team, see: www.theclimateapp.earth/the-team

Support comes from: Our ambassador Max Litchfield, Olympic swimmer; Sporting legend Phil Tufnell; Kwattswap and Sussex University Innovation Center
 

The Plan

  1. Develop the Alpha app using volunteers - Done
  2. Test the Alpha app and finalise the Beta app designs - In progress
  3. Develop the Beta app using a professional development team.
  4. Partner with organisations to help cover the core-costs of the project while expanding our online presence and educational outreach.
  5. Launch initially in US and UK, then roll out to other high-emitters

 

Our Goal

GOAL 1: £20k - Sam will work on this full time, and we will hire developers to complete the beta app within 4 months - COMPLETE!!!
GOAL 2: £25k - We can develop the beta app and fix bugs faster while improving the professional feel!
GOAL 3: £30k - We can develop the app in 3 months, improving compatibility across all devices, and scale product improvements from your direct feedback post app launch - including some animation!

- the more we raise the better the app will be!

 

How you can support us

  • Back this campaign now! Help us reach £25k!
  • Tell your network that you support TCA and tell them why
  • Follow & share us on Facebook/Twitter/Linkedin/Instagram

 

Thank you for being part of this movement and backing this campaign,
Sam, Amber, Astrid, Beth, Charlie, Deise, Hannah, Holly, Jessie, Josh, Kristin, Matthew, Milli, Paul, Sarah, Sindhu, Sophia, Tiffani, Tim, Tom, Vanessa, Xingjian, Yehudis, Zhong
hello@theclimateapp.earth

 

Notes:
For scientific references, see FAQ.
The Climate App is a CIC (aka Social Enterprise/B Corp)
We will not keep the money if we don't reach the target

story:
Mission: 

Around The World 2016 is a sailing mission to raise support and spread awareness of rhino preservation to communities everywhere.

Short Description:

Hugh and Sara Turpin are Rhino Ocean Warriors – environmentalists who have chosen to leave the corporate world and their home to sail around the world to establish support against rhino poaching.

Long Description: 

Rhino poaching is driven by demand for rhino horn in Asia and, in particular, Vietnam. It is used in traditional medicine, but more commonly now as a status symbol to display success and wealth.

It is unfortunately on the increase – spiraling since 2007 and pushing the remaining 20,000 Rhino closer to extinction, with the possibility of deaths overtaking births during 2016.

Hugh and Sara hope to reverse and reduce the demand for rhino horn by developing international awareness and support against the illegal syndicates who are responsible for the continued slaughter of these magnificent animals.

Plans: 

The boat is our environmentally-friendly and economical mode of transport, home and office. It will serve as accommodation for working guests and a source of income to sustain her and raise funds for projects back home.

We plan to deliver our message through the following platforms:

Fund Raising:

Rhino conservation needs financial resources to close the gap with the poaching syndicates. The funds raised locally nowhere near match the funding required to stop poaching. Rhino Ocean Warriors intends to gain one million individual paid commitments of 1 Euro through our declaration, of which 42% will be awarded to Project Rhino KZN. All future funds raised and in excess of the initial €136,000.00 for the boat will be split 42% with Project Rhino KZN and the balance retained for operational costs. Funds exceeding operational costs will be channeled to Project Rhino KZN.

Our declaration book, first signed by Kingsley Holgate

If you are unable to contribute, your participation in shouting out against poaching in support of our campaign will be rewarding in itself. Please share our campaign with your networks to help spread our message. 

Education:

We will be placing reliance on Lions International and Rotary Clubs to pave our way around the world by creating opportunities for us to talk to schools and universities. We see the youth as the generation that will help resolve the problems.

Partnerships: 

Rhino Ocean Warriors aims to partner with different rhino projects around the world. We want to use our beacon to support practical solutions to conservation  including education, technology, policing and sustainable sources of funding. We have already partnered with the Rhino Art –"Let Our Children’s Voices Be Heard" campaign (founded by the Kingsley Holgate Foundation) and plan to extend its reach internationally.

Rhino Ocean Warriors Club:

Part of our efforts include the establishment of the Rhino Ocean Warriors Club, whose purpose is to sustain the momentum of wildlife preservation. This allows members a structured opportunity to voice their opinions and share ideas.


Support:

Rhino Ocean Warriors (ROW) have committed support of:

Project Rhino KZN,

Provide a pillar of strength to ROW, having a proven track record by uniting 18 renowned organisations working together in South Africa to curb rhino poaching.

They have a footprint of 24 private game reserves and 8 provincial game reserves that benefit directly from their efforts and fund raising initiatives.

Lions International Shelly Beach Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa

Provide networks throughout the world and create the opportunity for ROW to deliver the awareness message by engaging with the youth, and developing opportunities for exchange students.

Rotary Clubs

Provide strong lines of communication through their e-club of Southern Africa into their international associates.

Bushman Films  (Mike McNamara)

Attend to all the local (South African) wildlife filming and editing of the sailing trips and community engagements, as ROW moves around the world.

Kingsley Holgate Foundation

Kingsley Holgate is a highly respected humanitarian, author and adventurer. He initiated Rhino Art, which has delivered a strong message and created enthusiasm into approximately 250,000 youth in South Africa.

Call to Action:

If you want to see the rhinos in the bush with babies rather than in history books, please jump on board with us and support our crowd funding on Indiegogo and create a larger voice by including your networks.

Remember if our target of €136,000.00 is not met, your money will be refunded by Indiegogo within 5 to 7 days.


ROW DONOR REWARDS

Thank you for taking the time to support this project. You have made a statement to the world about something that is important to you and your voice will be heard through our campaign.

In appreciation we have designed an award allocation based on value of contribution ranging from 1 Euro to 10,000 Euro. We hope that you will continue following our progress around the world and help continue fighting the good fight against rhino poaching.  

Perks on offer:

One week on the boat (excluding travel costs)
Rhino Ocean Warriors t-shirts
Children’s Rhino Art autographed by Kingsley Holgate

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Issues & how we can ALL help

Serenity Acres will not be just a farm, just an animal sanctuary, just a plant nursery.  It will bring all of these businesses and causes together to confront some of the worst problems that affect our world:

  • Nutritious food availability- Many communities around the U.S. and the world are classified as "Food Deserts", this means that the people have little or no access to fresh produce and nutritious food.  We at Serenity Acres believe that with the proper support and community education programs, we can drastically increase the quality of life for millions of people around the globe.  Starting here at home.
  • Animal cruelty and abandonment- Each year, approximately 1.5 million shelter animals are euthanized.  thankfully this number has been decreasing significantly since 2011, but we at Serenity Acres have the training and the will to help.  We just need your support.
  • Climate change- Scientists have confirmed that if we do not drastically change our CO2 emission rate in the next 10 years, there will be irreversible harm done to our planet.  At Serenity Acres, we are dedicated to leaving the planet healthier for future generations.  Ethiopia has recently taken the initiative and planted a record shattering 350 million trees in 1 day, ALL to help tackle the climate change crisis.  Your donation will help us attempt to one day break that record with a global day of tree planting!

Our goal is to raise $2,000,000.  This will allow us to...

We have the training, the will power and the passion.  We just need your financial support to jump start us:

  • Purchase 40+ Acres in the California desert and build infrastructure for animal housing and rehabilitation, staff housing, community education rooms and farm equipment.
  • The California desert is not the ideal farm location, but it is not a lost cause and it deserves a chance at being revived with sustainable agriculture practices and consistent reforestation.
  • We set a high goal because the more funds we can secure, the more good we can do!  No matter what is raised Serenity Acres will come to life.  Your donations now will just give us the boost to start NOW and start STRONG.  Help us so we can help you.

The Immediate Impact

Some issues, like climate change obviously cant be fixed overnight, but thousands of Americans, including the family behind Serenity Acres, will benefit from the almost immediate availability of:

  • Easy to access and low cost fresh, nutritious produce including annual and perennial vegetables plus, rare and tropical fruit.
  • Consistent produce donations to local food banks and homeless shelters.
  • Our family will be able to stop struggling paycheck to paycheck, and can begin fighting to make life better for everyone else in return.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page to quickly share our message!

Thank you!

Purchase 40+ Acres in the California desert and build infrastructure for animal housing and rehabilitation, staff housing, community education rooms and farm equipment.
The California desert is not the ideal farm location, but it is not a lost cause and it deserves a chance at being revived with sustainable agriculture practices and consistent reforestation.
We set a high goal because the more funds we can secure, the more good we can do!  No matter what is raised Serenity Acres will come to life.  Your donations now will just give us the boost to start NOW and start STRONG.  Help us so we can help you.


The Immediate Impact
Some issues, like climate change obviously cant be fixed overnight, but thousands of Americans, including the family behind Serenity Acres, will benefit from the almost immediate availability of:

Easy to access and low cost fresh, nutritious produce including annual and perennial vegetables plus, rare and tropical fruit.
Consistent produce donations to local food banks and homeless shelters.
Our family will be able to stop struggling paycheck to paycheck, and can begin fighting to make life better for everyone else in return.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page to quickly share our message!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Living Corals Initiative

Many are aware of coral reef depletion around the world but they also tend to underestimate the extent of damage. As it stands, we have already lost 27% of the worlds coral reefs. Should the present rate of destruction continue, 60% of the world's coral reefs will be destroyed over the next 30 years!

We are a social enterprise driving efforts to promote marine life conservation programs via:

1) coral planting activities;

2) biodiversity conservation programs; and

3) the promotion of ethical diving expeditions

Our three (3) conservation sites - Pom Pom, Kalapuan and Batu Rua - are located within the island of Borneo in Sabah, Malaysia (South East Asia). The thriving ecosystem of our conservation sites serve as a testament to our expertise and commitment to large scale marine conservation. 

Through our partners, we have successfully planted more than 75,000 coral, spanning a coverage area of 20 acres over the past 8 years. However, more needs to be done and we urgently need your support to arrest the escalating damage to coral reefs and marine biodiversity. 

With this campaign, we aim to accelerate our coral planting efforts. We target to cover 1,000 acres of planted area by end of 2017 by channeling your funding to conservation programs organized by our marine partners.

 

Why The Need To Save The Corals?

Apart from looking pretty underwater, coral reefs are a hugely vital part of the marine ecosystem.

Fun Fact: Coral reefs protect coastlines from the damaging effects of wave action and tropical storms. 

Did you know the Indian Ocean earthquake and Tsunami disasters in 2004 which hit Indonesian shores cost the lives of vast swaths of coral reef. The existence of coral reefs in strategic areas prevented more coastline damage from occurring, particularly in Malaysia and Thailand. This came at the expense of coral reefs which were horribly damaged in the process!

Coral reefs provide habitats and shelter for many marine organisms

Save Nemo! A diverse range of marine life species call these coral reefs home, giving natural communities survival options when environmental conditions and climates change. The destruction of coral reefs poses a great threat to species for which there is limited diversity. The logic is simple: the destruction of coral reefs contributes to the destruction of marine life which then provides the catalyst for structural disruptions to the global ecosystem.

 

The Impact

Damaged corals are salvaged and rehabilitated at our onshore conservation sites.

 

Through our in-house proprietary methodologies, fully rehabilitated and mature corals are planted at critical coral-reef zones to sustain and grow existing ecosystems.

 

Our planting methods have allowed coral reefs to thrive within our planting zones. Empirical evidence suggests that marine life population have grown more than 5 fold around our zones. Our marine biologists have confirmed increased sightings of marine life such as coral-cat sharks, hawksbill sea turtle, barracudas, yellowback fusiliers and bigeye trevallys.

 

Global (particularly in Asian cultures) consumption of turtle eggs, sharks meat and sharks fin soup are still widespread despite increasing scrutiny and campaigns against these actions. Our facilities are equipped to incubate the breeding of young turtles and sharks which are eventually released into their natural habitats upon reaching a certain level of maturity.

 

Limitation & Challenges

The Living Corals Initiative will be focusing on sustainability programs at our three conservation sites within the Island of Borneo, Sabah Malaysia. With the success of this campaign, we will expand our conservation reach to other highly critical areas around the world.

Marine and coral conservation activities are highly labor intensive and require significant amounts of marine science know-how. Your contributions will go a long way into into funding the working capital required for our operations and developing the technical expertise for our continuous improvement.

 

How You Can Help

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to seed this movement. In addition to funding our initiatives, we appreciate if you could spread the message about our campaign through channels such as:

  • Social media i.e. Facebook, LinkedIn, Weibo
  • Email, to as least five of your friends
  • Twitter, use the hashtag #livingcoralsinitiative

story:
Be part of the Green Building Revolution! Support us (This Cob House) as we establish a school of Earthen Building and construct our exemplary earthen home prototypes which will inspire and equip people all around the world to: construct buildings with a smaller ecological footprint, save the forests, and create a global impact by taking care of our health and the harmony of our planet. Your funds will help us secure the land we need to keep growing and to continue contributing to conscious architectural design and a better world for our generations to come.

We’re building freedom. One home at a time!

In the Great Smoky Mountains of northern Georgia, we plan to build our school to serve our community of students and builders in the United States, and to everyone around the world through our online learning resources.

Our school will act as a center of learning for how to construct buildings out of earthen materials such as: cob, rammed earth, and adobe. We will also teach a variety of other natural and conventional building methods as supplements. Its our belief that we should combine traditional and natural building materials with modern building materials, where most appropriate, in order to achieve the highest quality structures.

Once the school’s infrastructure is established, we will also offer classes on permaculture, food gardening, sustainable energy systems, and holistic health.

Our difference is not in what we teach, but how we teach it. We combine the best of both worlds. Both traditional and modern materials.

The school will offer experienced-based education through hands-on workshops. Our students’ imaginations and creativity will be stimulated through learning which will propel them to communicate, solve problems, and collaborate for the improvement of their lives and their communities. We will also offer a significant portion of our learning materials through online media for international students who can’t travel to the school.

We will offer living examples of modern, high quality, and code-friendly earthen buildings to meet the expectations of the general American populace and allow the way for these materials to enter the mainstream as an accessible option for normal construction. Eventually, we hope to contribute to the development of an official building code for cob (a traditional earth building material) in the United States.

We are committed to the architectural revolution in earth construction. But at the same time, we are committed to cleaning up and preserving our natural environment. These two missions go hand in hand in working together.

Today, many people are striving to cut down on carbon emissions, and we are starting to see the environmental impact of our destructive activities on the planet. We are also seeing the detrimental effects that deforestation is having.

The global tree count has fallen by 46% since the dawn of human civilization
-  TIME Magazine

Deforestation is when trees are chopped down to clear a forest so the land can be used for other purposes. The trees can eventually grow back, but at the rate we’re cutting them down, they can’t grow fast enough. Tropical deforestation is the 2nd biggest contributor to climate change. Tropical rain forests store more than 210 gigatons of carbon and deforestation is the cause of 15% of carbon emissions.

Wood-frame walls have been the predominant choice for houses in the United States for more than three centuries. People cut down 15 billion trees each year. Much of it used for building lumber.

In 2014 alone, 574,000 wood framed single-family houses were completed in the United States.

The typical 2,400 square foot, single-family home requires about 16,000 board feet of framing lumber and over 14,000 square feet of other wood products including plywood, oriented strand board, glulam beams, wood I-joists, laminated veneer lumber, hardboard, particleboard and medium-density fiberboard.

A board foot is a standard measure of the usable wood in a tree. You can picture a board foot as a piece of lumber one-inch thick, one foot wide, and one foot long (1" x 12" x 12").

So what does that mean in number of trees? That would mean almost 22 mature pines are needed to fill the demand for an average home.

Not only are wood framed homes being built by the hundreds of thousands each year in the United States alone, but typically around 200,000 to 300,000 homes are demolished each year as they become unlivable.

Wood framed homes usually only last a generation, whereas earthen homes can last hundreds of years if generally maintained and they don’t use nearly as much wood. Earthen buildings can use 50%-75% less wood than conventional stick-framed buildings. That could be at least 6 million trees saved each year just for the United States.

Earthen building materials have proven the architectural tests of time, they are better for the environment, and they promote a non-toxic living environment.

Green factors of earthen building

  • Energy efficiency. Thermal mass heating and cooling with earth materials, natural indoor humidity regulation, and the use of passive solar design can reduce energy consumption.
  • Sustainability. The main resources used to build the structure (subsoil, sand, fiber, and water) can be produced and attained on a sustainable basis.
  • Local building requirements. Areas prone to hurricanes or earthquakes, for example, may have specific rules to help structures withstand extreme natural events that affect specific areas of the country. Earthen buildings, when constructed properly, can withstand these events quite well. More research needs to be done at this point though.
  • Durability and initial cost. The expected lifespan of an earthen building can be much longer than a conventional stick-frame building. Initial cost of materials can also be lower. This means less money and materials are spent over time. Less deconstruction and rebuilding have to occur as well.
  • Combined functions. Wall systems that combine structure with finish have an inherent material efficiency advantage and should be seriously considered. Earthen walls generally need less finishing materials placed over them. This saves on wood finishes, polymers, and other materials.

Its time to introduce earth as a building material to the modern world.

Our school will prepare and motivate students to go back and share what they’ve learned with their local communities.

Not only will we be able to continue to offer low prices for classes. But if we can establish the school infrastructure with low overhead costs, we will also be able to offer classes for free to local schools and the less fortunate. And if students would like to become teachers and builders themselves in this area, we will also be able to provide business education for new startups and entrepreneurs.

Until now, we (This Cob House, LLC) have been entirely funded by class tuitions and book sales, and by the support of generous members in the community. We have been in business educating about cob and Natural Building for 4 years, and we are now ready to open our doors to an influx of new students with your support.

We’re ready to build a working model for the future. Our educational workshops are ready to triple in numbers, but we just need to create the space for this to happen in.

Additional funds are needed to purchase some acres of land, build school infrastructure, and to construct our first code-approved earthen buildings.

Cob Guest House

Rammed Earth House

This Cob House, LLC, our students, and our supporters are committed to building a unique place of learning in order to serve the world with the skills of earthen construction methods and sustainable systems.

Our Indiegogo campaign goal of $100,000 will help us reach our Phase One funding requirements. If we can raise more than $100,000 here, then GREAT! We aim to have the school open for students by April 2017. After that, we aim to reach our Phase Two goal of $200,000 in order to build a permanent classroom for students and to purchase some heavy machinery. Our Phase Three goal of $250,000 will be for a two-story Georgian-style home constructed with rammed earth (all code-approved).

Your financial support – small or large - could ensure that the target is met.

The heart that gives, gathers.
-  Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

Donations over $100 will be recognized with their names engraved on our school’s adobe block “Wall of Supporters”. These hand crafted adobe blocks represent the building blocks contributed by our supporters who make the vision of our school a reality. The proposed “Wall of Supporters” will become a stunning representation of the support from students, friends, and our global community.

It will showcase the depth of support our school has received and its visual impact will make everyone proud of what we’ve been able to build together. It’s a step toward helping restore Nature and to be more responsible with how we treat the environment. And of course we get some amazing building technology for our future!

The perks offered are listed on the right column of the page. 

Every individual has the ability to make a difference in the world. Your support to our school will show how true this can be. Together, we can have a future where we are conscious of our use of natural resources and we can become proper stewards to nature and our planet.

Your support will contribute to a future with:

  • Increased use of earth as a building material
  • A decrease of toxic materials used in common household building materials
  • A decrease in deforestation by less demand for lumber

Your support will carry these benefits:

  • We can hold many state of the art educational workshops each year
  • We can offer free learning opportunities to the disadvantaged, and to children
  • We can contribute to an official building code for cob in the United States
  • We can continue to provide free knowledge and services to our thousands of online followers
  • We can continue to produce new cutting edge educational video courses and DVDs
  • We will be able to offer classes on gardening, permaculture, homesteading, and healthy living
  • We will be able to continue to offer some of the lowest workshop prices
  • Students will be able to experience living in cob/earthen buildings during their workshop stay
  • We will have potential national TV show production opportunities. We can reach a much bigger audience this way to promote earthen building in a good light.
  • We will be able to create jobs for other Natural Builders

We need your support. Even if you are unable to contribute a financial donation, you can still help us:

  • Please share our vision! Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Act now and use the Indiegogo share tools to let your social circles, your tribes, your friends, and your families know about the important mission we are driving forward.

story:
Hello, my name is Mihai Alexandru (you can call me Mitza) and I would like to talk to you about a sustainability project called Perma Bârsoiu.

Once upon a time on the sunny hills of rural Romania a small permaculture project  was born. And now it’s time for it to grow.

We are a few friends that are passionate about growing plants in the most harmonious, natural and clean way, without artificial fertilizers in order to keep the soil’s natural balance.

Up to 40% of the world’s agriculture land is being rendered unusable due to intensive, uncaring agricultural practices. We want to change that.

Unfortunately it is no longer possible to continue the project on the current plot of land as there are issues with the land ownership and lacking legal paperwork for it (this is specific to many rural areas of Romania) so we need to transfer  the project on another piece of land or it will have to end very soon.

We have found a beautiful  and suitable property in the same village of Bârsoiu, Vâlcea County, Romania which is 5,200 square meters (56,000 sq ft) of workable land, a house, a big barn and a summer kitchen.

We want to acquire this land in order to be able to continue and expand the project by applying for funds from NGOs, Norvegian or European Union grants dedicated to supporting permaculture.

The cost is 8,500 euros, out of which through some generous donations we managed to acquire 2,500, needing 6,000 more or $8,000.

Our principal aims are

  • Doing our part to heal the land broken by traditional agriculture
  •  Creating and supporting a community of like-minded people around this project
  •  Giving healthy foodto as many people as possible
  • Offering an alternative way of life to the big city/corporate lifestyle
  • Teaching the techniques of permaculture to many

Making a profit comes a distant second.

What you get out of it

  • The knowledge that you’re contributing to helping our planet
  • The possibility of learning permaculture - free for donors
  • Fresh and healthy produce if you do visit - free for donors
  • A serene place to come and relax when you need to get away from a bit – free for donors

You can see the current project and a small part of our produce in the picture.  If interested, you can find more at https://permabarsoiu.ro/ (it’s only in Romanian though) and our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/PermaBarsoiu/

Contact me any time on facebook, my profile is https://www.facebook.com/alexandru.mihaialin.1
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Mihai Alexandru (you can call me Mitza) and I would like to talk to you about a sustainability project called Perma Bârsoiu.Once upon a time on the sunny hills of rural Romania a small permaculture project  was born. And now it’s time for it to grow.We are a few friends that are passionate about growing plants in the most harmonious, natural and clean way, without artificial fertilizers in order to keep the soil’s natural balance.Up to 40% of the world’s agriculture land is being rendered unusable due to intensive, uncaring agricultural practices. We want to change that.Unfortunately it is no longer possible to continue the project on the current plot of land as there are issues with the land ownership and lacking legal paperwork for it (this is specific to many rural areas of Romania) so we need to transfer  the project on another piece of land or it will have to end very soon.We have found a beautiful  and suitable property in the same village of Bârsoiu, Vâlcea County, Romania which is 5,200 square meters (56,000 sq ft) of workable land, a house, a big barn and a summer kitchen.We want to acquire this land in order to be able to continue and expand the project by applying for funds from NGOs, Norvegian or European Union grants dedicated to supporting permaculture.The cost is 8,500 euros, out of which through some generous donations we managed to acquire 2,500, needing 6,000 more or $8,000.Our principal aims are
Doing our part to heal the land broken by traditional agriculture
 Creating and supporting a community of like-minded people around this project
 Giving healthy foodto as many people as possible
Offering an alternative way of life to the big city/corporate lifestyle
Teaching the techniques of permaculture to many
Making a profit comes a distant second.What you get out of it
The knowledge that you’re contributing to helping our planet
The possibility of learning permaculture - free for donors

Fresh and healthy produce if you do visit - free for donors

A serene place to come and relax when you need to get away from a bit – free for donors

You can see the current project and a small part of our produce in the picture.  If interested, you can find more at https://permabarsoiu.ro/ (it’s only in Romanian though) and our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/PermaBarsoiu/Contact me any time on facebook, my profile is https://www.facebook.com/alexandru.mihaialin.1

story:
Chi Siamo...

Siamo un gruppo di ragazzi, profondamente innamorati della loro terra che da un po' di anni, tentano di contribuire e determinare, secondo le nostre risorse e possibilità, sviluppo etico e sociale, abitudine alla bellezza come presupposto imprescindibile del futuro sviluppo regionale.

Vogliamo...

L'organizzazione di un grande Festival dedicato all'Ambiente che focalizzerà l'attenzione di media, cittadini e politica sulla questione ambientale, accelerando il processo di sensibilizzazione e le opportunità di investimento in infrastrutture di bonifica, schemi urbanistici funzionali alla conformazione dei territori, un settore turistico più innovativo nelle idea e sostenibile nelle azioni.

Il festival è ideato per garantire la necessaria armonia tra arte, divertimento e la divulgazione del messaggio di protezione e amore nei confronti della terra che calpestiamo, del mare nel quale nuotiamo e dell'aria che respiriamo.   

Perchè?

La tutela dell'Ambiente e la progressiva ricostruzione di un'etica orientata alla difesa del territorio si configura come questione centrale per il rilancio economico e sociale, trasformando ciò che la natura generosamente ci ha donato in produzione di ricchezza e benessere collettivo e diffuso.

 

AIUTACI A SALVARE LA BELLEZZA CHE OGNUNO DI NOI POSSIEDE:

LA VERA RIVOLUZIONE... E' FARLO DIVERTENDOSI!

story:
Detaljno o predloženom:

www.csv-pula.com

Aktualnu i relevantnu dokumentaciju pogledajte ovdje (http://bit.ly/2dkO1NK):

Sve počinje od povezanih idejnih projekta koje bi ovime tek trebalo učiniti, stoga:

Zbog čega su 100 Kn ($15) dobar ulog?

  • Jer omogućavaju konstruktivnu ulogu građana Pule u dijalogu lokalne i državne uprave kao neizostavne treće strane
  • Jer građanima grada Pule pružaju priliku da napuštenoj vojnoj zoni daju društveno prihvatljiv sadržaj
  • Jer omogućavaju povećanje prihodovne strane javnog bazena čime se rješava želja građana za olimpijskim bazenom
  • Jer arhitekatima daje slobodne ruke da naprave pravi posao
  • Jer projekt javnog bazena ovime postaje pokretačka investicija a ne trošak
  • Jer u projekt uključuje i ostale sportove na vodi u njihovoj borbi za mjesto koje zaslužuju u društvu
  • Jer projekt javnog bazena ovime pokreće razvoj zelenog prstena kao temelja gradske luke

www.csv-pula.com

U slučaju nedovoljno prikupljenih sredstava sve se uplate vraćaju uplatiteljima!

(puno više o Crowdfunding-u može se naći na internetskim tražilicama)

Više ilustracija na:  www.csv-pula.com

 

Lista povezanih projekata u okruženja:

  1. Centar sportova na vodi
  2. Integracija cesta i biciklističko-pješačke prometnice gradske luke
  3. Iskorištenje postojeće željezničke pruge u prigradskom povezivanju uz mogućnost centralne gradske garaže korištenjem kamenoloma Vidrijan
  4. Pješački mostovi/palube za nesmetan protok osoba i vozila užom gradskom rivom
  5. Funkcionalna mogućnost apliciranja BI Uljanik kao kulturnog dobra Grada u posao putničkog terminala za kružna putovanja (uz nesmetani nastavak poslovanja brodogradilišta).
  6. Panoramski gradski Hotel visoke kategorije "Monte Grande" uz pripadajuće okolne sadržaje
  7. "Gastro Mundus Histria" kao mogućnost očuvanja kamenom građenih vojnih skladišta kao vrijednog dokumenta vremena Grada Pule
  8. Zasebni ribarski terminal

 

***

***

***

***

***

***

***

***

***

Dokument za ispis preuzmite ovdje

story:
Organizer: “Giant Steps”/visit our website: www.thegiantsteps.org/
CGS project:
1 footprint = 39 circles made up of plants, shrubs and trees
dimensions: 1560m long and 720m wide
circle: 60m in diameter
location: Fazenda Barreiros - Pernambuco – Caatinga - Brazil
achievement: in late December, early January - 2020/2021

 

_________________________________________________________________________________

 
_________________________________________________________________________________
 

 

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

 
_________________________________________________________________________________

 

Our story

The goal of the CGS project is to revive an entire region which has huge potential, but is repeatedly hit by drought due to deforestation. Long term human mismanagement is the cause of this situation and it is now our duty to ensure water returns to Caatinga.

This is why we are going to set up an agroforest predestined to grow bigger and bigger.

We believe that the participation of people from several indigenous ethnic groups in the realization of our project will also strongly motivate others to follow this imprint. Indeed, in the beginning our plantation will be in the form of a footprint. This symbol brings us to reflect on the imprint that our everyday actions leave behind us…The Caatinga Giant Steps project will be implemented as a living entity and will therefore become a constantly growing imprint.    

                                                                                                                                                                                          Caatinga is a magical place just waiting to blossom once again!

_________________________________________________________________________________

Nossa história

 

O objetivo do projeto Passo Gigante da Caatinga é fazer reviver uma região que possui um imenso potencial, mas que é frequentemente atingida pela seca devido ao desmatamento. Muito tempo de má gestão humana é a causa da atual situação mas agora é nosso dever fazer a água retornar para a Caatinga.

Por isso nos vamos reconstruir a agrofloresta que será predestinada a crescer cada vez mais.

Nos acreditamos que a participação dos povos provenientes de várias etnias indígenas no nosso projeto será também fortemente motivadora para outros seguirem nosso trabalho de reflorestamento, nossa pegada. De fato, o começo da plantação será na forma de uma pegada. Este símbolo nos leva a refletir sobre a impressão que nossas ações cotidianas deixam para trás. O projeto “Passo Gigante da Caatinga” será implementado como uma entidade viva e, portanto, vai se tornar uma crescente marca.

Caatinga é um lugar mágico apenas esperando para florescer outra vez.

_________________________________________________________________________________

Team:

Our Caatinga team was formed during the realization of the project Giant Steps in Roraima in Amazonia. We grouped together on a nowadays rather unusual principle: mutual trust. And it worked!!! This is why we continue together and have every good reason to think that we will succeed again ...!                                                                                                                                                              Since we started working on the Caatinga project, our team considerably expanded.

For the creation of the giant footprint in Caatinga, our team will be assisted by people from a wide variety of backgrounds ( cowboys, artists, farmers, university researchers, musicians, minstrels, journalists, filmmakers, photographers, translators, historians, etc.) and ethnicities: Atikum, Baniwa, Fulni-ô, Kiriri, Makuxi, Pankara, Pankararé, Pankararu, Pipipa, Trukà, Tukano, Tuxà, Quilombolas: Catolé, Luanda and Mirandiba.

Professor Martinho Carvalho, in addition to being a professor at the Federal Rural University of Pernambuco, coordinates the CRad - Reference Center for the recovery of degraded areas in the Caatinga Biome, also connected to the university's activities. Among his activities at CRad, is the research and development of forest recovery models, in particular the study of animals from the Caatinga biome that contribute decisively to the propagation and germination of seeds.

__________________________________________________________________________________

 

Equipe:

 

Nossa equipe Caatinga foi formada durante a realização do projeto Pegada Gigante em Roraima na Amazônia.  Nos agruparemos agora sob um novo princípio: mútua confiança. Isto funcionou!!! Este é o porque nós continuamos juntos e temos boas razões para pensar que nós teremos sucesso outra vez…!

Desde que nós começamos a trabalhar no projeto Caatinga, nossa equipe vem crescendo consideravelmente.

 

 Para a criação da pegada gigante na caatinga, nossa equipe será assistida por povos de várias origens étnicas, culturais (sertanejos, artistas, fazendeiros, pesquisadores da universidade, músicos, repentistas, jornalistas, cineastas, fotógrafos, tradutores, historiadores, etc.) e etnias: Atikum, Baniwa,  Fulni-ô, Kiriri, Makuxi, Pankara, Pankararé, Pankararu, Pipipa, Truká, Tukano, Tuxá, Quilombolas: Catolé, Luanda e Mirandiba.

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

Claim:

We are passionate about this project, but it is something we cannot do alone.  Our biggest hurdle right now is covering the operating costs of this giant project.

As a contributor, you will help carry this project into the future, so thank you all for your support! The satisfaction that comes with solidarity is yours, for it is thanks to your contribution that this project was able to succeed!

Every step we make, every word, every move, every thought ... will leave a mark in the universe.

 

 

 

Créditos:

Nós somos apaixonados por este projeto, mas é algo que não podemos fazer sozinhos. Nosso maior obstáculo é cobrir os custos operacionais deste grande projeto.

Como um apoiador, você poderá ajudar a levar este projeto para o futuro, então agradecemos imensamente por todo o seu apoio! É com grande satisfação que recebemos sua solidariedade e contribuição pois o sucesso de nosso projeto depende dela.

Cada passo que damos, cada palavra, cada movimento, cada pensamento … deixará sua marca no universo. 

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

Thank you!

We are passionate about this project, but it is something we cannot do alone.  Our biggest hurdle right now is covering the operating costs of this giant project. As a contributor, you will help carry this project into the future, so thank you all for your support! Whether you can donate or not, please help us spread the word about this campaign.

 

Obrigado!

Somos apaixonados por esse projeto, mas é algo que não poderemos realizar sozinhos. Nosso maior obstáculo, agora, é cobrir alguns custos operacionais desse projeto gigante. Como colaborador, você ajudará a fazer desse projeto algo real num futuro próximo. Agradecemos a todos pelo apoio! Independente de doar ou não, ajude-nos a espalhar a notícia sobre esta campanha.
