story:
Hello, my name is Maria Eugenia Ossa López and I want to present to you a family project, which consists of empowering 165 families in the northeaster Colombia in the cultivation of special organic coffee. We wish to train the community of village “Monjas”, located in Oiba Santander, providing them with the necessary tools to develop an agriculture that is clean, sustainable, profitable and friendly to the environment.



In 2015, I decided to take a leave from my job in the city to go to Santander to find my family, a family that my mother left in the village of Monjas when she was only 12 years old to look for better opportunities in the city of Cali. What I found in the village, after a lot of research, was that all of her siblings were alive, and they were working with coffee. We got to meet and together we decided to start working together. My mother also came to see her long lost family and this is why we are calling the project “The Reunion”.


 From what we saw of the conditions of the soil, and later tests that we took, we noticed that years of chemicals had worn out the once fertile earth and that it was not worth it to grow coffee in this way anymore. The work it requires is just not worth it when the pay barely covers daily expenses.



This is why we contacted  Jairo Restrepo and Daniel Agredo España to see if we could make the village a place of hope and development, a village where the soil is healthy and the agriculture is organic. And in this way regenerating the soil and bring back all the youth that have left the village in order to look for work in the cities. 



We are working on this project as a family, with my daughter, my mother, my uncles and aunts. We also have a team of profecionals helping us. We would like to present to you the other members of the team:



Daniel Agredo España

Environment Administrator and external consultant with experience in organic agriculture of all  types of plants, establishing bio-factories and working on the organic farm La Pachita in Jamundi, Colombia. Co-author of the new edition of “The ABC of Organic Agriculture” along with Jairo Restrepo Rivera and “Chromatography, images of Life and Destruction of Soil”. He is currently writing the “Production Manual of Organic Vegetales and Urban Gardens”. He works with different workshops in Colombia, Ecuador and Italy. Internship in the Gaia Laboratories in Michuacan, Mexico, along with Ignacio “Nacho”Jesus Zamora, working with microbiology. Internship in Costa Rica working with Juan José Paniagua on the organic farm “Land of Dreams”. Writing of the brochure of The Phenology of Organic Coffee based on the experience with the community of Oiba Santander.



Jairo Restrepo Rivera

More than 35 years of international work experience in organic agriculture and sustainable development. He has published more than 15 books about organic agriculture amongst them “The ABC of Organic Agriculture”, “Chromatography, Images of Life and Destruction of Soil; The Moon Book" and the it´s Influence in the Tropics”. Jairo gives courses in organic agriculture internationally and also follows up agricultural projects in the local communities all over the world. He is soon to launch the sequel to "The ABC of Organic Argriculture".

 


Carlos Amortegui

His connection to coffee started early when he grew up in the Coffee Triangle of Colombia. Since then he has acquired an education within tasting, roasting and managing coffee and he is now running a business in Norway where he imports and roasts organic coffeebeans from selected farms in Colombia, Africa and Latin-America. From many years of coorperation with Jairo Restrepo he has embraced the techniques and philosophy of organic agriculture and is always putting the people and nature before profit. 

 

 With the support of family and friends, the training and education from Jairo Restrepo, the partnership with “Orgánicos Pachita” lead by Daniel Agredo España and consultancies from the Carlos Amortegui from Norway, we aim to rescue a village from destruction in the hands of the agrochemicals.

 

Coffee with consequences

Convencional agriculture with poison in the form of agrochemicals has caused great costs as a result of health problems, destruction of the climate and the soil along with social injustice. In Colombia and other countries that produce our coffee and food we see how the fertile earth is dying and the living standard of the local communities are destroyed by agrochemicals, corruption, bad politics from politicians that are nothing but puppets for the multinational companies, the agroindustry and the pharmaceutical industry, forces that usually operate out of the richest countries. For Norway and Europe this means that what we consume of coffee and food is full of poison and we are also part of financing the destruction of the village and the misery of the farmers that are producing what we are importing.

 

Sustainable solutions

Organic agriculture is an understanding of life as a system where all the members depends on each other. Our principals are respect and dignity for all life on the planet. With this perspective as a foundation we now wish to increase the consciousness of the local community here in Colombia in order to raise their standards of living and at the same time the quality of the products we import in Norway. By facilitating organic cultivation of coffee and other products on our farm, along with training and courses for the local community, we wish to contribute to making the farming fair, healthy and without chemicals.

 

We are also planning to open a school for young entrepreneurs in the village, where we can train youth and farmers in the area so that they comprehend the important transition from tradicional farming to organic agriculture without agrochemicals. We wish to share the cleaner and healthier options to the methods they are using at the moment which are destroying the soil and the health of people and the nature. The bio-factory will be a big part of this change, giving us clean fertilizer to regenerate the soil as well as forming a source of income for the farmers.

 

We have designed a project that consists of three phases:

 

  1. The transformation of the family farm into a training center for farmers in the area.

 

2.     Establishing the biofactory where we will train the local community in prosessing of local materials to make bio-fertilizers as an alternative to agrochemicals. 

3.     Follow-up and advise in the transition from traditional coffee crops cultivated with agrochemicals to special organic coffee by the use chromatographic analyses which we will apply on soil, leaves and fruits.

 

To eliminate the use of agrochemicals is a demanding process, both practically and socially, as the local community only knows this way of farming and in most cases are forced by big companies to keep doing things this way. The transition process is also expencive, especially in the beginning. For this reason we are asking for your help to be able to support the local community in this transition and later be able to offer a healtier and more fair coffee to our clients abroad. Here you can see how we are planning to use our funds in order to accomplish our goals in this project:

 

FASE 1 EXPANDING THE FAMILY FARM TO FUNCTION AS A CAPACITATION CENTER

FASE 2 ESTABLISHING A BIO-FACTORY

 

1

 

 

2.1

2.2

2.3

2.4

2.5

2.6

2.7

Other ways of supporting the project

If you wish to be a part of this agricultural revolution, but do not have the economy to contribute, we are also grateful if you can share the project on social media or talk to friends that you think might be interested in what we are doing. In the future we are also offering trips to visit the village, the farm and the people behind the project.

The people are, after all, the ones that will enjoy the benefits of this life-changing project are many and, along with the Earth itself, we will all be most grateful for any contribution that you can spare. Together we can make a change. Thank you.
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Maria Eugenia Ossa López and I want to present to you a family project, which consists of empowering 165 families in the northeaster Colombia in the cultivation of special organic coffee. We wish to train the community of village “Monjas”, located in Oiba Santander, providing them with the necessary tools to develop an agriculture that is clean, sustainable, profitable and friendly to the environment.In 2015, I decided to take a leave from my job in the city to go to Santander to find my family, a family that my mother left in the village of Monjas when she was only 12 years old to look for better opportunities in the city of Cali. What I found in the village, after a lot of research, was that all of her siblings were alive, and they were working with coffee. We got to meet and together we decided to start working together. My mother also came to see her long lost family and this is why we are calling the project “The Reunion”. From what we saw of the conditions of the soil, and later tests that we took, we noticed that years of chemicals had worn out the once fertile earth and that it was not worth it to grow coffee in this way anymore. The work it requires is just not worth it when the pay barely covers daily expenses.This is why we contacted  Jairo Restrepo and Daniel Agredo España to see if we could make the village a place of hope and development, a village where the soil is healthy and the agriculture is organic. And in this way regenerating the soil and bring back all the youth that have left the village in order to look for work in the cities. We are working on this project as a family, with my daughter, my mother, my uncles and aunts. We also have a team of profecionals helping us. We would like to present to you the other members of the team:Daniel Agredo EspañaEnvironment Administrator and external consultant with experience in organic agriculture of all  types of plants, establishing bio-factories and working on the organic farm La Pachita in Jamundi, Colombia. Co-author of the new edition of “The ABC of Organic Agriculture” along with Jairo Restrepo Rivera and “Chromatography, images of Life and Destruction of Soil”. He is currently writing the “Production Manual of Organic Vegetales and Urban Gardens”. He works with different workshops in Colombia, Ecuador and Italy. Internship in the Gaia Laboratories in Michuacan, Mexico, along with Ignacio “Nacho”Jesus Zamora, working with microbiology. Internship in Costa Rica working with Juan José Paniagua on the organic farm “Land of Dreams”. Writing of the brochure of The Phenology of Organic Coffee based on the experience with the community of Oiba Santander.Jairo Restrepo RiveraMore than 35 years of international work experience in organic agriculture and sustainable development. He has published more than 15 books about organic agriculture amongst them “The ABC of Organic Agriculture”, “Chromatography, Images of Life and Destruction of Soil; The Moon Book" and the it´s Influence in the Tropics”. Jairo gives courses in organic agriculture internationally and also follows up agricultural projects in the local communities all over the world. He is soon to launch the sequel to "The ABC of Organic Argriculture". Carlos AmorteguiHis connection to coffee started early when he grew up in the Coffee Triangle of Colombia. Since then he has acquired an education within tasting, roasting and managing coffee and he is now running a business in Norway where he imports and roasts organic coffeebeans from selected farms in Colombia, Africa and Latin-America. From many years of coorperation with Jairo Restrepo he has embraced the techniques and philosophy of organic agriculture and is always putting the people and nature before profit.   With the support of family and friends, the training and education from Jairo Restrepo, the partnership with “Orgánicos Pachita” lead by Daniel Agredo España and consultancies from the Carlos Amortegui from Norway, we aim to rescue a village from destruction in the hands of the agrochemicals. Coffee with consequencesConvencional agriculture with poison in the form of agrochemicals has caused great costs as a result of health problems, destruction of the climate and the soil along with social injustice. In Colombia and other countries that produce our coffee and food we see how the fertile earth is dying and the living standard of the local communities are destroyed by agrochemicals, corruption, bad politics from politicians that are nothing but puppets for the multinational companies, the agroindustry and the pharmaceutical industry, forces that usually operate out of the richest countries. For Norway and Europe this means that what we consume of coffee and food is full of poison and we are also part of financing the destruction of the village and the misery of the farmers that are producing what we are importing. Sustainable solutionsOrganic agriculture is an understanding of life as a system where all the members depends on each other. Our principals are respect and dignity for all life on the planet. With this perspective as a foundation we now wish to increase the consciousness of the local community here in Colombia in order to raise their standards of living and at the same time the quality of the products we import in Norway. By facilitating organic cultivation of coffee and other products on our farm, along with training and courses for the local community, we wish to contribute to making the farming fair, healthy and without chemicals. We are also planning to open a school for young entrepreneurs in the village, where we can train youth and farmers in the area so that they comprehend the important transition from tradicional farming to organic agriculture without agrochemicals. We wish to share the cleaner and healthier options to the methods they are using at the moment which are destroying the soil and the health of people and the nature. The bio-factory will be a big part of this change, giving us clean fertilizer to regenerate the soil as well as forming a source of income for the farmers. We have designed a project that consists of three phases: The transformation of the family farm into a training center for farmers in the area. 2.     Establishing the biofactory where we will train the local community in prosessing of local materials to make bio-fertilizers as an alternative to agrochemicals. 3.     Follow-up and advise in the transition from traditional coffee crops cultivated with agrochemicals to special organic coffee by the use chromatographic analyses which we will apply on soil, leaves and fruits. To eliminate the use of agrochemicals is a demanding process, both practically and socially, as the local community only knows this way of farming and in most cases are forced by big companies to keep doing things this way. The transition process is also expencive, especially in the beginning. For this reason we are asking for your help to be able to support the local community in this transition and later be able to offer a healtier and more fair coffee to our clients abroad. Here you can see how we are planning to use our funds in order to accomplish our goals in this project: 

FASE 1 EXPANDING THE FAMILY FARM TO FUNCTION AS A CAPACITATION CENTER
FASE 2 ESTABLISHING A BIO-FACTORY

Together we can make a change. Thank you.

story:
"We live in a defining moment in history — a moment where the international community has come together to agree on an ambitious framework to resolve some of the world’s most daunting challenges. Today, 95% of plastic packaging material valued at over $100 billion annually, is lost to the economy after a short first use, pollute our nature, which will create huge problems for the future generation." H. E. Mogens Lykketoft  We want to contribute and change this!

Executive Summary

We at Open Packaging Network have built a new digital ecosystem for the packaging industry.  A Circular Economy Solution for both packaging manufacturers and brands across the globe. We have served more than 800 companies to date.

Now we are ready to revise the whole packaging material lifecycle with a new initiative called FULL CYCLE. A cutting-edge software that offers a revolutionary solution in the packaging waste management approach. Transform packaging materials from a product into a service and rethink the traditional life cycle of raw materials. Such an approach suggests the formation of a new sharing economy within the packaging industry. In which the manufacturer doesn’t sell packaging material definitely, but leases and then tracks the supply chain of its entire life cycle via sophisticated technology. 

This is all possible thanks to accumulated experience, a skilled team and thorough data flow.

The FULL CYCLE innovative project moves the packaging industry into a positive spiral of value, stronger economics, and better environmental outcomes. In this way, manufacturers assume responsibilities for the reuse of waste and have an elevated interest in getting the after-use packaging materials back from consumers as a raw material for future production cycles.

We invite you to invest with us on this timely opportunity.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We plan on raising an initial $815 000 for the next 12 months of the development and implementation process. Backers deploy capital and contribute through donations inline with the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals and becoming a catalyst for positive climate change and a new zero waste society.

Consumers will receive free access to a sophisticated web and mobile app to allow FULL CYCLE to be successful. This will contribute positively to the planet and humankind in the long run. The platform will be based on a sustainable packaging waste management mechanism in which every participant of the packaging life cycle contributes to its reuse in a circular, zero-waste production cycle. 

 

The Impact

Consumers may benefit from such an innovative system in many ways: 

  •  Reduced price of products due to minimized materials costs
  •  Eco-friendly involvement
  •  Lesson carbon footprint by improving sustainability
  •  Be a part of a revolutionary solution within the packaging manufacturing process
  • Tackle Climate Change

Manufacturers can benefit from:

  • Doing business responsibly
  • Accelerate transition to Circular Economy
  • Implement a zero-waste production cycle
  • Increase their use of sustainable materials in production of packaging
  • Connect with consumers via individualized packaging solutions

 

The Process

1. Consumer:

Input requested data about the used packaging, based on location, into the FULL CYCLE system through scanned QR labels of businesses supporting the FULL CYCLE initiative. This contributes to full transparency of all packaging waste locations and stages of reuse in the circular economy. 

2. Manufacturers, Converters or Resellers

Input data via unique identifiers in the FULL CYCLE system- packaging that remains immutable across all stages of the materials’ use and reuse. In this way, all manufacturers can track the location and condition of their materials via the FULL CYCLE app by using those unique identifiers. This system guarantees effective location of after-use packaging and prevention of its disposal into landfills or oceans.  

3. Recycling Companies

Register in the FULL CYCLE system to be added to the global map of facilities to ensure of recycled packaging waste. Gain access to deposits of packaging waste mapped by users in their location or become manufacturer service partner. 

 

The Time Is NOW

Sustainable change doesn’t happen overnight. It’s a process of integration. We refer to this process as Sustainable Development Goals and propose a new approach and action plan to get there. Now is the time for implementation. We must begin to practise what we have preached. Changing our production and consumption patterns in order to create virtuous cycles rather than depletive ones. Harnessing the global interconnectedness, communications technology and breakthroughs in materials science, we are now one step closer to a greener future!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially to our campaign there are still other ways you can help!

Share this campaign - we would love for you to spread information about our campaign...

Follow us across our social media platforms and please share the information posted to reach a wider audience. 

LinkedIn: Open Packaging Network

Instagram: @OPN_Platform

Twitter: @OpenPackaginNet

Facebook: Open Packaging Network

Youtube: Open Packaging Network

Join our newsletter and visit our website to gain monthly information on how you can help on our journey to lesson our carbon footprint and change the way we do packaging!

story:
To Donate Biodegradable Face Shields. 

I believe in creating change that's sustainable, and through that change being exemplary.

Being an environmentalist at heart,  I see the amount of waste created by the use of personal protection equipment during the Covid-19 crisis.  There are millions of masks, shields, gowns, face shields, gloves etc that are used and disposed of, in the millions daily, to be incinerated or dumped into landfills.  This only adds to the burden of an already existing problem of global waste and environmental pollution.

What I want to create is a Biodegradable version of the Face Shield, and donate to First Responders and Frontline Healthcare Workers. 

I hope through my project to equip Frontline Healthcare Workers with much needed face shields, as well as educate everyone about the options we have at our disposal that reduces the impact on our environment. 

The US$2 donation is mainly for the purchase of PLA sheets, cutting and shaping of the shields, the trims and assembly and finally the packaging so it reaches the destination in a manner that is fit for purpose. 

The donations are for the hardest hit locations in the USA, namely New York, Chicago and Los Angeles.

If I manage to reach the funding required, I will post pictures and documentation of the recipients and donations. 

The Total Value Shown is in HK$. The amount im trying to Raise is US$200,000 (conversion rate of US$1.00 = HK$7.80) 

Your funds will be returned if the campaign cannot reach its desired amount to start off the project and you will receive your money back within 5 days of termination of campaign.

story: Protecting our environment is vital to ensuring our future as a species. While government agencies like the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) exist to create public policy regarding climate change, greenhouse gas emissions, pollution, and clean water, nonprofit organizations work to address issues like the preserving land, protecting endangered specifies, supporting sustainable agriculture, and encouraging environmentalism in the community through activities like planting community gardens. Mightycause is the top environmental fundraising platform, with over 1,000 nonprofit organizations and charitable fundraisers raising money for the environment on our platform. Learn how to use Mightycause to fundraise for a brighter future!

story:
We at TreeLife believe that there is more that can be done in the battle to save our planet.

Currently, we rely on governments to take action to conserve our environment and counteract global warming - an issue which is not at the top of every politician's agenda. However, we believe that if given the opportunity, many of us will be willing to take action and become part of the solution to this global problem.

That's why we created TreeLife.

TreeLife is a brand new platform that allows you to calculate your carbon footprint, and then pick and choose what parts of your lifestyle you would like to offset. 

Our calculator includes a comprehensive breakdown of many of the day-to-day activities which contribute towards your carbon footprint. For clarity, we have divided these into 5 main categories: Transportation, Flights, Dietary Lifestyle, Energy at Home and Technology.

Up to now, we have developed a website with a smart carbon calculator. In order to build an accurate model, we have based our algorithms on reputable scientific papers and references. We have also developed a user-friendly interface where anyone can pick and choose which aspects of their lifestyles they would like to offset. Check it out!

www.treelife.co

 

 

At TreeLife, we offset your carbon footprint through our uniquely devised strategy. Our platform allows you to purchase CO2 that will be permanently stored in trees, until the same amount of CO2 is offset by another renewable source. Unlike other tree planting organisations, we promise to indefinitely store the purchased amount of CO2. When a tree dies, it releases CO2 back into the environment . In this event, TreeLife plants a new tree in it's place; hence the CO2 allocated to a purchase will always be conserved. 

A more detailed outline of our operation is described below: 

i) Land Acquisition

The land is acquired directly and also by contracted leases with respective land owners. 

The acquisition process is carried out by taking into consideration a number of factors, such as the conservation of natural habitats and indigenous species.

It is worth noting that some environmental companies may base their conservation services on plots of land which are already protected by government. At TreeLife we only work with land that is unprotected by such authorities, and hence, which is vulnerable to exploitation.  

ii) Planting trees 

By employing local communities, not only will be doing something good for the environment but also creating local jobs.

Plant species will be dependent on the chemistry of the soil, the local climate and other environmental factors. However, we will only grow trees having long life spans and which are beneficial to the overall ecosystem (i.e. non-invasive).  We will also attempt to grow local species with a view to reclaiming forest and rain-forest land. 

iii) Maintenance of the trees 

Personnel from local communities will be hired to protect and maintain the trees, in order to ensure healthy growth and to allow wildlife to thrive.  

Our promise of storing the CO2 permanently will require replacement of dead trees. Hence the health and status of the tree will be moinitored on a regular basis. 

Our scheme and operations are fully transparent, and we ensure this by means of the following actions:

a) We will open our sites to universities and research institutions in order to conduct any ecological and environmental research work or studies.

b) Every quarter, we will provide a quantitative statement showing the CO2 that has been stored in the trees grown. This will make it easy and straightforward for people to track the progress of the overall project.

In order to launch TreeLife we need your help. We have self funded the project so far, but we require £32,000 to get this idea off the ground. This is the minimum amount we need in order to acquire the land and make our service commercially available. However if we can raise more, our end product will be cheaper and our operations, bigger!

As three friends, we wanted to make a positive difference to our planet and offset our carbon footprint, but couldn’t find an easy way to go about it. That's why we felt it necessary to launch this campaign. 

Mark and Jozerd, two of the founding members of TreeLife, began discussing the possibility of launching a CO2 offsetting platform whilst reading for their Master’s degree in Energy Technologies at the University of Cambridge.

The idea is to provide a new, universal platform that allows individuals and businesses to easily offset their carbon footprint and make a positive difference to our shared environment – but it’s more than that! We also want to support environmental research, and further educate the importance of living in a sustainable world.

We at TreeLife realise that not everyone will be able to contribute to our campaign - however you can still participate if you, like us, believe that this platform can help make a real difference to our environment and help counteract climate change. 

The reason that we have put our time and money into this project is simply because we believe that TreeLife can be a real force for good in today's world. So anything you can do to positively impact our shared environment would be greatly appreciated. If TreeLife does nothing else, then making people aware and more informed about the issue of climate change would at least be a step in the right direction. 

Please share our page with everyone in order to get the word out there and help TreeLife reach its full potential!

a) We will open our sites to universities and research institutions in order to conduct any ecological and environmental research work or studies.
b) Every quarter, we will provide a quantitative statement showing the CO2 that has been stored in the trees grown. This will make it easy and straightforward for people to track the progress of the overall project.

In order to launch TreeLife we need your help. We have self funded the project so far, but we require £32,000 to get this idea off the ground. This is the minimum amount we need in order to acquire the land and make our service commercially available. However if we can raise more, our end product will be cheaper and our operations, bigger!

As three friends, we wanted to make a positive difference to our planet and offset our carbon footprint, but couldn’t find an easy way to go about it. That's why we felt it necessary to launch this campaign. 
Mark and Jozerd, two of the founding members of TreeLife, began discussing the possibility of launching a CO2 offsetting platform whilst reading for their Master’s degree in Energy Technologies at the University of Cambridge.
The idea is to provide a new, universal platform that allows individuals and businesses to easily offset their carbon footprint and make a positive difference to our shared environment – but it’s more than that! We also want to support environmental research, and further educate the importance of living in a sustainable world.

We at TreeLife realise that not everyone will be able to contribute to our campaign - however you can still participate if you, like us, believe that this platform can help make a real difference to our environment and help counteract climate change. 
The reason that we have put our time and money into this project is simply because we believe that TreeLife can be a real force for good in today's world. So anything you can do to positively impact our shared environment would be greatly appreciated. If TreeLife does nothing else, then making people aware and more informed about the issue of climate change would at least be a step in the right direction. 
Please share our page with everyone in order to get the word out there and help TreeLife reach its full potential!

story:
Short Summary

Shot in Colombia, Brazil, USA, Dubai, France, Spain, UK, Germany, Austria, Italy, Albania, Russia, Kazakhstan, Nepal, Malaysia and Singapore, this album speaks about the complexity, diversity and the true value of ecosystems. Professionally designed, this book will be published to the highest standard by the main partners of Thames and Hudson and Phaidon, National Geographic and Aperture.

Environment Europe is a sustainability think tank based in Oxford. It has been instrumental in providing cutting-edge research and education in sustainability, the programme of executive Summer and Winter Schools in Ecological Economics has been attended by participants from 54 different countries, including Canada, USA, Mexico, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Brazil, Colombia, Peru, Argentina, UK, France, Germany, Austria, Switzeland, Spain, Italy, Malta, Portugal, Belgium, the Netherlands, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Denmark, Sweden, Iceland, Norway, Serbia, Bosnia, Croatia, Albania, Latvia, Ghana, Nigeria, Jordan, Lebanon, Sri Lanka, China, India, Bhutan, Taiwan, Thailand, Philippines, Australia and New Zealand. The participants of our programmes included representatives of UNEP, UNDP, ILO, WWF, OECD, IUCN, European Commission, GGGI, GIZ, government departments, companies and leading universities.

We are aiming to raise £10000 to allow our audience to pre-order 'ECOSYSTEMS', a beautiful coffee-table photo album that will communicate the beauty, unique functions and diversity of world's ecosystems and illustrate a simple idea that we entirely depend on the ecosystems and the natural world and that money cannot be a measuring rod to assess its value..

The book has already been produced and a tall white ship will bring the first 500 copies to the UK in five weeks time. It is already listed on Amazon: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Ecosystems-Complexity-diversity-contribution-humanity/dp/1999624106

What We Need & What You Get

The £10000 we seek will go towards covering the cost of producing the first 500 copies of the album, many of which will be distributed in universities, libraries and NGOs all around the world.

The following packages are available:

£99 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request);

£499 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of the book, 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request) plus a 60x40cm framed print on paper of any of the images from the book (you will be able to communicate your wish after receiving your copy). Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website.

£999 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of the book, 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request) plus a museum quality 60x40cm print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website ;

£4999 This exclusive package will entitle you to one copy of 'Ecosystems', signed by the author, plus a 180x120cm museum quality unique print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website in a special section.

The Impact

Our project is hugely valuable to the world because ecosystems are under threat, half of the world's biodiversity has been lost according to WWF in the past 40 years. The photographer, Dr Stanislav Shmelev has worked for the International Union for Conservation of Nature and proposed a new way to assess ecosystems and biodiversity using multi-criteria tools.  This book will illustrate the multiple dimensions of what ecosystems 'do', from oxygen production to water purification, production of food, generation of soils, carbon sequestration and pollination but also inspiration for artists and cultural and educational values.

Dr Stanislav Shmelev (stanislav.photography) is an award-winning photographer and ecological economist and has been leading Environment Europe since its foundation in 2004. He is the author and editor of bestselling books, 'Ecological Economics: Sustainability in Practice' (Springer, 2012): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9789400719712 and 'Green Economy Reader' (Springer, 2017): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9783319389172. Dr Shmelev exhibited his photography in Austria, Dubai, Germany, Peru, Russia, Spain and the UK at venues, which include the United Nations, Global Landscapes Forum, Royal College of Art, Price Galitzine Library, Brighton Photo Biennial, Fotonoviembre de Tenerife, Format, St Ives Arts Club, Debut Contemporary, O3 Gallery etc.

The endorsements from the leading environmentalists the 'Ecosystems' photobook received already include:

“The great challenge of our time is to build and nurture human communities that honor, respect, and cooperate with nature’s inherent ability to sustain life. To do so, it is critical to understand how ecosystems work — not only intellectually, but also emotionally and spiritually. Artists have an essential role to play to foster such deep, multidimensional understanding, and Stanislav Shmelev’s magnificent book succeeds admirably in this task.” — Prof. Fritjof Capra, author, The Tao of Physics (1975), The Web of Life (1996), The Hidden Connections (2002), Learning from Leonardo (2007), coauthor, The Systems View of Life (2014).

“Our life depends on our ability to protect the home, which so generously hosts us. We should all contribute to our best. Sharing the captured moments of intrinsic beauty is certainly one of the most effective ways to raise awareness”, Janez Potočnik, former European Commissioner for the Environment, co-chair of the International Resources Panel, UN Environment.

“Stanislav Shmelev displays consummate skill in combining both art and science to produce his exquisite and captivating photo album, describing the essence of sustainability.” Prof. Mohan Munasinghe, Vice Chair of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC-AR4), joint recipient of the 2007 Nobel Prize for Peace.

“The great challenge of our time is to build and nurture human communities that honor, respect, and cooperate with nature’s inherent ability to sustain life. To do so, it is critical to understand how ecosystems work — not only intellectually, but also emotionally and spiritually. Artists have an essential role to play to foster such deep, multidimensional understanding, and Stanislav Shmelev’s magnificent book succeeds admirably in this task.” — Prof. Fritjof Capra, author, The Tao of Physics (1975), The Web of Life (1996), The Hidden Connections (2002), Learning from Leonardo (2007), coauthor, The Systems View of Life (2014).

“It is essential for us to appreciate not only the beauty of Nature but also its critical life-support services to our planet and to all of its inhabitants. This book inspires us to a deeper understanding of our important responsibilities to protect, restore and nurture ecosystems so that they can continue to provide us with the comforts we cannot take for granted.”

JULIA MARTON-LEFEVRE, Former Director General, International Union for Conservation of Nature; Edward P Bass Distinguished Visiting Environmental Scholar, Yale Institute for Biospheric Studies, Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies

“A wonderful and colourful journey through our planet’s varied ecosystems and the multiple services they provided us with on a daily basis, and a great reminder of the key need of environmental stewardship in today’s world.”

BERNARD COMBES, Information Officer, UNESCO Education for Sustainable Development

“This stunning array of images well illustrates nature’s aesthetic value and its intrinsic value too”. Prof. Robin Attfield, Professor of Philosophy, Cardiff University.

“Visualizing ecosystem services is perhaps the most effective way of popularizing this important concept”, Prof. Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker, PhD, Co-President, The Club of Rome.

“In this book Stanislav Shmelev, an ecological economist and an artist, goes far beyond the environmental social sciences and even the environmental humanities by appealing through photography to the incommensurable values that humans hold towards the environment”, Prof. Joan Martinez-Alier, Autonomous University of Barcelona, Past President of the International Society for Ecological Economics;

‘Ecosystems’ by Stanislav Shmelev takes us through a journey of ecosystem services. Captured by a lens of a remarkable artist, who is also an expert, the colourful details bring to life the text describing the links between sustainability and the ecology surrounding us. As a Colombian, I enjoyed the clear message from wilderness to the scent of a cup of coffee generously provided by nature.” Prof. Juan Armando Sánchez, Professor of Biological Sciencies, Universidad de los Andes, Bogota, Colombia;

“This splendid collection exhibits an amazing rainbow of colours in scenes from around the globe, expressing the photographer’s profound concern for the state of the Earth, while also celebrating the intense and astonishing exuberance of human and biological diversity in some of the world’s most beautiful ecosystems. Shmelev’s inspired structure leads us along a carefully selected series of contexts and themes, showing clearly the importance of maintaining the stability and productivity of natural processes through global and local commitment for planetary survival in the face of global change”, Prof. Peter H. May, PhD, Professor of Ecological Economics, Federal Rural University of Rio de Janeiro.

“This is an outstanding collection of photographs. Stanislav’s wonderful and imaginative book and sensuous photographs show how the economy is entirely a subsidiary of the environment. Stanislav has created a miracle, read this book, look at these photographs and you will be invited to celebrate our deep connection with the natural world.”

SATISH KUMAR, Editor Emeritus of Resurgence & Ecologist Magazine and founder of Schumacher College


The Mathematical Institute of Oxford University will host a big ECOSYSTEMS exhibition in November this year (10-30 November 2018).

Environment Europe is a think tank, a research centre and a non-governmental institution based in Oxford, UK. It focuses on conducting research in macroeconomic sustainability, sustainable cities, renewable energy, ecosystems and biodiversity and sustainable waste management, consulting international organizations, governments, regions and companies and runs a successful educational programme of Summer and Winter Schools in Green Economy, Ecological Economics, Sustainable Cities and Ecosystems and the Economy. Environment Europe keeps an active presence and runs projects all around the world and reached out to participants and speakers from 53 countries through its executive education programme: Canada, USA, Mexico, Costa Rica, Peru, Colombia, Argentina, Brazil, Iceland, UK, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, the Netherlands, Belgium, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Latvia, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Croatia, Serbia, Albania, Morocco, Ghana, Nigeria, China, Jordan, Lebanon, India, Sri Lanka, Bhutan, Thailand, Taiwan, Kazakhstan, Russia, Philippines, Papua New Guinea, Australia and New Zealand.

 

Risks & Challenges

We have already finished book design, for which I am very grateful to the University of Reading and the BA in Book Design, and especially to designers Rebecca Burlow and Charlotte Ham.

An ISBN number has already been assigned to the book.

The books have been printed and are being shipped to the UK as we speak. It will take them 5 weeks to arrive.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you could help, which includes sharing this campaign and information about the book: https://www.facebook.com/EnvironmentEurope/ and our Summer, Winter and Spring Schools on social media: Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn .

You can always use Indiegogo share tools to repost this campaign so more people could see it! If you cannot order a book, donate £1 and comment, this will help us to get to the front page. Spread a word!

story:
Short Summary

We are working to revitalize a neglected piece of property into a state of the art Eco friendly recycling center.  Garbage is one of the biggest contributors to pollution worldwide and we are on a mission to develop a facility dedicated 100% to recycling various materials.  We have the property and all required permits already which are the hard part.  Big problem is the facility was leased to a company that went into bankruptcy and left the site full of their debris.  Plan is to revitalize the property and roll out different processes for recycling of various materials. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are working towards cleaning the facility as well as catching up on property taxes to create a full cycle green Eco friendly recycling facility. In addition to those two major reasons for the campaign we will do our part to find ways to reuse every items we have coming into the facility.  Our first major development plan will be equipment that can recycle asphalt shingles and tires.  

The Impact

This is a great way to contribute to the good of the earth and start a new trend in the recycling industry.  Our goal is to greatly reduce the amount of things that hit landfills by finding new ways to process and recycle these materials.  We are out to prove that our planet is all we have and we can take all of the garbage we produce and turn it into something we can use again and again

story:
Summary

 

Dear Supporters, Philanthropist & Good people,

 Stay SafeKeep you and your family safe

We hope you and your family and loved ones are all fine, and we hope to always find you fine.

 

  • Let me introduce myself: MOHAMED ALI SAMAH A very ambitious young farmer, Specialist completion of large irrigation facilities.
  • I was inspired to work in agriculture while I was in semi-remote areas, so I started my career as an amateur. Now I am looking for more, The rest is in the story.......!

 

  • My campaign or project, our project aims to revive healthy agriculture free of toxins, chemical fertilizers and genetically modified seeds, Before you contribute to our project, before you ask me why all this attention, ask yourself if what you eat is healthy?
  • I will answer you, no, 90% of what people eat worldwide is carcinogenic, genetically modified seeds that are able to alter human genes and cause birth defects, Chemical fertilizers have a negative impact on the underground, especially the underground water in the long run, pesticides and herbicides are toxic and very dangerous to the environment and human health, and their effect will not appear immediately after their use.
  • Therefore, I decided to create a project aimed at eliminating agriculture harmful to the environment, the world, human health, and animals, It's not easy, but I trusted Indigo and yesterday I was involved in several campaigns like you and now I am running a campaign for a project to save the world, It is not easy because I am alone, but by simply mobilizing the largest number of wonderful society we can be active people in society and the world.
  • Do not worry about the world, the environment, the continuity since you are a contributor to my campaign, do not worry about your money since the rewards are available, you only need to think, before buying something from the store such as a phone, perfume, shirt .... etc. Take a look at my campaign if  What you intend to buy was available to me, so you better contribute with me.
  • This is easy for you, contribute to my campaign, save the world, create jobs, we will help the needy, you will get a wonderful reward, I contact with companies to provide you with luxury products, clothing phones, perfumes and many surprises.
  • With your contribution, you will help us a lot in giving the project a good start or an easy birth, You will save the whole world, keep your food and many people healthy.

  • We care about the whole world, environment, health, humanity, animals, continuity.., We really need someone to care about us, If you contribute, you are our hero, you are involved in preserving the world and continuity.

  • Finally, I would like to thank you in advance as I'm the owner of the project and on behalf of all the farmers, We trust you, We love you.

    We are also looking to help people COVID-19 RELIEF 

     

    #people helping people

     

    Sincerely,

     

    MOHAMED ALI SAMAH~♥

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We haven't determined the exact amount of funding, but compared to the rewards that we give you, it will be the amount of 3 million successful matches for us.
  • We will spend the financing money to success our project from failure, compensation for some farmers who participated with us and put their trust in us, rent the fields, buy agricultural equipment, buy or manufacture 100% organic fertilizers, seeds, irrigation systems, greenhouses,  Workers' expenses, plowing and tractor, Tractor accessories, storage warehouse, etc.
  • Our perks for you will be more than wonderful, Elegant Shoes and clothing from major companies, Luxury Fragrances, Smartphones at the time of their launch, iPhone, Samsung, LG .. We will be on commitments.
  • Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still be earmarked for fulfilling the perks, Each contributor will get its perk.

The Impact

 

      ▪Your contributions to this project will change the course of environmental conservation and human health in the right way, If your food is healthy and free of toxins, you will not get sick and there is no need to visit a doctor.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

 

  • Like all projects, there are obstacles, but we take the necessary precautions to overcome all these obstacles thanks to the availability of professional farmers, in addition to obtaining financing from good people who care about us and the world, Risks are almost non-existent.
  • The only challenge we face is getting financing for our project, and since we are in a wonderful community we hope to share the same ideas.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • We understand the difficult stage the world is going through, and for this some good people who want to contribute and cannot, do not worry, Once you share the link with friends and family, you help spread the goodness, make some noise about our campaign, be active and effective in the community.
  • Remember to always use INDIEGOGO sharing tools!

We thank you in advance, Stay Safe!

Therefore, I decided to create a project aimed at eliminating agriculture harmful to the environment, the world, human health, and animals, It's not easy, but I trusted Indigo and yesterday I was involved in several campaigns like you and now I am running a campaign for a project to save the world, It is not easy because I am alone, but by simply mobilizing the largest number of wonderful society we can be active people in society and the world.
Do not worry about the world, the environment, the continuity since you are a contributor to my campaign, do not worry about your money since the rewards are available, you only need to think, before buying something from the store such as a phone, perfume, shirt .... etc. Take a look at my campaign if  What you intend to buy was available to me, so you better contribute with me.
This is easy for you, contribute to my campaign, save the world, create jobs, we will help the needy, you will get a wonderful reward, I contact with companies to provide you with luxury products, clothing phones, perfumes and many surprises.
With your contribution, you will help us a lot in giving the project a good start or an easy birth, You will save the whole world, keep your food and many people healthy.
We care about the whole world, environment, health, humanity, animals, continuity.., We really need someone to care about us, If you contribute, you are our hero, you are involved in preserving the world and continuity.

Finally, I would like to thank you in advance as I'm the owner of the project and on behalf of all the farmers, We trust you, We love you.
We are also looking to help people COVID-19 RELIEF 
 
#people helping people
 
Sincerely,
 
MOHAMED ALI SAMAH~♥


 
 

What We Need & What You Get
 

We haven't determined the exact amount of funding, but compared to the rewards that we give you, it will be the amount of 3 million successful matches for us.
We will spend the financing money to success our project from failure, compensation for some farmers who participated with us and put their trust in us, rent the fields, buy agricultural equipment, buy or manufacture 100% organic fertilizers, seeds, irrigation systems, greenhouses,  Workers' expenses, plowing and tractor, Tractor accessories, storage warehouse, etc.
Our perks for you will be more than wonderful, Elegant Shoes and clothing from major companies, Luxury Fragrances, Smartphones at the time of their launch, iPhone, Samsung, LG .. We will be on commitments.
Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the money will still be earmarked for fulfilling the perks, Each contributor will get its perk.


The Impact
 
      ▪Your contributions to this project will change the course of environmental conservation and human health in the right way, If your food is healthy and free of toxins, you will not get sick and there is no need to visit a doctor.

Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.
 

Like all projects, there are obstacles, but we take the necessary precautions to overcome all these obstacles thanks to the availability of professional farmers, in addition to obtaining financing from good people who care about us and the world, Risks are almost non-existent.
The only challenge we face is getting financing for our project, and since we are in a wonderful community we hope to share the same ideas.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
We understand the difficult stage the world is going through, and for this some good people who want to contribute and cannot, do not worry, Once you share the link with friends and family, you help spread the goodness, make some noise about our campaign, be active and effective in the community.
Remember to always use INDIEGOGO sharing tools!

We thank you in advance, Stay Safe!

story:
The goal is to find healing through participatory action research while living with and contributing to the communities. What I offer in exchange is more than money, I am inviting you to witness and be on this journey with me, you will have the opportunity to dive into the process of transformation and spiritual development in community living, as well as become part of raising awareness internationally about the importance of preserving the indigenous communities that are under threat.

I am deeply grateful to the experiences that led to this project, they opened me to the world as a whole and offered me prodigious sense of belonging to humanity rather than one geographical region. I found myself useful to serve humankind and the earth in such ways that I could find meaning and inspiration. Therefore, I feel a profound need to give back whilst discovering the ancient indigenous knowledge with therapeutic potential of shamanic diets and master healers.  I am offering my skill, experience, outreach and most importantly myself as a research subject. The research will start in the November of 2019 and will potentially continue for 18 months. 

With the community permissions am going to develop a thorough on-line presence of my project through daily live updates from the community life on Instagram, as well as keep a detailed diary blog, both of these will become the main resource for my research and are currently under construction. Yet the most exciting product is series of short documentaries, that I am planning to work on the go. I will be able to talk about community benefit more when I find hosts and have a change to understand what they need from their perspective as well.

The budget for the trip is around $8,000 USD see the cost breakdown below (not including Indiegogo fees), the trip will be built depending on the raised amount. ANY FUNDS RAISED ON TOP OF THIS, WILL BE DONATED DIRECTLY BACK TO THE COMMUNITY NEEDS.

Read more about the struggles of indigenous people in Amazon.

***

Hi all! Thank you for giving your time to this crowdfunding campaign! 

My name is Hamida, 27 and I am a practicing Peace & Conflict worker from Baku, Azerbaijan with a thorough training in holistic approaches to peace and considerable experience in human rights advocacy. Majority of my career I have been occupied with understanding the importance of self-regulating intentional communities across the globe and the potential it has for the societies of the modern world, as well as designing spaces for multi-format dialogues within and between societies. Great deal of my training and practice originates from the context of Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict and UNESCO Chair for Peace Studies MA  Program at the University of Innsbruck, Austria. Currently, I work with Imagine Center for Conflict Transformation where I lead the initiatives in Azerbaijan as well as offer services of independent facilitator, trainer and consultant. Imagine is very special for me in particular because I believe that, structures forming communities has potential for healthy and inclusive coexistence.

I am from a small Post-Soviet country situated on a shore of Caspian Sea at the feet of Great Caucasus mountains. For about 30 years now the region I am from have been involved into violent conflicts due to various political and not reasons. Since I am 18 I have been invested into peaceful transformation of the societies living in this authentically beautiful and diverse area, which included not only reconciliation of conflict-torn societies, yet also profound activism in the areas of human rights, social healing, environment,  and gender. However beyond all of these strong words I find it crucial to dig deeper into reasons why chose peacebuilding. 

 In order to understand my motivation of learning from Amazon communities, it would be a huge overlook not to mention all the personal incentives of why I have been following these themes for so long and how I see this journey as indispensable for my healing. As much as I look happy on all of the pictures, I have been struggling with heavy depression connected to several PTSDs followed by continuous physical and emotional abuse, discrimination, assault, harassment, suicide and rape attempt for most of my life. In some of the cases my family members have been the reason for these painful experiences, in some, the society transitioning from authoritative communism to a new form of  statehood followed by a wave of nationalism and traumas of war. 

Peacebuilding have not been just a career for me, over these years it became my life, my therapy, which extended beyond my own ego, into the community I wanted to belong without forcing myself to adjust. Thanks to everything I experienced through my work, by the age of 27 I have learned to prevent the traumatic events and survival patterns from manipulating my life, now I own the experience not vice versa. Yet above all, I am grateful for it opened me to the world as a whole and offered me prodigious sense of  belonging to humanity rather than one geographical region, where I found myself useful to serve humankind and the earth in such ways that I could find meaning and inspiration. A great example of this phenomena is my volunteering experience during Syrian refugee crisis where I used to provide humanitarian aid at a small camp in Austria.

For my transformational journey I own a big deal of gratitude to MA Program in Peace Studies at the University of Innsbruck where I was introduced to the concept of holistic peace, that integrates the knowledge of many ancient philosophies and traditions across the world. I have started learning through many different experiences of healing via altered state of consciousness, for instance Holotropic Breathwork, 5Rhythms Dance, Quantum Light Breath, Shamanic journeys etc., which in its turn have bestowed mental, emotional, and spiritual development for myself. After my masters I have had a chance to spend 8 months on several organic vegetable farms in Virginia and Maryland, USA. Before this experience I have never thought on a serious basis how significant and most importantly how physically hard and unappreciated farming is, I have spent probably one of the most challenging 8 months of my life on this soil in a team of wonderful people, so dedicated to and in love with nature and environment.

Picking potatoes at Potomac Vegetable Farms 2016. 

While I was living in a small forest tree house,  listening to cicadas mating at nights, and breaking down my body over caring after the fruits the fertile soil was ceaselessly producing during the day, an obscure bond with the earth was germinating inside of me. I found out later during an intensely healing Ayahuasca retreat from an intentional community Amoraleza in Spain, that it was the connection to the great mother of all with its unconditional divine love. It is exactly when I knew I have to go to the Amazon forest and serve it for it has given me the greatest gifts of all, self-love. It has given me the healing, which years of drugs and therapy would not. I see an exceptional purpose in the call that I have and I wish the community that I am reaching out to support me in my purpose and maybe, just maybe I will find more healing for myself and more people in this challenged world we have today. 

Hopefully with the help of the universe, I am planning to visit several communities across the Amazon, where I can live and work along with the indigenous people, that are taking care of the forest and follow the traditions of Shamanism. I am trained in Basic Universal Shamanism, Indigenous survival techniques, and Universal spiritual Practices, so in a sense I feel like I have the basics for the journey. I want to learn the ancient knowledge that will result in a research, as well as unfold my true self more than ever. I don’t have any money to fulfill this dream therefore I am looking for support from all over the world. I am planning to start my journey already this November, but I will continuously crowdfund so I can build the trip on the go. Please see the budget for the trip below if you are wondering how I am planning to spend the gathered sources. 

Plan of the trip 

Since my nationality offers me certain limitations on my journey, I am building my plan according to the travel and visa regulations of the Amazon states. In case I will find a way to legally stay longer I will certainly take the opportunity to engage with community life on continuous basis.

Brazil 3-6 Months (travel visa 3 months, renewable); Bolivia 3 Months (maximum); Ecuador 3 Months (maximum); Colombia 3-6 Months (travel visa 3 months, renewable) .

Be aware that any funds raised on the top of the goal will be donated to the community needs. I frankly do not know what future holds for me, I am preparing myself for anything. For example if I will manage to crowdfund only for one trip I will visit one community and stay there as much as possible, and the remaining funds will be donated. I promise to update the donating community on a constant basis, sharing the life in Amazon as much as possible through variety of social media platforms, which also means raising the awareness and advocacy about the local issues.

Skills I am offering

Here is brief overview of most relevant skills and training I have gathered throughout these years, which I am offering to the communities upon their need including some reference: 

Networking, Campaigning, Advocacy, Conflict Resolution and Conflict Transformation, Non formal Education, Confidence and Capacity building; Monitoring Assemblies  (OSCE/ODIHR), Human Rights (Council of Europe), Video and Photo Journalism, Film Directing  (Internews Azerbaijan), Political Analysis and Risk Assessment (Peace Brigades International), Sustainable Development and Permaculture (Potomac Vegetable Farms), Conflict specific First Aid and Immediate life-saving measures (Austrian Red Cross); Peace Support Operations, Security Awareness, Negotiation Techniques, Coordination and Organization of small field units, Stress management, Public and Press Relations, Humanitarian Aid Delivery (Austrian Armed Forces Military Command of the Tyrol), Water Rescue (Tyrolean Water Rescue Team).

Current Stage and Needs

Currently I am establishing contacts at my first destination in Brazil and slowly learning Portuguese. Before I leave for such a tough journey, I am also planning to take several months of Aikido course in order to straighten my self defense skills. I am in a big need for promotion support and PR strategy for finding potential investors as well as building the audience for the project.

 I really hope I will be able to make this journey happen and invest my soul into the people of our planet’s only functional lungs. Please feel free to contact me over my campaign e-mail florestasagrada2019@gmail.com if you have any more questions, or concerns, or suggestions on destinations and communities to visit, seriously any help is very much appreciated. 

Thank you for everything no matter who you are. 

Here is a short multimedia story where you can read more about me and work the Imagine Center does in English on Chai-Khana.  

And an article in Azerbaijani on Meydan TV

story:
There is more to life than increasing your speed and productivity.

If you want to find a balance with life, we must learn to go at it speed

To work with nature to allow it to blossom the abundance it provides us

There is a great deal you can learn from nature.

The lessons are all around us.  From the smallest of bamboo leaves

to the largest trees in the rainforest; they are all great teachers.

When we talk about climate change, we act like the change is going to come from external forces

So we focus on external reasons as to why we cannot enact change.

 but our teachers in nature show us this change will come from within.

Just as a tree in nature, pulls CO2 and turns it into life from within

The answer to Carbon emissions is to grow the plants that sequester this carbon.

And nothing pulls carbon out of the air faster than bamboo. 

Bamboo can be used in any form of building material and we can grow 8 times the weight of itself within the life span of one piece.  One stalk can contain as much as 51kg of carbon and grow to maturity in 4 years. 

We have an idea.  To use what we have learned from nature by adapting fluidly

To the changes the environment presents to us.  Like a bee absorbing pollen from different flowers, let us use what we need, and discard what no longer serves us, then add what is uniquely your own.

Like a Bamboo pole, the change will come from within.

For every $10 in donations, we will plant a bamboo tree in a favorable eco-diverse area. 

Each plant has the potential to sequester as much as 10 tons of carbon within 10 years time. 

Our $5k goal with this campaign is to sequester and hold in treated bamboo as much as 5000 tons of carbon pulled from the air. 

About Mae:

We are one of Costa Rica’s first bamboo treatment facilities, and it is our job to grow sustainable building materials for construction, erosion prevention, and carbon sequestration.  Our natural process of treating bamboo is now faster than ever.  We now process in 1 day what once took 6 months to produce.  With our advancements in treating, bamboo has become a viable hardwood and building alternative to convention materials because it last just as long and we can offer it at the same price or less.  Support our cause as we believe that this simple shift in building materials to something sustainable can have a huge global impact on cleaning up the emissions we are releasing into the environment every day.

Nature has given us a way to reverse our mistakes.  Now is the time to learn from those mistakes and begin offering future generations the chance to explore the natural world the same way we have grown up to enjoy it ourselves. 

Help our cause.  Make a difference, stand with us:  We are going to #takeTheCarbonBack

story:
As a qualified environmental scientist, I am accustomed to using fancy words which are often in latin or whose definitions are as long as a short paragraph!  It’s another language!  Yet, this does not put me off my path as a permaculture educator.  I believe there is GREAT value in bridging the gap between the “layman” & the scientific community.  I also believe that the only true way to meaningful Earth care – is through ecological communal movements (such as what “permaculture” inspires). 

 

My campaign is simple…it is to raise half of the fees needed, just AU$600 - to attend a course, which will provide me the skills I need to become an effective & engaging group facilitator.  The second half is being donated via the Noosa Forest Retreat permaculture community.  I thank them for their continued support & belief in me.

 

The course is facilitated by Robin Clayfield, who is professional and globally experienced.  Robin is the “go-to” person for people in dire need of assistance such as myself!  My aim with this campaign, is to attend Robin's "Dynamic Groups" course at Crystal Waters (the world's first permaculture community).  I feel extremely fortunate to have this relatively local opportunity as it is not often that Robin is in Australia due to high demand worldwide.

 

Check it out, here:

http://permaculturenoosa.com.au/event/dynamic-groups-dynamic-learning-course-16th-to-21st-october/

 

Your contribution will enable not just myself, but each and every-one of the students who I teach, to live with true conscious awareness:

EARTH CARE, PEOPLE CARE, FAIR SHARE!!! 

Together, let's be a supportive community of Earth stewards - who bring a safe future into the present moment.  Who create a future for humans, on Planet Earth!

And don't forget to come visit someday and check out how far we have progressed with our communal scientific research facility, planned to provide knowledge, skills & resources to the permaculture community.  And know that YOUR CONTRIBUTION MADE THIS POSSIBLE !!!– helped bridge the gap between community & science!  Be an Earth carer too.  Support this campaign!

 

Don’t forget to share this page with those you feel may be interested or who might simply be curious about what we are doing in our permaculture community gardens.  Sharing the knowledge (and inspiring ideas) is just as important as their successful execution.  It is through new paths that we find the next step. 

 

Thanks for reading & stay inspired!!!
story_txt: As a qualified environmental scientist, I am accustomed to using fancy words which are often in latin or whose definitions are as long as a short paragraph!  It’s another language!  Yet, this does not put me off my path as a permaculture educator.  I believe there is GREAT value in bridging the gap between the “layman” & the scientific community.  I also believe that the only true way to meaningful Earth care – is through ecological communal movements (such as what “permaculture” inspires).  My campaign is simple…it is to raise half of the fees needed, just AU$600 - to attend a course, which will provide me the skills I need to become an effective & engaging group facilitator.  The second half is being donated via the Noosa Forest Retreat permaculture community.  I thank them for their continued support & belief in me. The course is facilitated by Robin Clayfield, who is professional and globally experienced.  Robin is the “go-to” person for people in dire need of assistance such as myself!  My aim with this campaign, is to attend Robin's "Dynamic Groups" course at Crystal Waters (the world's first permaculture community).  I feel extremely fortunate to have this relatively local opportunity as it is not often that Robin is in Australia due to high demand worldwide. Check it out, here:http://permaculturenoosa.com.au/event/dynamic-groups-dynamic-learning-course-16th-to-21st-october/ Your contribution will enable not just myself, but each and every-one of the students who I teach, to live with true conscious awareness:EARTH CARE, PEOPLE CARE, FAIR SHARE!!! Together, let's be a supportive community of Earth stewards - who bring a safe future into the present moment.  Who create a future for humans, on Planet Earth!And don't forget to come visit someday and check out how far we have progressed with our communal scientific research facility, planned to provide knowledge, skills & resources to the permaculture community.  And know that YOUR CONTRIBUTION MADE THIS POSSIBLE !!!– helped bridge the gap between community & science!  Be an Earth carer too.  Support this campaign! Don’t forget to share this page with those you feel may be interested or who might simply be curious about what we are doing in our permaculture community gardens.  Sharing the knowledge (and inspiring ideas) is just as important as their successful execution.  It is through new paths that we find the next step.  Thanks for reading & stay inspired!!!

story:
My name is Mehluli Dube, the founder and Managing Director of Solar Tech Africa. I am also a graduate of the Tony Elumelu Entrepreneurship Programme.

I am looking for US$1,5M exchange for 25% stake in my business.

Solar Tech Africa is a business that operates in Zimbabwe and has been doing solar systems including rooftop and solar water pumps for 15 months now.

Solar Tech Africa has 3 main products namely; Solar Home Stations, solar water pumps and rooftop solar systems.


Solar Water pumps are ideally targeting the farming community in Zimbabwe, that is both peasant and commercial farmers. Zimbabwe has of late suffered from drought which has caused hunger and malnutrition to millions of people especially the rural folk. The dependency on rain by most of the farmers in Zimbabwe leaves them vulnerable when it comes to dry spell during the rainy season.

The ability to draw water from the ground to use as irrigation for their crops is one challenge that people are facing. The big field crops they have are impossible to water using water drawn by hand from their wells. This scenario causes people to go hungry and malnourished and eventually there is increase in poverty. Solar Tech Africa is offering a solution to this problem by introducing Solar leasing, whereby the farmers will pay only $200 towards the installation of a solar water pump. The  farmer will continue paying a rental fee of $100 every month for 5 years. This scenario will help farmers improve the food supply in their homes and in the country and also afford to build surpluses which have always been used for barter trade  or trade of their farm produces to earn money for spending on other home needs and wants. This will solve the problems of hunger, malnutrition and poverty.

The money will be used in this way;

Solar Water Pumps including panels and installation-US$1.2M

Salaries -US$80000

Overheads-$US20000

Utility Vehicles-US$200000

story:
Mission


  • Inserting the Andean Condor in its original habitat in central South America. Agricultural and livestock educate people about the importance of sustaining this new population.
  • Generate a sustainable space for species and biodiversity that contributes to economic activities.

Because Donate?


The Andean Condor is in serious danger of extinction. Whole populations have disappeared. In the center of Argentina, in South America, specifically in the province of Cordoba, its habitat has been greatly reduced.

Erroneously for years, farmers and ranchers fought this animal considering it a threat to their livestock. Today it was found that their presence is vital for biological control because it feeds on the main carriers of the virus Anta rodents and other animals that damage crops.


Our Idea


First Stage:

  • Acquiring a field in Villa Berna, Córdoba, Argentina, to build a breeding farm and insertion of CONDOR in the Calamuchita valley at the foot of the hill Champaqui, the highest of the shut Cordoba.
  • The center will have a set of incubators for breeding and feeding puppets of the hatchlings (no contact with man).

  


  • A school to chat and information about the importance of the Condor open to the community and educational institutions.

Second stage:

Visitor accommodation complex where you can stay and share a few days in contact with nature and mission of the center, participate in the daily activities of complex upbringings and trained in the tasks.


the rewards

story:
Mi az a jég felespohár? 

  • Ezt a részt nem magyaráznánk túl. A jég felespohár egy feles pohár, ami jégből van, azaz, ha megittad belőle a tüskédet, nem marad utána szemét, hanem szépen visszaolvad vízzé a fröccsödben, vagy az anyatermészet lágy ölén. 
  • Lehet láttál vagy használtál is már életedben jégpoharat, nem is ez az újdonság ebben. Hanem az, hogy miként lehet kiváltani akár egy egész fesztiválon az egyszer használatos műanyagot vele. Mi ehhez kérjük a segítséged. 

 

Mire költjük a támogatásodat?

Arra, hogy a Szegedi Ifjúsági Napokon csinálhassunk idén egy fasza kampányt és próbaüzemet, valamint, hogy utána elkezdhessük megalapozni a jégpohár hosszútávú Magyarországi jelenlétét. Azaz pontosan: 

 

1) Jégpohár készítő formák, fagyasztók és egyéb szükséges kellékek beszerzése, előzetes tesztelés, gyártási periódus / kapacitás optimalizálás, emberek betanítása

2) Szükséges hatósági engedélyek beszerzése

3) Próbaüzem fesztiválkörnyezetben (SZIN): 

a) helyszíni kommunikáció (mi ez, miért van, stb.), jégpohár gyűjtő edény kialakítása, stb.

b) gyermekbetegségek, első körös problémák és visszajelzések begyűjtése 

c) videók, fényképek és közvélemény kutatás készítése

4) Fesztivál után: tapasztalatok összegzése, környezeti hatástanulmány elkészítése. 

5) Ipari termelés első lépései (3-6 hónap szervezői munka): 

a) kiajánló elkészítése (SZIN-en szerzett tapasztalatok alapján): vevői elegédettség, környezeti hatástanyulmány értékei, gazdasági adatok. 

b) megfelelő magyar gyártó keresése jégpohárgyártó gép / gépek építésére

c) piac kiépítése (rendezvény és fesztiválszervezők, áruházláncok ..)

 

Miért a közösségi finanszírozás?

  • A környezetvédelem mindig egy furcsa kísérleti ló, amit ugyan mindenki fontosnak tart, meg szupernek, de valahogy pénz az sosincs rá. Egy ideig még voltak pályázatok, amik így-úgy befoltozták ezeket a lukakat, de mára ezek is jobbára elapadtak. 
  • Szóval elegünk lett, hogy az íróasztalnak ötleteljünk és tervezzünk, ezért úgy gondoltuk megpróbáljuk inkább a kezünkbe venni a dolgok irányítását és meghírdetjük itt a dolgot.
  • Nekünk már az is nagy segítség, ha dobsz egy ezrest / ötöst, de nagyon örülünk, ha többet is megengedhetsz magadnak. 

 

És ez hogyan működik?

  • Az ajánlott adományok listájából a jobb oldalon választhatsz és bankkártyával juttathatod el hozzánk a támogatásod. Természetesen, hogyha úgy érzed, az ajánlottnál többet is adhatsz.
  • Az adományodért cserébe ajánlott ajándékot postán fogjuk eljuttatni neked, illetve ha eljössz a SZIN-re, akkor személyesen is átveheted. 
  • Az általunk használt Indiegogo rendszerének sajátosságai miatt a kiírások amerikai dollárban vannak, ám tájékoztatásképpen a forintban értendő körülbelüli  összeget is odaírtunk. Az árfolyam ingadozásai miatt ez azonban valamennyire eltérhet.
  • Többször felmerült kérdésként, úgyhogy: A billing postal code az a lakcímed irányítószáma, ami a bankkal kötött szerződésedben van. a többi elvileg logikus, bár angolul van, de ha nem tudtok valamit kérdezzetek itt az indin keresztül, vagy: mangel.koppany@gmail.com.

 

KÖSZÖNJÜK.
