story:
Meet GroomPal

GroomPal is your pet grooming companion. GroomPal cuts and brushes fur quickly and quietly. No mess left behind! A happy pet, and a happy owner, only with GroomPal!

We love our pets! But, we did not love constantly cleaning up pet hair and spending lots of time and money getting our pets groomed. When we tried grooming our pets at home it was difficult, uncomfortable and made a mess. We created GroomPal to take the hassle out of keeping our furry friends and our home clean. As an added bonus, our pets love it too and we get more bonding time with them.

The innovative features of the GroomPal include:

  • Vacuum-powered grooming allows comfortable, precise trimming at any angle, for all dog breeds. The air-touch technology pulls in the hair when cutting or combing, leaving no mess behind to clean up.
  • Lightweight, sleek design that's comfortable and attractive.
  • Three functional attachments: trimming tool with replaceable blades, brush for regular dog hair maintenance and flat-head vacuum for spot cleaning the home.
  • Four levels of filtration provide 98% clean trimming, brushing and spot-cleaning for a healthier home environment.
  • High capacity vacuum canister with unique compression technology that makes emptying less often and easier.

What does media say about Groompal?

GroomPal, the first vacuum powered dog grooming device, helps dog owners groom their dogs like a pro in the comfort of home, without any mess. Now we can spend more time with our dogs and have fewer pet-hair hassles. ----Yahoo


What’s So Great About GroomPal?

Unlike other clippers or vacuum devices, GroomPal is powered by revolutionary air-touch technology. This innovative turbo-motor driven grooming tool is for all pets and is guaranteed to be mess-free, safe, easy to use, and super efficient. 

Rather than spending $50+ on each grooming session at a pet spa, you will start saving money after only 2 uses with GroomPal. It will be your best investment for your furry friend and your wallet!

GroomPal is designed for all pet breeds with any type of coat. The perfect grooming tool for ALL pets!

How does it work?

Step 1: Attach the grooming tool to the hose.

Step 2: Turn it on.

Step 3: Adjust the speed.

Step 4: Begin grooming.

Step 5: Press the compressor.

Step 6: Open the latch to empty the canister when full.


Done! No mess, a beautiful pet, and a clean home! 

Product Details

GroomPal is an all-in-one grooming solution and comes with three attachments to fit any pet and any grooming style.


GroomPal Community

Bringing the joy of mess-free pet grooming to every pet lover in the world. Enjoy a happy pet and healthy home. Join us!

Join our Groompal pet lover community, members can get tips, advice, share photos, videos,coupons, attend chats and events.Our online community also including pet rescues, shelter and adoption in the future.Join us and help us to build this, a community full of love for pet :)  

                                         >>>>>Click here to Join<<<<<<

Perks

【Great! Get GroomPal Pet Massage brush limited edition for free now!】

Now If you buy one GroomPal and share our Indiegogo Campaign with some recommend comment via social media (Facebook, twitter and so on), you will get one Get GroomPal Pet Massage brush limited edition for free. Just share the campaigns URL or click the share botton on the page, then leave us a COMMENTS on our campaigns page, the brush is for you now!

Click here share to facebook     Click here share to twitter

Groompal Pet massage brush Limited edition,
The forms of the massage heads of the functional brush are various, the operating mode is flexible, and each site of the pet's body is suitable for massage.
Help us share to the world!

(We Ship Worldwide now! If you are outside the supports countries, select $139 perk.)

Team

Visit our website and social media channel:
         Website      Facebook       twitter       Youtube     

Milestones

Inspiration

As pet lovers, visiting the pet spa was once our weekly routine. However, it was a hassle to make appointments, commute (often in traffic), and wait around. We then tried grooming our pets at home with the existing scissors and electric clippers on the market. It was challenging for us as non-pros, not to mention the mess left behind. We thought, what about a vacuum-powered clipper that sucks in all the hair while trimming? We searched, and what we found were that the vacuum grooming tools already on the market were all heavy, inflexible, imprecise, and too noisy for our pets. Could we produce something better ourselves?


Development

Starting in 2013, we brought together a group of talented designers and engineers to reinvent the in-home pet grooming experience. At first, we tried to integrate a vacuum with a few existing grooming attachments but we still struggled with the weight and comfort of the tool as well as experiencing poor grooming results. 



In October 2014, inspired by nature, we considered tapping into wind power. By using wind as a single power source, the grooming attachment might not need a second motor. We studied the turbo engine and developed a turbo wind-driven motor that weighs only 0.09lb, which turned out to be a vital breakthrough! Our new-patented air-touch technology not only reduced the overall product weight by 30%, but also led to more flexibility and accuracy in trimming.


Iteration

During the next 18 months, GroomPal continued to evolve, expanding the canister capacity with dust compression and improving the filtering system. By June 2016 we were already making our 5th prototype whose appearance closely resembles our current product. It’s by far our lightest version, with the highest cleaning rate and largest canister capacity. Outperforming all available offerings on the pet grooming market, we are so proud and excited to bring GroomPal to you and share this unprecedented mess-free pet grooming experience!


Your support is so critical to our success. Support us and start experiencing mess-free in-home grooming with GroomPal!

FAQ

1.  How long does the GroomPal last?

After many rounds of testing, most parts of the current GroomPal prototype function up to 800 hours, while the trimming attachment lasts 500 hours. On average, if used an hour every week at home, it will continue to work well for 7-8 years.

2.  My pet doesn't like loud sounds. How is the noise level of the GroomPal?

We specifically designed the GroomPal for the comfort of our pets, who often got nervous about grooming at pet spas and vet appointments. Because the motor is situated in the canister and designed to be quieter, it makes a pleasant experience for the pet. We have tested it on hundreds of pets, and as you can see from our videos and pictures, the pets were quite relaxed during the grooming process.

3.  What is the trimming blade made of? How do I maintain it?

The blade is made of durable high-carbon steel. The material is temperature resistant but we have also designed a unique cool airflow system for peak performance. We suggest applying professional lubricant regularly to prevent dullness and jamming. The blade may get dull every 5-6 sessions. We have included at least one set of 3 replacement blades in each package that’s good for over one-year of usage. You can purchase replacement blades separately on our website after the Indiegogo campaign. We will keep you posted once they become available.

4. Can I purchase the attachments separately and attach them directly to my vacuum machine at home?

We currently do not sell attachments separately. With its unique air-touch technology, the GroomPal vacuum device has been optimized over time for the smoothest operation of all attachments. Using these attachments with other branded vacuum devices may damage the attachments or affect the parts’ longevity. However, for users who own a 500-800W powered vacuum with speed control, GroomPal’s attachments will perform relatively well on this type of vacuum device. The attachments may be sold separately in the future and we will keep you updated with further information on our website.

5.  How does the hair straightening technology work?

The "hair-straightening" technology has gone through extensive testing and upgrading. It doesn’t pull the hair at all, instead gently straightening it for an even cut. When you use it for the very first time, please start with the lowest speed and increase the speed gradually as you become comfortable. The suction uses a unique trapezium-shaped design, and doesn't jam if used properly.

6.  Does the one-year warranty cover anywhere in the world? How do you define “used as intended”? Where is your repair center?

Yes, the warranty covers global purchases. Within one year of the purchase, if used as intended, any breakage or quality issue arises, you can send it back for free repair or part replacement. The user will only need to pay the shipping fee. The warranty doesn't cover the blade, as it will naturally wear out during normal usage.

Not using as “intended’ examples can include:

• Dropping or hitting the attachments when they are operating

• Continuously operating the device at the highest speed for more than 2 hours straight

• Frequent use in a professional spa, including resulting damage of the carbon brush or gears of the turbo engine

Our repair center is located in China. 

7.  Can GroomPal be used on cats or people?

Yes, but the hair diameter needs to be less than 0.15mm. Within the next few months on our social media channels we will share more videos about grooming cats properly and examples of use on kids and adults. Stay tuned.

8.  Can I trim my pet if its hair is tangled badly?

You should brush its hair first with the included brush attachment. If the hair is tangled from the roots, and is difficult to brush through, we suggest cutting off the tangles/knots first without any combs. Afterwards, you can attach combs of the desired length to the clipper for a stylish hair cut. 

9. Is GroomPal patented?

We already have a registered utility model patent and three pending patents on the technology as well as a pending global PCT patent.

10. How do you ensure GroomPal's high manufacturing quality?

Our manufacturing director has 15 years experience in hardware development, manufacturing, and design. We’ve selected one of the best manufacturing partners, experienced in working with established brands such as Shark, Karcher, and Hoover. This partnership will ensure GroomPal is manufactured at a very high quality.

11. Has GroomPal obtained any safety certifications?

The product has passed tests on hundreds of pets with different coat types and lengths. Not one potential safety issue has ever been detected. The only precaution owners need to take is not to use the blades within the pet’s skin folds. The product has been submitted for North American 65 and European RoHS certifications, which we expect to have by September 2016.

What’s So Great About GroomPal?Unlike other clippers or vacuum devices, GroomPal is powered by revolutionary air-touch technology. This innovative turbo-motor driven grooming tool is for all pets and is guaranteed to be mess-free, safe, easy to use, and super efficient. 
Rather than spending $50+ on each
grooming session at a pet spa, you will start saving money
after only 2 uses with GroomPal. It will be your best investment for your furry
friend and your wallet!


GroomPal is designed for all pet
breeds with any type of coat. The perfect
grooming tool for ALL pets!
How does it work?Step 1: Attach the grooming tool to the hose.

Step 2: Turn it on.
Step 3: Adjust the speed.
Step 4: Begin grooming.
Step 5: Press the compressor.
Step 6: Open the latch to empty the canister when full.

Done! No mess, a beautiful pet, and a clean home! 




Product Details



GroomPal is an all-in-one grooming solution and
comes with three attachments to fit any pet and any grooming style.






GroomPal
Community

Bringing the joy of mess-free pet grooming to every pet lover in the
world. Enjoy a happy pet and healthy home. Join us! 





Join our Groompal pet lover community, members can get tips, advice, share photos, videos,coupons, attend chats and events.Our online community also including pet rescues, shelter and adoption in the future.Join us and help us to build this, a community full of love for pet :)  
                                         >>>>>Click here to Join<<<<<<

Perks




【Great! Get GroomPal Pet Massage brush limited edition for free now!】
Now If you buy one GroomPal and share our Indiegogo Campaign with some recommend comment via social media (Facebook, twitter and so on), you will get one Get GroomPal Pet Massage brush limited edition for free. Just share the campaigns URL or click the share botton on the page, then leave us a COMMENTS on our campaigns page, the brush is for you now!
Click here share to facebook     Click here share to twitter

Groompal Pet massage brush Limited edition,

The forms of the massage heads of the functional brush are various, the operating mode is flexible, and each site of the pet's body is suitable for massage.Help us share to the world!




(We Ship Worldwide now! If you are outside the supports countries, select $139 perk.)


Team




Visit our website and social media channel:

         Website      Facebook       twitter       Youtube     
Milestones

Inspiration
As pet lovers, visiting the pet spa was once our weekly routine.
However, it was a hassle to make appointments, commute (often in traffic), and
wait around. We then tried grooming our pets at home with the existing scissors
and electric clippers on the market. It was challenging for us as non-pros, not
to mention the mess left behind. We thought, what about a vacuum-powered
clipper that sucks in all the hair while trimming? We searched, and what we
found were that the vacuum grooming tools already on the market were all heavy,
inflexible, imprecise, and too noisy for our pets. Could we produce something
better ourselves?



Development


Starting in 2013, we brought together a group of talented designers and engineers to reinvent the in-home pet grooming experience. At first, we tried to integrate a vacuum with a few existing grooming attachments but we still struggled with the weight and comfort of the tool as well as experiencing poor grooming results. 

In October 2014, inspired by nature, we considered tapping into wind
power. By using wind as a single power source, the grooming attachment might
not need a second motor. We studied the turbo engine and developed a turbo
wind-driven motor that weighs only 0.09lb, which turned out to be a vital
breakthrough! Our new-patented air-touch technology not only reduced the overall
product weight by 30%, but also led to more flexibility and accuracy in
trimming.



Iteration
During the next 18 months, GroomPal continued to evolve, expanding the canister capacity with dust compression and improving the filtering
system. By June 2016 we were already making our 5th prototype whose appearance
closely resembles our current product. It’s by far our lightest version, with the
highest cleaning rate and largest canister capacity. Outperforming all
available offerings on the pet grooming market, we are so proud and excited to
bring GroomPal to you and share this unprecedented mess-free pet grooming
experience!





Your support is so critical to our success. Support us and start experiencing mess-free in-home grooming with GroomPal!


FAQ
1.  How long does the GroomPal last?
After many rounds of testing, most parts of the current
GroomPal prototype function up to 800 hours, while the trimming attachment
lasts 500 hours. On average, if used an hour every week at home, it will
continue to work well for 7-8 years. 
2.  My pet doesn't like loud sounds. How is the noise level of the GroomPal?
We specifically designed the GroomPal for the comfort of our pets, who often got nervous about grooming at pet spas and vet appointments. Because the motor is situated in the canister and designed to be quieter, it makes a pleasant experience for the pet. We have tested it on hundreds of pets, and as you can see from our videos and pictures, the pets were quite relaxed during the grooming process.

3.  What is the trimming blade made of? How do I maintain it?
The blade is made of durable high-carbon steel. The material is temperature resistant but we have also designed a unique cool airflow system for peak performance. We suggest applying professional lubricant regularly to prevent dullness and jamming. The blade may get dull every 5-6 sessions. We have included at least one set of 3 replacement blades in each package that’s good for over one-year of usage. You can purchase replacement blades separately on our website after the Indiegogo campaign. We will keep you posted once they become available.
4. Can I purchase
the attachments separately and attach them directly to my vacuum machine at
home?
We currently do not sell attachments separately. With its
unique air-touch technology, the GroomPal vacuum device has been optimized over
time for the smoothest operation of all attachments. Using these attachments
with other branded vacuum devices may damage the attachments or affect the
parts’ longevity. However, for users who own a 500-800W powered vacuum with
speed control, GroomPal’s attachments will perform relatively well on this type
of vacuum device. The attachments may be sold separately in the future and we
will keep you updated with further information on our website.
5.  
How does the hair straightening technology work?
The "hair-straightening" technology has gone
through extensive testing and upgrading. It doesn’t pull the hair at all,
instead gently straightening it for an even cut. When you use it for the very
first time, please start with the lowest speed and increase the speed gradually
as you become comfortable. The suction uses a unique trapezium-shaped design,
and doesn't jam if used properly.
6.  Does the
one-year warranty cover anywhere in the world? How do you define “used as
intended”? Where is your repair center?
Yes, the warranty covers global purchases. Within one
year of the purchase, if used as intended, any breakage or quality issue arises, you can send it
back for free repair or part replacement. The user will only need to pay the
shipping fee. The warranty doesn't cover the blade, as it will naturally wear
out during normal usage.
Not using as “intended’ examples can include:
• Dropping or hitting the attachments when they are
operating
• Continuously operating the device at the highest
speed for more than 2 hours straight
• Frequent use in a professional spa, including
resulting damage of the carbon brush or gears of the turbo engine
Our repair center is located in China. 
7.  Can GroomPal be
used on cats or people?
Yes, but the hair diameter needs to be less than 0.15mm.
Within the next few months on our social media channels we will share more
videos about grooming cats properly and examples of use on kids and adults.
Stay tuned.
8.  Can I trim my
pet if its hair is tangled badly?
You should brush its hair first with the included brush
attachment. If the hair is tangled from the roots, and is difficult to brush
through, we suggest cutting off the tangles/knots first without any combs.
Afterwards, you can attach combs of the desired length to the clipper for a
stylish hair cut. 
9. Is GroomPal patented?
We already have a registered utility model patent and three
pending patents on the technology as well as a pending global PCT patent.
10. How do you ensure GroomPal's high manufacturing quality?
Our manufacturing director has 15 years experience in
hardware development, manufacturing, and design. We’ve selected one of the best
manufacturing partners, experienced in working with established brands such as
Shark, Karcher, and Hoover. This partnership will ensure GroomPal is
manufactured at a very high quality.
11. Has GroomPal obtained any safety certifications?
The product has passed tests on hundreds of pets with
different coat types and lengths. Not one potential safety issue has ever been
detected. The only precaution owners need to take is not to use the blades
within the pet’s skin folds. The product has been submitted for North American
65 and European RoHS certifications, which we expect to have by September 2016.

story:
Apoya una empresa dedicada al reciclaje, reutilización y posterior impresión 3D de plásticos en Mallorca.

Nuestro objetivo es establecernos como punto de recogida de plásticos en diferentes municipios de la isla. Llegar a acuerdos con la administración pública para la gestión de los puntos de aportación y de recogida selectiva y dar una segunda vida a los plásticos recogidos, evitando así posibles quemas de plásticos y contaminación ambiental.

Nuestro sistema consiste en:

Recogida y recepción de plásticos en nuestro almacén.

Triturado y desecado de plásticos.

Impresión de plásticos con nuestras impresoras 3D.

Venta posterior de estos productos a nivel nacional:

- Mobiliario de interiores y exteriores económicos

- Material de construcción para viviendas económicas y sostenibles

- Venta de plásticos en forma de pellets para la industria.

Una medida que la empresa crezca, la parte mayor de los recursos económicos va a ir destinada a la creación de nuevos puntos de recogida e impresión a lo largo de todo el territorio nacional.

En este sentido, creemos que es una empresa con una gran capacidad de crecimiento ofreciendo como resultados, nuevos lugares de trabajo (transportes, recogida y separación de plásticos, impresores, diseñadores 3D...), que colaboran con asociaciones locales y ayuntamientos, para conseguir reutilizar plásticos que de otra forma resultan en muchos, muy contaminantes contaminantes contaminantes

Necesitamos ayuda para poner en marcha el proyecto.

Ya contamos con almacén, máquinas de impresión y furgoneta para recogida, también hemos empezado una ronda de contactos con diferentes alcaldes de la zona y podemos decir que en general, el proyecto cuenta con la simpatía y el apoyo de mucha gente, pero no es suficiente. Necesitamos adquirir varias máquinas para que la empresa empiece a funcionar.

Una trituradora de plásticos de capacidad industrial cuyo coste es de 3.000 euros.

Una máquina para hacer filamentos: 6.000 euros.

4 Extrusoras de Pellets: 2200 euros.

Contenedores para puntos de aportación: 80 euros cada uno.

Campaña publicitaria: 2.000 euros.

Actualmente somos 2 personas trabajando, pero si va bien, necesitaremos a:

1 Conductor para traslado plásticos.

1 Recolector, triturador.

1 Técnico de Impresoras 3D.

1 Diseñador 3D.

Esta seria la plantilla media por municipio de 6000 a 10000 habitantes.

Ecofilament, se compromete a mantener la información de forma clara y transparente a todos los interesados a través de nuestra página web, aún en construcción.


Llevamos tiempo estudiando las posibilidades de la impresión 3D. Hemos hecho muchas pruebas con nuestras impresoras y actualmente, ya se puede contar con la tecnología necesaria para llevar a cabo el proyecto. En un momento crucial de nuestra historia reciente, estamos convencidos de que podemos aportar algo positivo a la sociedad con nuestro proyecto.

Finalmente, el esfuerzo y el entendemos que este proyecto sin tu ayuda es simple, imposible.

De forma muy sincera, GRACIAS por tu colaboración.

Rafel Ángel Valls.
Propietario de Ecofilament.

story:
The Problem

  • Currently, there are five trillion pieces of plastic, weighing 250 tons in the oceans. This equates to five grocery bags filled with plastic for every foot of coast line in the world.
  • The Deep-Sea Debris database reported that 89% of plastic found by divers at the bottom of the sea are designed for one time use or consumption. This includes plastic bottles and plastic bags.
  • This single use plastic ends up in oceans and beaches; severely impacting marine life and sensitive ecosystems.
  • Many communities don’t have a recycling program and the prospect of a large-scale program is far too costly.

The Great Sea Project (GSP) 

In 2019, GSP is working to combat the issue of plastic pollution in the ocean. The goal is to return the ocean to a cleaner state, recycle recovered material, provide resources that will promote sustainability while boosting the economy of participating communities.  

  • S.C.R units (self contained recycling units)
    • Our first unit is now operational in South Andros Bahamas 
  • Working with local governments and communities in impacted areas:
    • GSP will deliver the S.C.R units – which will act as a hub for delivery of recovered plastics from beaches, marine habitats and surrounding lands.
    • GSP will employ local community residents to operate the S.C.R unit.
    • GSP will help drive awareness on the impact of single use plastics by working closely with local governments, hotel, resort chains, tourism companies and cruise companies. The majority of the single use plastics in the Caribbean are due to the largest income driver in most countries – tourism.
  • GSP will sell the shredded plastic material to partnering companies for the production of 100% recycled GSP ocean plastics goods.

Logistics

  • The S.C.R unit  will be established in participating communities and GSP will train local employees to operate.
  • GSP will coordinate clean up and community drop off of the recovered plastics for year one or for a longer term if required.
  • Shipping of processed plastics will occur when sufficient materials have accumulated.
  • GSP will set a shipping schedule accordingly; monthly or quarterly depending on the amount of recovered material.
  • The funds from the sale of the plastic for year 1-3 will flow back to participating communities.
  • Option to include a mould or press in each unit will allow process GSP ocean plastics to be converted to GSP HIPPO wood 

 

Impact 

 

Community

Partnering and working with local communities is key to success and key to a permanent solution:

  • Employ local residents to collect plastics for recycling and manage operations.
  • Incentivize local residents to pay by / lb for drop off at designated facilities Local artists design or paint S.C.R. units (patent pending).
  • Change the culture by changing perception:
    • Education program
    • Create scholarship program for school age children to encourage collection at a younger age.
  • Community investment - Provide key community resources as required. This could include:
    • Sponsor and align with local community programs that drive sustainability.
    • Investment in essential services such as emergency vehicles i.e. Fire Trucks, EMS.
    • Repair to key buildings due to hurricane damage

Benefits

  • Clean beaches and oceans
  • Promotion of eco-tourism
  • Community investment
  • Economic growth
  • Job creation

The S.C.R units (patent pending) will allow local communities to process plastic onsite, making it easier to ship and will give communities a viable product to drive a new income stream. 

Revenue flow channels

  • Sale of recovered and processed plastic to manufacturers.
  • Sale of product
    •  GSP will launch a signature skateboard and skim board made of 100% ocean plastic.
  • Partnerships
  • Percentage of partner product:
    •  GSP is currently negotiating contracts with end users and the buyers of the recycled materials. These contracts will be managed by GSP.
  • Licensing of S.C.R. unit (patent pending) to other communities & countries - the long term goal is to raise capital to produce 8-12 S.C.R units (patent pending) and license or sell to communities that don't have capacity for large scale recycling programs. 

What you can do:

  • Contribute now
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Shop consciously 
  • Stop buying single use plastics 
  • Use reusable bags and containers 
  • Share GSP’s mission via all of your social channels.
  • We love meeting people and talking about our project. Introductions are invaluable. Contact us to chat.
  • In-kind donations welcome (contact us for a list of items needed).
  • Do you want to partner? Contact us to chat.

The Problem
Currently, there are five trillion pieces of plastic, weighing 250 tons in the oceans. This equates to five grocery bags filled with plastic for every foot of coast line in the world.
The Deep-Sea Debris database reported that 89% of plastic found by divers at the bottom of the sea are designed for one time use or consumption. This includes plastic bottles and plastic bags.

Benefits

Sale of product GSP will launch a signature skateboard and skim board made of 100% ocean plastic.

Partnerships
Percentage of partner product: GSP is currently negotiating contracts with end users and the buyers of the recycled materials. These contracts will be managed by GSP.

Licensing of S.C.R. unit (patent pending) to other communities & countries - the long term goal is to raise capital to produce 8-12 S.C.R units (patent pending) and license or sell to communities that don't have capacity for large scale recycling programs. 
What you can do:
Contribute now
Use the Indiegogo share tools.
Shop consciously 
Stop buying single use plastics 
Use reusable bags and containers 
Share GSP’s mission via all of your social channels.
We love meeting people and talking about our project. Introductions are invaluable. Contact us to chat.
In-kind donations welcome (contact us for a list of items needed).
Do you want to partner? Contact us to chat.

story:
The inception of Project Eco Earth can be traced back to when we were walking through one of the famous nature trails of Uttarakhand, India. We identified the problem of how those areas are not at all able to manage the plastic being generated by the tourists. Almost all the plastic waste is either disposed of in drains or is burnt away. We went on to other trails and found large heaps of plastics being dumped in every corner of the mountains.

 

The issues revolving around plastic waste have long been acknowledged. However, the efforts made to combat it have been minimal. While the rates of plastic consumption are rising alarmingly, developments in its waste management have not picked up. It is well known that once introduced into the environment, plastic is capable of staying in the system for over 500 years. Before degrading entirely, plastic disintegrates into tiny particles that have hazardous impacts. According to UN estimates India generates about 15,342 tons of plastic waste per day (TPD) if we talk particularly in the tourism circuits of Uttarakhand the number. Even when statistics state that India recycles 60% of its plastic, a major chunk of plastic waste in the oceans comes from India. Tourism is one of the fastest growing industries in our country. More tourists equal more waste, and more waste inevitably translates into a larger environmental footprint. This is not just a problem for the areas where establishing an efficient waste management system is challenging, like small islands or remote, sparsely populated areas. Even major tourist sites fail to pay heed to this alarming issue.

 

This plastic waste is capable of traveling hundreds of kilometers, getting lodged into the ecosystem, leeching out chemicals that affect every possible life form. Many studies have investigated the potential uptake of hydrophobic contaminants emerging from mismanaged plastic waste, which then get bioaccumulated in the food chain. Plastic is made using toxic additives like BPA, BPS, and Phthalates which can easily dissolve out into whatever material is kept inside it. Scientists have studied and illustrated how this can serious health defects like thyroid, mental breakdown, bad stomach, cell disruptions, DNA mutation and even higher stages of cancer. The harmful chemicals like PCBs, DDT, and PAH, which get absorbed in the plastic debris that floats in the sea water, have a varied and harmful range of chronic effects like endocrine disorders. The plastic that flows out in water bodies gets ingested by marine life forms exposing them to dangers of either poisoning or choking. Besides this, waste dump sites attract animals which feed on the easily available food waste and in the process, ingest the plastic interspersed with it.

 

A lot of single-use plastic is thrown in the tourism circuits and due to lack of resources and ideas on how to deal with it, therefore, it either ends up in the rivers, chokes nallahs, litter around the trails or just lies somewhere in the corner of the mountains. Project Eco Earth is an environment-friendly solution to tackle the plastic problem around the globe by introducing easy to handle portable and efficient machines to up-cycle plastic and develop products which can be used for a long duration. As previously stated, we are going to develop a set of four machines namely Shredder, Extrusion, Injector, and Compressor. The shredded plastic flakes go into the extrusion machine to create threads of plastic which directly can be used to make door handles, vases, baskets, etc. Similarly, the injector gives out the melted plastic directly inside small molds to make small products like wall tiles. The compressor is a device which comes in the picture when we need to create big products like chairs, buckets, sheets, bricks, etc.

The main Goals and Objectives of this project, therefore, are -

• Reduce Plastic in the urban and rural landfills, mainly starting with tourist hotspots

• Create sustainable material from the plastic waste collected

• Promote DIY machines to set micro entrepreneurs.

• Create employment

The Machines are uniquely designed by our team throughout the globe to fit in a small workspace in order to be easy to handle, maintain and deliver the most efficient outcomes, before starting with the machine handling it should be very clear of what type of plastic we are going to deal with and whether it is pre segregated or not so that we can keep the products categorically as every category of plastic melts at a different temperature and if not understood properly can cause serious damage to the machine as well as will degrade the quality of the outcome.

The Shredder is designed in such a way that it can shred even the hardest plastic with a motor of 3Hp and 70 RPM, it goes slow and steady and gives equal pressure at every blade to a perfect same sized flakes of plastic the pain is to get used to segregate plastic categorically and use only one at a time the idea is to keep all the categories segregated so that in future the products can again be recycled and keep up the vicious circle.

Now these flakes enters the Extrusion machine where these shredded plastic flakes takes a new shape all together the machine is basically a heating tube with a 1.5 Hp motor connected at 60-70 RPM .once the temperature reaches the melting point of a particular category of plastic ,the flakes of the same categories goes inside the machine and keeps throwing a thread of the same material which either can be rolled in a thread form, or cut continuously at an interval to get pallets of the category which can be used as a secondary virgin material and molded into other shapes and forms . This machine is also capable of creating rod-like the structure of various shapes and castes you want to and have a nozzle to decide what shape coming out of the tube and of course the dimension of it.

These pallets now can be used to put into the third machine i.e. Injection machine which is small similar heating tube machine as that of the Extrusion but doesn’t have a motor (its manual) and also is standing vertical, pointing downwards which once preheated to a certain temperature it intakes the pallets into its semi funnel fitted in the rod and goes straight into the tube, a mould is already fixed in the nozzle and is waiting to be injected, the melted plastic then pushed and pooped into the cast to take desired shapes. This machine can process only a limited quantity and that is the reason why we can only make small products out of this machine and for big products we use a compressor.

The Compressor creates products like baskets, tubs, vases, big tiles etc. The machine is a uniquely finished design which is fitted with an oven at the top of it with a small circular hole at the floor of the oven and a solid 5mm steel sheet at the ceiling inside, once a cast of product filled with flakes/ pallets enters into the oven chamber its is pushed from below wising a mechanical jack manually and given the shape provided the oven was preheated and was set to a temperature already.

All the machines are equipped with temperature controllers where heating takes place and speed regulator where the motor runs sometimes both using PID controllers and latest temperature regulators, in the shredder there exists a controller device which sometimes allows the motor to automatically reverse the shredding if stuck with a thick plastic piece.

The inception of Project Eco Earth can be traced back to when we were walking through one of the famous nature trails of Uttarakhand, India. We identified the problem of how those areas are not at all able to manage the plastic being generated by the tourists. Almost all the plastic waste is either disposed of in drains or is burnt away. We went on to other trails and found large heaps of plastics being dumped in every corner of the mountains.
 
The issues revolving around plastic waste have long been acknowledged. However, the efforts made to combat it have been minimal. While the rates of plastic consumption are rising alarmingly, developments in its waste management have not picked up. It is well known that once introduced into the environment, plastic is capable of staying in the system for over 500 years. Before degrading entirely, plastic disintegrates into tiny particles that have hazardous impacts. According to UN estimates India generates about 15,342 tons of plastic waste per day (TPD) if we talk particularly in the tourism circuits of Uttarakhand the number. Even when statistics state that India recycles 60% of its plastic, a major chunk of plastic waste in the oceans comes from India. Tourism is one of the fastest growing industries in our country. More tourists equal more waste, and more waste inevitably translates into a larger environmental footprint. This is not just a problem for the areas where establishing an efficient waste management system is challenging, like small islands or remote, sparsely populated areas. Even major tourist sites fail to pay heed to this alarming issue.
 
This plastic waste is capable of traveling hundreds of kilometers, getting lodged into the ecosystem, leeching out chemicals that affect every possible life form. Many studies have investigated the potential uptake of hydrophobic contaminants emerging from mismanaged plastic waste, which then get bioaccumulated in the food chain. Plastic is made using toxic additives like BPA, BPS, and Phthalates which can easily dissolve out into whatever material is kept inside it. Scientists have studied and illustrated how this can serious health defects like thyroid, mental breakdown, bad stomach, cell disruptions, DNA mutation and even higher stages of cancer. The harmful chemicals like PCBs, DDT, and PAH, which get absorbed in the plastic debris that floats in the sea water, have a varied and harmful range of chronic effects like endocrine disorders. The plastic that flows out in water bodies gets ingested by marine life forms exposing them to dangers of either poisoning or choking. Besides this, waste dump sites attract animals which feed on the easily available food waste and in the process, ingest the plastic interspersed with it.
 
A lot of single-use plastic is thrown in the tourism circuits and due to lack of resources and ideas on how to deal with it, therefore, it either ends up in the rivers, chokes nallahs, litter around the trails or just lies somewhere in the corner of the mountains. Project Eco Earth is an environment-friendly solution to tackle the plastic problem around the globe by introducing easy to handle portable and efficient machines to up-cycle plastic and develop products which can be used for a long duration. As previously stated, we are going to develop a set of four machines namely Shredder, Extrusion, Injector, and Compressor. The shredded plastic flakes go into the extrusion machine to create threads of plastic which directly can be used to make door handles, vases, baskets, etc. Similarly, the injector gives out the melted plastic directly inside small molds to make small products like wall tiles. The compressor is a device which comes in the picture when we need to create big products like chairs, buckets, sheets, bricks, etc.
The main Goals and Objectives of this project, therefore, are -
• Reduce Plastic in the urban and rural landfills, mainly starting with tourist hotspots
• Create sustainable material from the plastic waste collected
• Promote DIY machines to set micro entrepreneurs.
• Create employment
The Machines are uniquely designed by our team throughout the globe to fit in a small workspace in order to be easy to handle, maintain and deliver the most efficient outcomes, before starting with the machine handling it should be very clear of what type of plastic we are going to deal with and whether it is pre segregated or not so that we can keep the products categorically as every category of plastic melts at a different temperature and if not understood properly can cause serious damage to the machine as well as will degrade the quality of the outcome.
The Shredder is designed in such a way that it can shred even the hardest plastic with a motor of 3Hp and 70 RPM, it goes slow and steady and gives equal pressure at every blade to a perfect same sized flakes of plastic the pain is to get used to segregate plastic categorically and use only one at a time the idea is to keep all the categories segregated so that in future the products can again be recycled and keep up the vicious circle.
Now these flakes enters the Extrusion machine where these shredded plastic flakes takes a new shape all together the machine is basically a heating tube with a 1.5 Hp motor connected at 60-70 RPM .once the temperature reaches the melting point of a particular category of plastic ,the flakes of the same categories goes inside the machine and keeps throwing a thread of the same material which either can be rolled in a thread form, or cut continuously at an interval to get pallets of the category which can be used as a secondary virgin material and molded into other shapes and forms . This machine is also capable of creating rod-like the structure of various shapes and castes you want to and have a nozzle to decide what shape coming out of the tube and of course the dimension of it.
These pallets now can be used to put into the third machine i.e. Injection machine which is small similar heating tube machine as that of the Extrusion but doesn’t have a motor (its manual) and also is standing vertical, pointing downwards which once preheated to a certain temperature it intakes the pallets into its semi funnel fitted in the rod and goes straight into the tube, a mould is already fixed in the nozzle and is waiting to be injected, the melted plastic then pushed and pooped into the cast to take desired shapes. This machine can process only a limited quantity and that is the reason why we can only make small products out of this machine and for big products we use a compressor.
The Compressor creates products like baskets, tubs, vases, big tiles etc. The machine is a uniquely finished design which is fitted with an oven at the top of it with a small circular hole at the floor of the oven and a solid 5mm steel sheet at the ceiling inside, once a cast of product filled with flakes/ pallets enters into the oven chamber its is pushed from below wising a mechanical jack manually and given the shape provided the oven was preheated and was set to a temperature already.
All the machines are equipped with temperature controllers where heating takes place and speed regulator where the motor runs sometimes both using PID controllers and latest temperature regulators, in the shredder there exists a controller device which sometimes allows the motor to automatically reverse the shredding if stuck with a thick plastic piece.

story:
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Each purchase of an OCEANPLASTIK perk contributes to the development of an innovating ecosystem to cleanup and recycle (ocean) plastic debris on a global scale.

With your support we can start to develop this ecosystem to battle the global plastic pollution problem by cleaning up and recycling as many plastic as possible.

All our backers will be listed on our website.

Our main target is to give collected and recycled plastic waste a real value and reward all participants using their smartphone.

OCEANPLASTIK aims to cleanup and recycle approximately 19,500,000 kilos of (ocean) plastic waste through its ecosystem in the next 4 years.

In April 2020 we expect to have the OCEANPLASTIK ecosystem live, including a recycling, production center and a network of waste collection points in Bali (Indonesia) before we expand to other regions around the world.

We need to cleanup our beautiful planet from the insane amount of plastic waste we have created before its too late. Our children's children deserve a future!

 

LOCALIZE AND CLEANUP PLASTIC 

OCEANPLASTIK empowers you and everyone else with a smartphone to combat (ocean) plastic debris using PTAGGER, a mobile app (Android and iOS) to tag, localize and collect plastic waste.

From April 2020 everyone can download the PTAGGER app and earn exchangeable crypto tokens by tagging, collecting and dropping off plastic waste at connected waste collection points and recycling centers. 

FEATURES

  • Easy-to-use interface
  • Localization (available in multiple languages)
  • Tag, collect and drop off plastic objects
  • Navigational instructions (Google Maps Platform API)
  • Real-time collection queue
  • Notification services
  • Using QR codes for drop off activities
  • App users are rewarded with crypto tokens
  • Levels, scores and achievements (gamification elements)
  • Social media functions (profile, timeline, activity feed, follow and albums)
  • Education aspects (create awareness and learn more about plastic)
  • Issue crypto debit cards for PTAGGER app users

 

FUTURE ADD-ONS

  • Automated drone solution to collect tagged plastic that is ready to be picked up
  • Smart trash bin solution to increase the number of waste collection points within the OP ecosystem

 

Note:
With the PTAGGER app we aim engage local communities and motivate millions of people.

For example many people in Indonesia (and other countries) have a smartphone with Internet access but have a lack of income.

We aim to give all our app users a safe and secure source of income by cleaning up plastic waste (tag, collect and drop off plastic objects).

By installing the PTAGGER app, our users (locals) are automatically notified if someone in their area has tagged plastic waste that is ready to be collected and dropped off.

We expect this method will engage millions of people to be part of the ecosystem and doing their contribution to cleanup (ocean) plastic waste. 

In the next 4 years we aim to have 13,5 million active PTAGGER app users and 2,250 collection points, where our users can drop off collected plastic waste.

 

RECYCLED PLASTIC

Collected plastic waste will be processed at one of the connected recycling centers.

Recycling companies can enlist their batches of recycled plastic on RPNDEX, a decentralized marketplace for recycled plastic where plastic manufacturers can get their production material for the lowest prices.

This way we encourage plastic manufacturers to avoid using virgin plastic resin for their production purposes and purchase recycled plastics.

Both plastic recycling companies and manufacturers can use specific B2B features within the RPNDEX marketplace to accelerate their business activities.

 

NEW ENDURABLE PRODUCTS

OCEANPLASTIK will set up collection points, recycling and production centers in areas that are heavily affected by plastic pollution to manufacture new endurable plastic products.

By manufacturing endurable plastic chopsticks made out of ocean plastic debris we aim to minimize deforestation with an alternative for disposable wooden chopsticks.

Later we will manufacture other endurable products using recycled plastic like cutlery, building bricks, lunchboxes (for children) and additional semi-finished products for our partners.

OP products will be sold over various sales channels including our own B2C - B2B webshop and promoted using our affiliate program (for resellers).
 

OCEANPLASTIK will use its generated sales profits as followed:

  • To increase the cleanup and recycle process
  • To create awareness about the global plastic pollution problem
  • To educate people about plastic pollution
  • Create job opportunities
  • Involve local economies and governments
  • Buy back crypto tokens from the crypto exchanges

 

PARTNER PROGRAM

OCEANPLASTIK is looking for companies who would like to contribute with financial aid or by providing services and/or goods to help us to reach our goals to cleanup as much plastic as possible through the OCEANPLASTIK ecosystem.

We offer 6 partner levels which includes an annual and one-time fee.
 

PARTNER BENEFITS

  • Partners will be mentioned in all outbound communications (on-site, in-app, press releases and social media channels)
  • All Partners are automatically invited to participate in OCEANPLASTIK workshops and annual OP events
  • Partners are updated monthly about the progress  and results
  • Partners receive 50% from their placed contribution back in our crypto tokens
  • Outsource manufacturing of semi-finished products (endurable plastic products only) based on recycled plastic
  • Partners can purchase recycled plastic granules on the RPNDEX marketplace


Click here to read more about our partner program. For more information , please contact us by email hello@oceanplastik.com


PROJECT TIMELINE

Here you will have a summary overview for the years 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022.

Note: the OP project timeline is fully scheduled but can always be modified. Click here to access OCEANPLASTIK's roadmap.

 

2019

Raise funds through the OCEANPLASTIK partner program and Indiegogo campaign, start the development of the OP ecosystem and launch the OCEANS token ICO (our crypto token).  

Start the development from the OP ecosystem, which is an ongoing process during our roadmap where version 1.0a (live MVP) is scheduled to be launched in Q2/2020. 

Targets: Start development MVP (complete OP ecosystem), approach investors, supporting partners, raise funds with the OCEANS Token ICO (own crypto token), prepare and schedule the first recycling and production facility in Bali (Indonesia).
 

2020

OP ecosystem MVP live from April 2020, start manufacturing endurable plastic chopsticks, have the OCEANPLASTIK locations in Brno (Czech Republic) and Bali (Indonesia) fully operational. 

To expand with OCEANPLASTIK collection points, recycle and production facilities worldwide in areas where there is heavy ocean plastic pollution. 

Targets: cleanup and recycle between 1,000,000 - 2,500,000 kilo (ocean) plastic debris and have in total minimum 1,000,000 PTAGGER apps installed
 

2021

OCEANPLASTIK collection points, recycle and production facilities fully operational in various countries. Maximum production of multiple OP product types sold over a network of worldwide distribution channels. 

The RPNDEX marketplace fully operational for plastic recyclers and manufacturers to avoid purchasing new virgin plastic resin materials. 

Targets: cleanup and recycle between 5,000,000 - 10,000,000 kilo ocean plastic debris and have in total minimum 5,000,000 PTAGGER apps installed
 

2022

Expand with collection points, recycling and production facilities. Maximum production capacity of multiple OP product types and semi finished plastic products for OP partners. 

Launch a network of OP smart bins to expand the number of collection points in our ecosystem.

Targets: cleanup and recycle between 10,000,000 - 15,000,000 kilo ocean plastic debris and have in total minimum 7,500,000 PTAGGER apps installed

 

OUR STORY

Three years ago we were approached to invest and manufacture a new endurable product made from out of ocean plastic trash.

Unfortunately we had to decline the opportunity because we didn't had the time or available resources.

After some in-depth research and studying, we were truly shocked about the disastrous impact plastic trash has on our natural environment and marine wildlife. The plastic pollution problem is completely out of control and requires direct action. 

Unfortunately there are no real regulations, governments and big corporation need to wake up and do everything in their power to stop this. One of the topics is to create awareness and educate the public.

Our generation is the last one who can do something about this problem and our actions of today will shape the future from our children’s children.

Our oceans die within two generations once we neglect or ignore this problem. Once all marine wildlife died we humans are the next in line to extinct.

Some of our team members are working together since 2004 and 2009. We have a strong background in software development, business development, payment processing, digital marketing and are involved in various tech startup companies.

Most of us are parents and are really concerned about our children's future.

In the beginning of 2018 we decided to use our network, skills and resources to design and blueprint an ecosystem designated to cleanup and recycle (ocean) plastic.

In April 2018 we started to design this innovating ecosystem and in January 2019 we incorporated OCEANPLASTIK SRO, a limited liability company operating from Brno (Czech Republic). 

Exactly one year later (April 2019) we are ready to start our journey to develop an unique ecosystem, to involve people and companies and make them aware about the dangers of plastic waste.

 

CONTACT US

We'd love to hear from you. Whether you have a question, suggestion, comment, or anything else, our team is ready to answer all your questions.

  • Email
  • News
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • LinkedIn

story:
Nambiti is situated in a malaria-free zone - so there's no need for medication. It is also the only reserve in the area that can boast of having the Big 5, along with 40 other game species. Nambiti's 22000 acres offers incredible biodiversity, with grasslands, riverine bush, savannah and thornveld. Game viewing, birding, and fishng (for yellowtail) in the river are the main activities at Nambiti, which is also close to the renowned battlefields.

"Conservation has to be a business. It can't run on fluffy stuff; it has to run on real things."

There are nine game lodges, with facilities ranging from self catering to the pampered. Our Lodge will be the tenth and final Safari  lodge on Nambiti, which will boast 5 star service. 

The long-term goal of our Bush Lodge is creating a differentiated experience capitalising on personal service, the historical nature of Nambiti, and its unique location in one of the most attractive parts of South Africa. We plan to be more than a great lodge. We plan to create an environment of pampered luxury that surpasses the standard.  A place where you can leave the stresses and worries of everyday life behind you and allow the magic of the bush to captivate your soul. Introducing the Lodge to people that have not yet discovered this year-round paradise will allow us to maintain a higher than average occupancy rate and above average profits. A new bush lodge is a perfect symbiosis of wildlife conservation by raising international awareness, creating jobs for the local people and maintaining a safe sanctuary for the animals. Since the reserve was founded it created over 400 jobs for the local community and is now home to hundreds of animals. Our lodge will create 15 more sustainable jobs for the local community and through the payment of levies to the reserve will contribute towards conservation and protection of these magnificent animals. 

Our Lodge will exude a warm, welcoming atmosphere that invites guests to submit to the magic of the African bush. Visitors will accommodated one of only 5 exclusive, free standing  suites, offering maximum privacy each with it's own splash pool and spectacular views of the bushveld.  After a game drive, visitors can enjoy a massage or take a dip in the magnificent infinity pool. Meals will be prepared to perfection by a new Executive Chef and are served in the traditional boma or in the elegantly decorated dining room. The lodge will have four Luxury Suites with one Honeymoon Suite each having it's own unique theme and design. Suites will consist of  a plush bedroom with a walk-in cupboard and spacious lounge area. The open-plan bathrooms will house a feature bath that invites long indulgent soaks. There are 'His' and 'Hers' showers in both the bathroom as well as outdoors for an added touch of magic under the African sky. Glass folding doors invite the bush to be the main focus of the lodge. We will use natural, eco friendly and recycled materials to reduce the environmental footprint without compromising on the quality. We want our guests to feel pampered and homely at the same time. We will create a space that will allow you to escape the rat race, take off your shoes and immerse yourself fully in the magic of Africa.

Only when the last of the animals horns, tusks, skin and bones have been sold, will mankind realize that money can never buy back our wildlife” 

The number of rhinos poached in South Africa in 2017 was lower than 2016’s. Last year, 1028 rhinos were killed compared to 1054 in 2016, a decrease of 26 animals (2.5%). 

Any fall in the numbers is welcomed, but it’s the fifth year running that over 1000 rhinos were killed.

TRAFFIC, the international wildlife trade monitoring group, states that 5476 rhinos were killed in South Africa over a five year period. This is from an estimated rhino populations at the end of 2010 of 18 796 white and 1916 black rhino in the country. South Africa has about 93% of the world’s white rhino population and 40% of its black rhinos.

Though recorded deaths have dropped for three years in a row, there is still a crisis on hand. Tom Milliken, TRAFFIC’s Rhino Programme Leader, said

The marginally lower total in 2017 still remains unacceptably high and with close to three rhinos illegally killed in South Africa every single day…the crisis continues 

Anti-poaching operations in the world famous Kruger National Park have achieved considerable success. But rhino poaching has soared in KwaZulu-Natal and several other provinces. The Kruger has increased patrols, the size and sophistication of anti-poaching units and worked with the South African army to secure the areas with the largest rhino populations, but smaller parks and reserves do not have the resources to do this.

Your pledge will directly help to fight poaching though our monthly donation to the reserve which will help to maintain anti poaching team on the reserve. 

"The illegal wildlife trade threatens not only the survival of entire species, such as elephants and rhinos, but also the livelihoods and, often, the very lives of millions of people across Africa who depend on tourism for a living. "

"WE  believe if you work hard and you dream big enough, you can accomplish anything in this world."

Both Nadia and myself are nature lovers, South Africa and Nambiti especially has captured our hearts. We believe that through small acts of kindness you can accomplish great change, and the time to give back and preserve this planet is now.

We both worked in hospitality and corporate environment as well as ran successful businesses. Each time we went to Nambiti we realised that we never want to leave. From that point the idea of running a sustainable and eco conscious business became a focus and now you can help us make this dream a reality.

Thank you for your time and for your interest in our project. I can't wait to enjoy this journey together and to see this project grow.  With your help, we can start building  this year! :-) 

Please enjoy our short video, which we hope will touch your hearts as it has ours. 

Please feel free contact us if you have any question, any ideas how you would like to get involved or other investment options. 

 

 

Nadia, 07912065755

 Stephen, 07770766868 

(All photos and videos have been taken within Nambiti)

The open-plan bathrooms will house a feature bath that invites long indulgent soaks. There are 'His' and 'Hers' showers in both the bathroom as well as outdoors for an added touch of magic under the African sky. Glass folding doors invite the bush to be the main focus of the lodge. We will use natural, eco friendly and recycled materials to reduce the environmental footprint without compromising on the quality. We want our guests to feel pampered and homely at the same time. We will create a space that will allow you to escape the rat race, take off your shoes and immerse yourself fully in the magic of Africa.
Only when the last of the animals horns, tusks, skin and bones have been sold, will mankind realize that money can never buy back our wildlife” 
The number of rhinos poached in South Africa in 2017 was lower than 2016’s. Last year, 1028 rhinos were killed compared to 1054 in 2016, a decrease of 26 animals (2.5%). 
Any fall in the numbers is welcomed, but it’s the fifth year running that over 1000 rhinos were killed.
TRAFFIC, the international wildlife trade monitoring group, states that 5476 rhinos were killed in South Africa over a five year period. This is from an estimated rhino populations at the end of 2010 of 18 796 white and 1916 black rhino in the country. South Africa has about 93% of the world’s white rhino population and 40% of its black rhinos.
Though recorded deaths have dropped for three years in a row, there is still a crisis on hand. Tom Milliken, TRAFFIC’s Rhino Programme Leader, said
The marginally lower total in 2017 still remains unacceptably high and with close to three rhinos illegally killed in South Africa every single day…the crisis continues 
Anti-poaching operations in the world famous Kruger National Park have achieved considerable success. But rhino poaching has soared in KwaZulu-Natal and several other provinces. The Kruger has increased patrols, the size and sophistication of anti-poaching units and worked with the South African army to secure the areas with the largest rhino populations, but smaller parks and reserves do not have the resources to do this.
Your pledge will directly help to fight poaching though our monthly donation to the reserve which will help to maintain anti poaching team on the reserve. 
"The illegal wildlife trade threatens not only the survival of entire species, such as elephants and rhinos, but also the livelihoods and, often, the very lives of millions of people across Africa who depend on tourism for a living. "
"WE  believe if you work hard and you dream big enough, you can accomplish anything in this world."
Both Nadia and myself are nature lovers, South Africa and Nambiti especially has captured our hearts. We believe that through small acts of kindness you can accomplish great change, and the time to give back and preserve this planet is now.
We both worked in hospitality and corporate environment as well as ran successful businesses. Each time we went to Nambiti we realised that we never want to leave. From that point the idea of running a sustainable and eco conscious business became a focus and now you can help us make this dream a reality.
Thank you for your time and for your interest in our project. I can't wait to enjoy this journey together and to see this project grow.  With your help, we can start building  this year! :-) 
Please enjoy our short video, which we hope will touch your hearts as it has ours. 
Please feel free contact us if you have any question, any ideas how you would like to get involved or other investment options. 
 
 
Nadia, 07912065755
 Stephen, 07770766868 
(All photos and videos have been taken within Nambiti)

story:
Oh God.

It's actually happening. We're actually going to hand Donald J Trump the actual keys to the actual White House. Just breathe. Take big deep breaths. In and out, through - yup you guessed it - the 

Commemorative Presidential Inauguration Pollution Mask

 

The day we didn't really believe was going to come is now here, and this is how we think the day should be commemorated. Not convinced? Let's put it like this... What better way to protect yourself from breathing in the toxic fumes that are bound to emanate from the Oval Office than a Presidential anti-pollution mask? Don't try to answer that. But take it from us,

this limited edition piece of facewear will become the runaway craze of 2017.

There's practically nothing the mask doesn't go with. It works fantastically with workwear…

Even fits with knitwear...

...and it's basically the perfect accessory to wear at rallies and protests.   

We're talking about the man who proves the American Dream is actually possible. That truly anyone can take the highest office and become Leader of the Free World. A guy who not only denies Climate Change, but actually thinks the Chinese made the whole thing up.     

Trump announced to the world he’d get to work "right away on day one", starting with the appointment of oil men to Secretary of State, then climate change deniers to the Environmental Protection Agency, before swiftly moving on to scrapping a whole bunch of environmental and green energy initiatives.

 

 
That's why we think he deserves something much more appropriate to commemorate his inauguration.
 

Not a t-shirt, mug or bumper sticker,

BUT A POLLUTION MASK

 

So who’s with us? Because if this is going to happen, we’re going to need your help.

But first, before we start, we want to make one thing super clear: all this is NOT-FOR-PROFIT. We came up with this idea because we thought it was something fun that people could get involved with, as well as raise a bit of cash to help the environment. We're not going to make anything from this ourselves. Everything will be distributed at cost price, and all extra money goes to Greenpeace. 

So let's get down to brass tax, because we've got a target to hit. We think it will cost us $5 to make each mask once we've included printing and postage. So what's what we'll charge. And anything else you give goes to Greenpeace, to help fight the very real causes and very dangerous effects of Climate Change. So if you give a dollar, that goes to Greenpeace. If you send $5, you get a mask. If you send $10, you get a mask and we donate the extra $5 to Greenpeace.

It's that simple.

In case you didn't get it though, here's a quick recap:

  • You pledge $$$
  • We buy masks
  • You get masks
  • All profits and extra donations to Greenpeace

One final point is that if we don't hit our target, you keep all your hard earned cash. But if that happens, maybe you might consider giving Greenpeace a small donation anyway?
