story:
Deutsch auswählen


Buy a living tree,

and reduce climate change!

Deforestation and Global Warming are prevailing! These are the simple facts: 

Deforestation

Climate Change 1

Climate Change 2

It is important to keep our environment as livable as it is today for our future generations. Therefore we want to sell living trees to the public. 

25 sqm of forest will sell for $25AUD with a guaranteed minimum of one tree on it.

A tree that you own can not be cut.

Be a hero

It is time to make a difference. Now you can show that you care. This is the chance to DO something. Everybody can afford to buy a tree. Do it NOW and share it with the wold.

How it works

The business model is very simple and transparent. You can buy a share of the company that owns the forest. You'll get all the documents such as a share certificate, company titles, and GPS coordinates of your tree/s.  The Australian legal system guarantees long term safety of the forest and your investment.

As a non-for-profit company we would also guarantee by our company constitution to reinvest any surplus into reforestation. 

The best thing is that you get immediate value for your investment. If the campaign is successful (= $250 000 AUD invested), you own the trees which you have already paid for. If not, you'll get your money back. This is how we want to set up the project.

We are very excited about our project, because this has never been done on a global basis before.  We could create a public market for living trees and that would help our environment tremendously.

Benefit for the climate

Trees produce oxygen and take vast amounts of CO2 and other greenhouse gases out of the atmosphere. Trees moderate Earth's temperature; - keeping Earth cooler in Summer and warmer in Winter.

70% of the world's forests have already been cut down and continue to be cut down faster than they are currently being replanted. This is causing extreme Climate Change and Desertification globally.

Reforestation is the ONLY solution!

A tree that you own can not be cut.

According to a study (http://www.sciencemag.org/content/suppl/2013/11...) based on Google Earth we have estimated that there are only 100 trees to each human on this planet left today. With our project you can buy one of these trees for as little as $25. You would get 25 sqm of forest with a guaranteed minimum of 1 tree on it. With an investment of as little as $2500 you can secure enough trees for a lifetime supply of oxygen for yourself.


Perks

1. $25AUD one living tree

You'll get a share certificate and GPS coordinates of the tree. You'll be a proud owner of a living tree, that cannot be cut.

2. $250AUD ten living trees

You'll get ten share certificates and GPS coordinates of the trees. You'll be a proud owner of a tiny living forest that cannot be cleared. You would also get a preview of the tree allocation map and a photo of your trees. 

3. $2500AUD hundred living trees

You'll get one hundred share certificates and GPS coordinates of the trees. You'll be a proud owner of a small living forest that cannot be cleared. You would also get a preview of the tree allocation map and a photo of your trees. If you want to visit your forest, we can organize free entry to the property/forest.

During this visit, you would have the option to place an ownership stone in the middle of your trees with your name carved onto it. It would also say, that you bought those trees in order to protect them. This stone will be placed with the intent to keep it standing for many many generations to come.


Where the money goes

You buy a share of the company. This money will go into buying forests, maintaining forests, reforesting, and company administration. The company, by its constitution, will assign one tree to all shares released by the company.  


Your return on investment

Since 1993 we are observing Australian forest pricing. A forest worth $17,000AUD in 1993 is worth today $115,000AUD. If you compare with interest rates today, or the share market even, this is an incredible return of 9.5% per year! 

With taxes on carbon emission coming soon worldwide, forest owners will get money for their oxygen production. Hence the prices for forests will rise. So next year you can expect the share price for one tree to be $27 already.

As it stands, this investment could be an excellent addition to a retirement fund for job starters. Keep buying one tree each week and you have saved over $200,000 after 30 years. (providing value for trees goes up by 9.5% each year)

A tree that you own can not be cut.

Non-For-Profit
The constitution of the company would guarantee to reinvest any surplus into reforestation and buying forests. It would also state that any trees which get destroyed by natural forces (flood, diseases, ...) will be replaced with other trees at a new location (so you will never loose your trees). The company will cover all costs of maintaining the forests, and keep extending the assets of the company by buying new forests (business plan). The long term goal is to reforest deserted areas, which we have plenty of in Australia.

The Founder

My name is Walter Gith. I was born in Germany and living in Australia now. I studied physics in Germany. After starting an IT career with a consulting company I later worked as a manager in a large corporation for 10 years. For 14 years now, I have been running a small software company in Australia. For as long as I remember I loved trees. I recognize that trees play a large part to keep us alive on this planet as they provide the air we breathe.

You can visit us on Facebook to follow the project.

FAQ

Can I pay with credit or debit card?

Yes, first select ‚Pay with PayPal‘. Then there is an option ‘Pay with a credit or debit card’. After you entered the Card details, you will be asked to use the details to open a PayPal account. But in the same window there is a button that allows you to “Continue’ without creating a PayPal account. Choose this option.  

Can I contribute any amount?

Yes, you don't need to choose a PERK. Any contribution amount that is a multiple of $25AUD will be used to issue shares and attracts the benefits of a $25 PERK. If you contribute $250AUD we will automatically handle this as PERK 2 (accordingly for $2500AUD).   
For obvious reasons please choose multiples of $25 as your contribution/payment amount.

Can I sell, donate, bequeath or give away the share?

Yes. An ownership change request will be necessary. The company register change causes a fee. If you want to give away the share as a present, just put the receivers email address in the first email box that comes up.

Is this campaign restricted to Australia? 

No, this is a worldwide campaign. Everybody in the world is allowed to buy company shares. There is also a German translation of this page further down. Many browsers like Chrome also provide a 'translate page' feature.

How is the relation between tree and share?

You can only buy a living tree (we are not talking about trees form nurseries), if you own the land where it is on. The company buys the land with the trees on it. The share represents the part of the company that equals 25 sqm. The company guarantees by its constitution that there is a minimum of one tree per 25 sqm (this could be verified for you through Google earth).

Where would the forest be bought?

We will start in Australia. Other regions could follow as the company grows.
What is in it for the founder?
The founder is happy that forest is saved. But in case of success he also gets a salary for the administration work. The company's financial reports will be sent to all shareholders.

When the campaign fails, would I get the whole $25AUD back?

YES

What is INDIEGOGO?

It is a crowd-funding platform: Many small single contributors together make an investment in a company. Often is the investment lost. Not in our case. The company would only be founded if the critical sum of $250000 investment is reached. If it is not reached, all participants will get their money back, which is guaranteed by Indiegogo (fixed funding). If reached, everybody gets a share with tree rights attached.


German

Kauft lebendige Bäume

und schützt unser Klima!

Waldrodung und Klimawandel sind Tatsachen: 

Rodung

Klimawandel

Es ist wichtig, unsere Umwelt so lebenswert wie sie heute ist, auch für zukünftige Generationen zu bewahren. Deshalb wollen wir lebendige Bäume zum Kauf anbieten. 

25 qm Wald werden $25AUD kosten, mit einem garantierten Minimum von einem Baum auf dieser Fläche.

Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.

Das Geschäftsmodel ist einfach und durchsichtig. Du kannst eine Aktie der Firma kaufen, die den Wald besitzt. Du wirst alle Dokumente, so wie Aktienzertifikat, Eigentumsrecht und GPS Koordinaten deiner Bäume zugesendet bekommen. Das australische Rechtssystem garantiert die Sicherheit der Bäume und die Stabilität der Eigentumrechte über lange Zeit.

Als eine Firma, die über die Firmensatzung keinen Gewinn erzielen darf, garantieren wir alle Uberschüsse in Waldaufforstung zu investieren. 

Das beste ist, dass Du einen direkten Gegenwert für deine Investition bekommst. Wenn die Kampagne erfolgreich ist (= $250 000 AUD erreicht), wirst Du die Bäume besitzen, die Du schon bezahlt hast. Wenn nicht, bekommst Du dein Geld zurück. So ist diese Kampagne mit Indiegogo gestaltet.

Wir sind stolz auf dieses Projekt, weil so etwas auf globalem Level noch niemals zuvor gemacht wurde. Wir können einen öffentlichen Markt für lebendige Bäume kreieren und dadurch der Umwelt helfen.


Vorteile für die Umwelt

Bäume erzeugen Sauerstoff und nehmen eine große Menge CO2 und andere Treibhausgase aus der Atmosphäre auf. Bäume mässigen die Temperaturen auf der Erde.

70% der Weltbaumbestände sind bereits gerodet und die Rodungen halten an. Es wird mehr gerodet als wieder angebaut. Dies verursacht Klimawandel und Versteppung weltweit.

Aufforstung und Bestandssicherung ist die EINZIGE Lösung!

Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.

Nach einer Studie (http://www.sciencemag.org/content/suppl/2013/11...), basierend auf Google Earth, haben wir geschätzt, dass es heute nur ungefähr 100 Bäume für jeden Mneschen auf dieser Welt gibt. Mit unserem Projekt kannst Du einen dieser Bäume für nur $25AUD kaufen und sichern. Du wirst 25 qm Waldfläche mit einem garantierten Baum darauf bekommen. Mit einer Ausgabe von nur $2500AUD kannst Du genug Bäume sichern, um Dich dein Leben lang mit Sauerstoff zu versorgen.


Leistungen (PERKS)

1. $25AUD ein lebendiger Baum

Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinem Baum. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines lebendigen Baumes, der nicht gefällt werden kann.

2. $250AUD zehn lebendige Bäume

Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinen Bäumen. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines kleinen Waldes, der nicht gerodet werden kann. Du bekommst auch vorab eine Karte mit der Position deiner Bäume und ein Photo. 

3. $2500AUD hundert lebendige Bäume

Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinem Baum. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines kleinen Waldes, der nicht gerodet werden kann. Du bekommst auch vorab eine Karte mit der Position deiner Bäume und ein Photo. Wenn Du deinen Wald besuchen möchtest, können wir nach Absprache eine kostenlose Besichtigung vor Ort organisieren. 

Während des Besuches wirst Du die Möglichkeit haben, einen Besitzerstein mitten in deinen Wald zu legen. Er wird Deinen Namen und Deine weitsichtige Entscheidung den Wald zu kaufen, eingraviert haben.


Wo das Geld verwendet wird

Du kaufst eine Aktie einer australischen Aktiengesellschaft. Das eingenommene Geld wird für den Waldkauf, Waldpflege, Aufforstung und Firmenunkosten verwendet. Die Firma wird, festgeschrieben in der Firmensatzung, jeder Aktie die ausgegeben wird einen Baum zuordnen.  


Vorteil deiner Investition

Wir beobachten seit 1993 australische Waldpreise. Ein Wald der 1993 für $17,000AUD angeboten wurde, ist heute $115,000AUD wert. Wenn Du das mit Zinsen oder sogar dem Aktienmarkt vergleichst, ist das eine Rendite von sage und schreibe 9,5% pro Jahr! 

Auf weltweiter Ebene werden in allen Ländern bald Steuern auf CO2 Emission erhoben werden. Waldbesitzer werden eine Steuergutschrift für ihre Sauerstoffproduktion bekommen. (In Australien gab es das schon -carbon tax- und wird es wahrscheinlich mit der nächsten Regierung auch wieder geben :)) Daher werden die Preise für Wald weltweit ansteigen. Du kannst erwarten, dass nächstes Jahr der Preis für eine Aktie (ein Baum) schon $27AUD sein wird.

Wie es aussieht, kann dieser Baumkauf als langfristige Anlage gesehen werden, die sogar als Rentenbeitrag geeignet wäre. Kaufe jede Woche einen Baum und Du wirst in nach 30 Jahren über $200,000AUD besitzen. (vorausgesetzt der Wert von Bäumen steigt jedes Jahr um ca. 9.5%)

Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.

Reinvestitionsverpflichtung
Die Satzung der Firma wird vorschreiben, dass anfallende Gewinne in Waldpflege und Waldaufbau reinvestiert werden. Die Satzung wird ebenfalls garantieren, dass Bäume die durch Naturgewalten zerstört worden sind (z.b. Waldbrand) durch neue Bäume ersetzt werden. (Dein Baumrecht wird niemals verloren gehen) Die Firma wird alle Kosten für diese Waldpflege übernehmen und den Waldbestand weiter ausbauen.(Geschäftsplan). Das langfristige Ziel ist auch die Aufforstung versteppter Gebiete, von denen es in Australien jede Menge gibt.

Der Initiator

Mein Name ist Walter Gith, geboren in Deutschland und ansässig in Australien. Ich habe in Deutschland Physik studiert. Nach einer Laufbahn in IT bei einer Unternehmensberatung habe ich 10 Jahre im Management eines großen Industriegiganten gearbeitet. Seit 14 Jahren habe ich meine eigene Softwarefirma in Australien. Solange ich mich erinnere, habe ich Bäume geliebt. Ich erkannte früh, dass Bäume eine große Rolle dabei spielen, uns am Leben zu erhalten. Sie stellen den Sauerstoff bereit, den wir atmen.

Du kannst uns auf Facebook besuchen, um den Verlauf des Pojekts zu verfolgen.

Häufig gestellte Fragen

Kann ich mit Kreditkarte bezahlen?

Ja, zuerst 'mit PayPal bezahlen' auswählen. Dann gibt es eine Option 'mit Kreditkarte bezahlen'. Danach werden die Kartendetails eingetragen (inkl. Adresse, Telefon, ...). Nach diesem Fenster kommt die Aufforderung, mit den eingegebenen Details, ein PayPal Konto zu eröffnen. Hier gibt es aber auch eine Schaltfläche 'Continnue', die erlaubt ohne Konto weiterzugehen. Diese Option wählen.

Kann ich einen beliebigen Betrag beitragen/einzahlen?

Ja, Du musst keinen PERK auswählen. Jede Unterstützung/Zahlung die ein vielfaches von $25AUD ist, wird wie ein PERK behandelt. D.h. es wird eine Aktie pro $25 zugewiesen.
Aus ersichtlichen Gründen, ist es sinnvoll einen Betrag beizusteuern, der ein vielfaches von $25AUD ist.

Kann ich meine Aktie verkaufen, spenden, vererben oder verschenken?

Ja. Ein Besitzerwechsel muss zu gegebener Zeit  im Firmenregister eingetragen werden. Für die Änderung des Registereintrags fällt eine Gebühr an. Wenn es ein Geschenk sein soll, bitte die Emailadresse des Empfängers im Email feld eintragen.

Ist diese Kampagne auf Australien beschränkt? 

Nein, dies ist eine weltweite Aktion. Jeder in der Welt kann Aktien einer Firma kaufen. Es kann Beschränkungen in der Menge geben, hier sind die Gegebenheiten zu überprüfen. Es gibt eine deutsche und englische Version dieser Seite, aber viele Browser so wie Chrome haben auch eine Übersetzungsfunktion. 

Wie ist das Verhältnis zwischen Baum und Aktie?

Du kannst nur einen lebendigen Baum besitzen, wenn Du auch das Land besitzt wo er steht. Die Firma kauft das Land mit den Bäumen darauf. Die Aktie repräsentiert das Besitzrecht über 25 qm. Die Firma wiederum garantiert über ihre Satzung, dass auf 25 qm mindestens ein Baum steht (dies kann über Google Earth überprüft werden).

Wo wird der Wald gekauft?

Wir werden in Australien anfangen, aber andere Regionen können später folgen.
Was hat der Initiator davon?
Der Initiator freut sich, dass Wald gerettet wird. Bei Erfolg bekommt er aber auch ein Gehalt für die Verwaltung der Firma. Der Finanzreport der Firma wird jährlich an alle Aktionäre versendet.

Wenn das Ziel nicht erreicht wird, würde ich dann die vollen $25AUD zurück bekommen?

JA

Was ist INDIEGOGO?
Es ist eine sogenannte 'Crowd-Funding' Plattform. Viele kleine Investoren finanzieren gemeinsam in eine Firma. Oft ist die Investition erfolglos und das Geld ist weg. Nicht in unserem Fall. Die Firma wird nur gegründet, wenn die kritische Summe von $250000AuD zusammenkommt. Wenn die Summe nicht zusammenkommt, bekommt jeder sein Geld zurück, dies wird auch von Indiegogo gewährleistet (fixed funding). Kommt die Summe zustande, bekommt jeder einen sofortigen Gegenwert, nämlich die Aktie inkl. Baumrecht.

It would also say, that you bought those trees in order to protect them. This stone will be placed with the intent to keep it standing for many many generations to come.

Where the money goes
You buy a share of the company. This money will go into buying forests, maintaining forests, reforesting, and company administration. The company, by its constitution, will assign one tree to all shares released by the company.  

Your return on investment

Since 1993 we are observing Australian forest pricing. A forest worth $17,000AUD in 1993 is worth today $115,000AUD. If
you compare with interest rates today, or the share market even, this is an incredible
return of 9.5% per year! 

With taxes on carbon emission coming soon worldwide, forest
owners will get money for their oxygen production. Hence the prices for forests
will rise. So next year you can expect the share price for one tree to be $27
already.
As it stands, this investment could be an excellent addition to a retirement fund for job starters. Keep buying one tree each week and you have saved over $200,000 after 30 years. (providing value for trees goes up by 9.5% each year)
A tree that you own can not be cut.

Non-For-Profit

The constitution of the company would guarantee to reinvest any surplus into reforestation and buying forests. It would also state that any trees which get destroyed by natural forces (flood, diseases, ...) will be replaced with other trees at a new location (so you will never loose your trees). The company will cover all costs of maintaining the forests, and keep extending the assets of the company by buying new forests (business plan). The long term goal is to reforest deserted areas, which we have plenty of in Australia.
The Founder

My name is Walter Gith. I was born in Germany and living in Australia now. I studied physics in Germany. After starting an IT career with a consulting company I later worked as a manager in a large corporation for 10 years. For 14 years now, I have been running a small software company in Australia. For as long as I remember I loved trees. I recognize that trees play a large part to keep us alive on this planet as they provide the air we breathe.
You can visit us on Facebook to follow the project.



FAQ

Can I pay with credit or debit card?
Yes,
first select ‚Pay with PayPal‘. Then there is an option ‘Pay with a credit or debit
card’. After you entered the Card details, you will be asked to use the
details to open a PayPal account. But in the same window there is a button that
allows you to “Continue’ without creating a PayPal account. Choose this option.  
Can I contribute any amount?
Yes, you don't need to choose a PERK. Any contribution amount that is a multiple of $25AUD will be used to issue shares and attracts the benefits of a $25 PERK. If you contribute $250AUD we will automatically handle this as PERK 2 (accordingly for $2500AUD).   
For obvious reasons please choose multiples of $25 as your contribution/payment amount.
Can I sell, donate, bequeath or give away the share?
Yes. An ownership change request will be necessary. The company register change causes a fee. If you want to give away the share as a present, just put the receivers email address in the first email box that comes up.
Is this campaign restricted to Australia? 
No, this is a worldwide campaign. Everybody in the world is allowed to buy company shares. There is also a German translation of this page further down. Many browsers like Chrome also provide a 'translate page' feature.
How is the relation between tree and share?
You can only buy a living tree (we are not talking about trees form nurseries), if you own the land where it is on. The company buys the land with the trees on it. The share represents the part of the company that equals 25 sqm. The company guarantees by its constitution that there is a minimum of one tree per 25 sqm (this could be verified for you through Google earth).

Where would the forest be bought?We will start in Australia. Other regions could follow as the company grows.
What is in it for the founder?

The founder is happy that forest is saved. But in case of success he also gets a salary for the administration work. The company's financial reports will be sent to all shareholders.
When the campaign fails, would I get the whole $25AUD back?
YES
What is INDIEGOGO?
It is a crowd-funding platform: Many small single contributors together make an investment in a company. Often is the investment lost. Not in our case. The company would only be founded if the critical sum of $250000 investment is reached. If it is not reached, all participants will get their money back, which is guaranteed by Indiegogo (fixed funding). If reached, everybody gets a share with tree rights attached.


German

Kauft lebendige Bäume
und schützt unser Klima!

Waldrodung und Klimawandel sind Tatsachen: 
Rodung
Klimawandel 

Es ist wichtig, unsere Umwelt so lebenswert wie sie heute ist, auch für zukünftige Generationen zu bewahren. Deshalb wollen wir lebendige Bäume zum Kauf anbieten. 

25 qm Wald werden $25AUD kosten, mit einem garantierten Minimum von einem Baum auf dieser Fläche.

Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.
Das Geschäftsmodel ist einfach und durchsichtig. Du kannst eine Aktie der Firma kaufen, die den Wald besitzt. Du wirst alle Dokumente, so wie Aktienzertifikat, Eigentumsrecht und GPS Koordinaten deiner Bäume zugesendet bekommen. Das australische Rechtssystem garantiert die Sicherheit der Bäume und die Stabilität der Eigentumrechte über lange Zeit.

Als eine Firma, die über die Firmensatzung keinen Gewinn erzielen darf, garantieren wir alle Uberschüsse in Waldaufforstung zu investieren. 
Das beste ist, dass Du einen direkten Gegenwert für deine Investition bekommst. Wenn die Kampagne erfolgreich ist (= $250 000 AUD erreicht), wirst Du die Bäume besitzen, die Du schon bezahlt hast. Wenn nicht, bekommst Du dein Geld zurück. So ist diese Kampagne mit Indiegogo gestaltet.
Wir sind stolz auf dieses Projekt, weil so etwas auf globalem Level noch niemals zuvor gemacht wurde. Wir können einen öffentlichen Markt für lebendige Bäume kreieren und dadurch der Umwelt helfen.

Vorteile für die Umwelt

Bäume erzeugen Sauerstoff und nehmen eine große Menge CO2 und andere Treibhausgase aus der Atmosphäre auf. Bäume mässigen die Temperaturen auf der Erde.
70% der Weltbaumbestände sind bereits gerodet und die Rodungen halten an. Es wird mehr gerodet als wieder angebaut. Dies verursacht Klimawandel und Versteppung weltweit.

Aufforstung und Bestandssicherung ist die EINZIGE Lösung!
Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.
Nach einer Studie (http://www.sciencemag.org/content/suppl/2013/11...), basierend auf Google Earth, haben wir geschätzt, dass es heute nur ungefähr 100 Bäume für jeden Mneschen auf dieser Welt gibt. Mit unserem Projekt kannst Du einen dieser Bäume für nur $25AUD kaufen und sichern. Du wirst 25 qm Waldfläche mit einem garantierten Baum darauf bekommen. Mit einer Ausgabe von nur $2500AUD kannst Du genug Bäume sichern, um Dich dein Leben lang mit Sauerstoff zu versorgen.





Leistungen (PERKS)
1. $25AUD ein lebendiger Baum
Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinem Baum. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines lebendigen Baumes, der nicht gefällt werden kann.
2. $250AUD zehn lebendige Bäume
Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinen Bäumen. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines kleinen Waldes, der nicht gerodet werden kann. Du bekommst auch vorab eine Karte mit der Position deiner Bäume und ein Photo. 
3. $2500AUD hundert lebendige Bäume
Du bekommst ein Aktienzertifikat und die GPS Koordinaten von Deinem Baum. Dann bist Du ein stolzer Besitzer eines kleinen Waldes, der nicht gerodet werden kann. Du bekommst auch vorab eine Karte mit der Position deiner Bäume und ein Photo. Wenn Du deinen Wald besuchen möchtest, können wir nach Absprache eine kostenlose Besichtigung vor Ort organisieren. 
Während des Besuches wirst Du die Möglichkeit haben, einen Besitzerstein mitten in deinen Wald zu legen. Er wird Deinen Namen und Deine weitsichtige Entscheidung den Wald zu kaufen, eingraviert haben. 

Wo das Geld verwendet wird
Du kaufst eine Aktie einer australischen Aktiengesellschaft. Das eingenommene Geld wird für den Waldkauf, Waldpflege, Aufforstung und Firmenunkosten verwendet. Die Firma wird, festgeschrieben in der Firmensatzung, jeder Aktie die ausgegeben wird einen Baum zuordnen.  

Vorteil deiner Investition

Wir beobachten seit 1993 australische Waldpreise. Ein Wald der 1993 für $17,000AUD angeboten wurde, ist heute $115,000AUD wert. Wenn Du das mit Zinsen oder sogar dem Aktienmarkt vergleichst, ist das eine Rendite von sage und schreibe 9,5% pro Jahr! 

Auf weltweiter Ebene werden in allen Ländern bald Steuern auf CO2 Emission erhoben werden. Waldbesitzer werden eine Steuergutschrift für ihre Sauerstoffproduktion bekommen. (In Australien gab es das schon -carbon tax- und wird es wahrscheinlich mit der nächsten Regierung auch wieder geben :)) Daher werden die Preise für Wald weltweit ansteigen. Du kannst erwarten, dass nächstes Jahr der Preis für eine Aktie (ein Baum) schon $27AUD sein wird.
Wie es aussieht, kann dieser Baumkauf als langfristige Anlage gesehen werden, die sogar als Rentenbeitrag geeignet wäre. Kaufe jede Woche einen Baum und Du wirst in nach 30 Jahren über $200,000AUD besitzen. (vorausgesetzt der Wert von Bäumen steigt jedes Jahr um ca. 9.5%)
Ein Baum den Du besitzt, kann nicht gefällt werden.

Reinvestitionsverpflichtung

Die Satzung der Firma wird vorschreiben, dass anfallende Gewinne in Waldpflege und Waldaufbau reinvestiert werden. Die Satzung wird ebenfalls garantieren, dass Bäume die durch Naturgewalten zerstört worden sind (z.b. Waldbrand) durch neue Bäume ersetzt werden. (Dein Baumrecht wird niemals verloren gehen) Die Firma wird alle Kosten für diese Waldpflege übernehmen und den Waldbestand weiter ausbauen.(Geschäftsplan). Das langfristige Ziel ist auch die Aufforstung versteppter Gebiete, von denen es in Australien jede Menge gibt.
Der Initiator

Mein Name ist Walter Gith, geboren in Deutschland und ansässig in Australien. Ich habe in Deutschland Physik studiert. Nach einer Laufbahn in IT bei einer Unternehmensberatung habe ich 10 Jahre im Management eines großen Industriegiganten gearbeitet. Seit 14 Jahren habe ich meine eigene Softwarefirma in Australien. Solange ich mich erinnere, habe ich Bäume geliebt. Ich erkannte früh, dass Bäume eine große Rolle dabei spielen, uns am Leben zu erhalten. Sie stellen den Sauerstoff bereit, den wir atmen.
Du kannst uns auf Facebook besuchen, um den Verlauf des Pojekts zu verfolgen.



Häufig gestellte Fragen

Kann ich mit Kreditkarte bezahlen?

Ja, zuerst 'mit PayPal bezahlen' auswählen. Dann gibt es
eine Option 'mit Kreditkarte bezahlen'. Danach werden die Kartendetails
eingetragen (inkl. Adresse, Telefon, ...). Nach diesem Fenster kommt die
Aufforderung, mit den eingegebenen Details, ein PayPal Konto zu eröffnen. Hier
gibt es aber auch eine Schaltfläche 'Continnue', die
erlaubt ohne Konto weiterzugehen. Diese Option wählen.

Kann ich einen beliebigen Betrag beitragen/einzahlen?
Ja, Du musst keinen PERK auswählen. Jede Unterstützung/Zahlung die ein vielfaches von $25AUD ist, wird wie ein PERK behandelt. D.h. es wird eine Aktie pro $25 zugewiesen.

Aus ersichtlichen Gründen, ist es sinnvoll einen Betrag beizusteuern, der ein vielfaches von $25AUD ist.

Kann ich meine Aktie verkaufen, spenden, vererben oder verschenken?
Ja. Ein Besitzerwechsel muss zu gegebener Zeit  im Firmenregister eingetragen werden. Für die Änderung  des Registereintrags fällt eine Gebühr an. Wenn es ein Geschenk sein soll, bitte die Emailadresse des Empfängers im Email feld eintragen.
Ist diese Kampagne auf Australien beschränkt? 
Nein, dies ist eine weltweite Aktion. Jeder in der Welt kann Aktien einer Firma kaufen. Es kann Beschränkungen in der Menge geben, hier sind die Gegebenheiten zu überprüfen. Es gibt eine deutsche und englische Version dieser Seite, aber viele Browser so wie Chrome haben auch eine Übersetzungsfunktion. 
Wie ist das Verhältnis zwischen Baum und Aktie?
Du kannst nur einen lebendigen Baum besitzen, wenn Du auch das Land besitzt wo er steht. Die Firma kauft das Land mit den Bäumen darauf. Die Aktie repräsentiert das Besitzrecht über 25 qm. Die Firma wiederum garantiert über ihre Satzung, dass auf 25 qm mindestens ein Baum steht (dies kann über Google Earth überprüft werden).

Wo wird der Wald gekauft?Wir werden in Australien anfangen, aber andere Regionen können später folgen.
Was hat der Initiator davon?

Der Initiator freut sich, dass Wald gerettet wird. Bei Erfolg bekommt er aber auch ein Gehalt für die Verwaltung der Firma. Der Finanzreport der Firma wird jährlich an alle Aktionäre versendet.

Wenn das Ziel nicht erreicht wird, würde ich dann die vollen $25AUD zurück bekommen?
JA


Was ist INDIEGOGO?

Es ist eine sogenannte 'Crowd-Funding' Plattform. Viele kleine Investoren finanzieren gemeinsam in eine Firma. Oft ist die Investition erfolglos und das Geld ist weg. Nicht in unserem Fall. Die Firma wird nur gegründet, wenn die kritische Summe von $250000AuD zusammenkommt. Wenn die Summe nicht zusammenkommt, bekommt jeder sein Geld zurück, dies wird auch von Indiegogo gewährleistet (fixed funding). Kommt die Summe zustande, bekommt jeder einen sofortigen Gegenwert, nämlich die Aktie inkl. Baumrecht.

story:
Here at OP Foundation , we firmly believe that humans will always be the heart of the planet. However, we understand that as we step further into the future the virtual and digital world will fill a larger and larger part of everyone’s lives. As upcoming generations spend the majority of their time on the web , we are convinced that this could be a perfect place for them to be educated to respect this planet. But we can't expect to thoroughly communicate with them if we are not even capable of speaking their language. That's why we have thought about the birth of “OP ” , a model of an ideal land located on Earth2.io , a futuristic concept for a second virtual 1:1 scale version of earth

Let us explain such a metaverse : imagine something in between virtual and physical reality, in which real-world geolocations on a sectioned map correspond to user generated digital virtual environments. These environments can be owned, bought and sold;  In the next phase , in addition to the existing locations around the world,  users will be able to build their own custom virtual cities, also known as "Megacities", and to create their own avatars to explore this world through VR

                                                                                                        

 

We truly believe that the creation of this digital world is an immense opportunity for us to succeed where others failed... to have the chance of a new beginning

We have the opportunity to create together an ideal land, built in synergy with nature, based on harmony, happiness and respect for all of its inhabitants

We have the opportunity to finally create a community where it matters not your gender, ethnic or religious background, your sexual orientation or your social status

We have the opportunity to inspire young generations to build a world far better than the one we have today

We can show them how to live in peace together...How to live by taking care of the enviroment to acknowledge that we are guests on this planet...not owners

A place that can be a model for the cities of the future and, most importantly, a way to lead and educate the citizens of the future

We’ve been on Earth2 since January 2021, with over 1500 tiles owned and a property value of 7000 dollars , and our dream is to build  “OP”  fully immersed in nature...in a complex of several paradisiac islands (info about coordinates will be released in the next phase),  designed to be futuristic and innovative at the same time, but as the price of land goes up daily we need your help to acquire the entire designated area and to create a solid team made up of experts in human rights, engineering, architecture, social coexistence, urban developments, wellbeing, pollution and environment, that can ensure the correct development of “OP ”.

Our goal is to create a perfect model of cities that are green, modern, colorful  and totally self-sustainable... to create a community made of people investing in the future, still believing in a better future

                                     

We know that the only way to be successful in this ambitious project is to ensure that every detail is perfectly executed

We are what we repeatedly do, therefore excellence is a habit not an act. Even though we know it's just a virtual starting point, we aim to create a new way of communicating and living in real life

We are simply faced with a choice...We can rise again as humanity, or we'll be slowly cleared away, one by one, as humans. Our time is limited, the future depends on what we do today

We still believe that not everything is lost , We can turn this vision into reality

We need you to make some noise out of there...tell your family, friends, colleagues and strangers about OP...share this page on your social networks 

Every single act, even the smallest one, can make the difference, nothing change unless you do

 

We need you to believe again

We need you to hOPe again

story:
Pound info

The pound currently has 650+ dog residents and three Thai staff to care for them. There is a small, dedicated team of volunteers who are working alongside the government to try and improve the lives of the dogs in every way possible. 

What We Need

We are always in need of basic supplies to keep the place running!

Essential items are always needed. Our dream is to have a full store cupboard ready for the rainy season! 

We have set a goal of £2000 (83,351 thb). This is a huge amount of money for us and would allow us to fill the store cupboards with wet food and cleaning materials, ready for the rainy season. We also would love to be able to make the dog runs more comfortable by creating more shaded areas to protect the dogs from the elements and some comfy beds for the dogs living in small enclosures. 

The Impact

Every single donation means the world to us. The dogs at the pound deserve a happy and healthy life. The pound is improving every day and your donation will help to speed the process up! Every single penny donated to us is used directly to help the dogs. 

Risks & Challenges

Anyone that spends time at the dog pound knows that it isn't easy! Every day there are new challenges and difficult decisions have to be made. The key to us being able to overcome anything is team work. We need a strong team of volunteers, staff and SUPPORTERS! Money doesn't buy love, the dogs already get love by the bucket load, but it buys us the chance to make the pound a better place for them to live

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we understand that! 

  • Please, please, please, share our campaign and share our Facebook and Instagram pages!
  • People need to know the Pound exists.
  • If you're ever in Phuket please pop by to say hello and to meet it's famous residents, volunteers are always needed.
  • ADOPT DON'T SHOP.

ADOPT DON'T SHOP.

story:
Bref résumé


Cette maison c'est ma vie ! 20000 euros, c'est l'apport que je souhaite présenter aux banques pour les convaincre de me faire un prêt pour acheter et rénover une maison naturelle et traditionnelle.

English presentation :

It's the story of one man, me, Amiel ,35 years, handicaped. In France when you've got this statut, you can't pretend to have money from banks.
That's why I need crowdfunding to help me asking a credit from banks : 20000 € on 60000 € (price of the house).
Natural technics will be use for the restoration. You can see video/picture down the pitch.
Thanks a lot !

Présentation

Je suis Amiel, passionné par l'habitat, l'artisanat, traditionnel et vernaculaire.

  • Ex-chaumier, aujourd'hui handicapé, je travail sur un projet (CenTs Terres) sur les thèmes précédents.
  • Dans l'impossibilité de faire un prêt sans apport à cause de mon handicap, je me tourne naturellement vers le CrowdFunding et la communauté solidaire. Pour acquérir une maison et la rénover selon des règles simples : patrimoine, nature et localité.

Voici la maison (Son prix 60000 €)

Son devenir : 

Chaumière réalisée par mon ami Maxime

Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez :

De l'aide pour l'achat, le reste je me débrouille: chantiers participatifs, aide des copains !

  • Votre participation sert donc à une chose unique : l'achat de la maison à rénover !
  • Bien sûr, une fois la maison et le jardin aménagés, j’accueillerai volontiers mes soutiens, pour une visite du chantier, une visite du projet fini ou bien quelques nuits en CouchSurfing.
  • Dans ce pays, pas loin de la Brière :


Le projet :

A l'image de Natural Homes, c'est un projet entièrement basé sur l'écologie et la vie au naturel.

  • Me soutenir, c'est permettre aussi de montrer que ce genre de projet (une maison écologique pas si chère) est viable.
  • Et que ce qui se fait dans le monde est encore possible en France (Matériaux locaux : terre, bois, et végétation).
  •  Un exemple en vidéo avec un ami maçon terre crue :

  • Il nous (moi et mon réseau) prendra quelques années pour réaliser ce projet mais nous y arriverons sans nul doute.

Risques et défis

  • Mon Handicap peut me jouer des tours, mais il s'agit du rêve d'une vie, et je pense pouvoir mobiliser mon entourage pour me soutenir.
  • La nature m'a appris une chose : c'est d'essayer, et si c'est difficile, de réessayer et c'est pourquoi, je fais appel à vous.

D'autres façons d'aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  • Si mon projet vous touche, n'hésitez pas à le partager.
  • Les réseaux sociaux et les outils de partage Indiegogo sont là pour ça !

Merci !

Bonus : (les techniques employées)

  • Le chaume :

  • La terre crue :

  • Du colombage fabriqué ainsi :  

  • Et en cadeau, mon modeste travail : 


NB : si la vente de la maison était faite entre temps à une autre personne que moi, l'argent récolté irait dans la création d'une entreprise de chaume et charpente.

Natural technics will be use for the restoration. You can see video/picture down the pitch.
Thanks a lot !

Dans l'impossibilité de faire un prêt sans apport à cause de mon handicap, je me tourne naturellement vers le CrowdFunding et la communauté solidaire. Pour acquérir une maison et la rénover selon des règles simples : patrimoine, nature et localité.



Voici la maison (Son prix 60000 €)


Son devenir : 

Chaumière réalisée par mon ami Maxime



Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez :
De l'aide pour l'achat, le reste je me débrouille: chantiers participatifs, aide des copains !

Votre participation sert donc à une chose unique : l'achat de la maison à rénover !


Bien sûr, une fois la maison et le jardin aménagés, j’accueillerai volontiers mes soutiens, pour une visite du chantier, une visite du projet fini ou bien quelques nuits en CouchSurfing.
Dans ce pays, pas loin de la Brière :






Le projet :
A l'image de Natural Homes, c'est un projet entièrement basé sur l'écologie et la vie au naturel.

Me soutenir, c'est permettre aussi de montrer que ce genre de projet (une maison écologique pas si chère) est viable.
Et que ce qui se fait dans le monde est encore possible en France (Matériaux locaux : terre, bois, et végétation).
 Un exemple en vidéo avec un ami maçon terre crue :



Il nous (moi et mon réseau) prendra quelques années pour réaliser ce projet mais nous y arriverons sans nul doute.


Risques et défis


Mon Handicap peut me jouer des tours, mais il s'agit du rêve d'une vie, et je pense pouvoir mobiliser mon entourage pour me soutenir.


La nature m'a appris une chose : c'est d'essayer, et si c'est difficile, de réessayer et c'est pourquoi, je fais appel à vous.



D'autres façons d'aider
Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

Si mon projet vous touche, n'hésitez pas à le partager.
Les réseaux sociaux et les outils de partage Indiegogo sont là pour ça !

Merci !Bonus : (les techniques employées)
Le chaume :



La terre crue :



Du colombage fabriqué ainsi :  



Et en cadeau, mon modeste travail : 
NB : si la vente de la maison était faite entre temps à une autre personne que moi, l'argent récolté irait dans la création d'une entreprise de chaume et charpente.

story:
THE PROJECT

 

A pencil is a universal product used by people of all divides; be it race, religion, demographic, age and sex. Pencils are used in learning and creative works by students, designers, architects, planners and for some office duties. Pencils have stood the test of time. Without doubt, they will continue to be important components of our daily activities.  

 

BUT DO YOU KNOW? 

 

About 15 billion pencils are made worldwide every year. This means about 88,000  trees are cut down yearly. This is tragic, and its environmental impact is devastating! Trees are life. Quality of life on Earth depends on the number of trees around. Less trees is undoubtedly a threat to human survival.

 

 Global warming is seriously challenging life on Earth.  Cutting down this huge numbers of trees contribute greatly to this disturbing phenomenon. 

 

We've got to change.

 

 

 This is the reason why as a group of young and enterprising individuals in Ghana that are yearning to contribute our quota towards saving our Earth  from the worsening climatic condition, We came up with the idea of making pencils from recycled newspapers and magazines which are usually littered or improperly disposed and hence, creating serious environmental problems.

 

 

 

Our ECOLOPH pencils are as hard as wood but easy to sharpen.  They don't contain any chemicals and are of higher quality.

 

 

 

AND MORE ABOUT OUR ECOLOPH PENCILS IS THAT.....

We prioritise the demands and feelings of people. So we do customised branding on every ECOLOPH  pencil we make to satisfy the taste of people.  

 

  We do this to create some form of attachment between a person and an ECOLOPH  pencil we create.

 

 

ECOLOPH  pencils can therefore be used as special presents to your loved ones, as gifts and donations and also as portable billboards for the dissemination of information to people.

 

 

 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT to get standard machines  to perfect our manufacturing process and also increase our production capacity to make our impact significant. 

 

The project will be far from being successful without your SUPPORT.  

 

Here are few reasons why you should be part of this life changing project;

 

. 1. For every 30 inch stack of Newspaper  recycled for these pencils a 20 feet tall tree will be spared. This will contribute towards the improvement of the ecosystem and thus combating global warming. 

 

2. Also recycling a ton of Newspaper saves 3 cubic yards of landfill space, 7,000 gallons of water and enough energy to power an average home for six months. 

 

3. For every $5 (or above)  you support us with, we will make a number of pencils (depending on the amount) , brand them according to your taste and give them to a needy child on your behalf.  This will go a long way to help the many needy children in Ghana struggling with basic educational materials such as pencils.

 

( Details of our various perks can be found in the perks section of this campaign )

 

4.  Finally apart from the fact that this will promote and conserve the ecosystem, it will provide jobs for people( Especially the youth and women) and thus alleviating poverty.

 

This is important.  More people will have an opportunity to a decent and productive life. 

 

 

Remember every cent that will be spent on this project will be fine-tuned into  GREENING our world again

 

 

 

Production and Fulfillment plan

May to July --- Funding

July to August--- sponsors feedback questionaire and acquisition of standard machines

August to September--- Production of Ecloph Pencils

October---- Delivery of perks

THE TEAM 

A venture is basically as good as the people running it. With this in mind we have put together a strong, innovative and creative team for the management of the project.

MOHAMMED MUSTAPHA ABDULAI--- Co- Leader of project

( A very innovatve young entrepreneur.  He runs a community educational project.)

Dawud Zakaria Yakub-- Co- Leader of Project

(An energetic enterprising young man. He always comes out with creative solutions to problems)

Abdul Wakil Abubakar----  Designer

(He is one of the guy behind our designs. He knows how to fascinate minds with incredible designs)

Huzaifa Napari A. ---- Production adviser.

( He supervises the production process.  He's incredibly driven to do his work)

 

 

( He is highly motivated. Ramadan works closely with Abdul Wakil to bring out the best of designs for our project )

Risk and Challenges

Every project has its challenges. But our team is committed to ensuring that we have a smooth and extremely successful indiegogo campaign. Our main challenge will be getting the standard machines on time to help us deliver on our promises according to our timeplan. Fortunately we have already contacted potential suppliers  and disccussed our plans with them. They have expressed thier willingness to help us deliver on time.

story:
Greenhouse gases emissions caused by human activities

 

 

Humankind has emitted more than 2,000 gigatons of CO₂ since 1750 (1 gigaton = 10⁹ metric tons) and has destroyed more than 3.5 x  10⁹ hectares of previously vegetated ecosystems in the approximately 10,000 years since agriculture became widespread. After the widespread implementation of agriculture, only a very small number of people have led completely sustainable lifestyles, and since fossil fuels became the most potent energy source exploited by humankind an ever smaller number of individuals have led sustainable and carbon neutral lifestyles. 

 


All of us who live in industrialized, consumerist societies generate significant greenhouse gases emissions from all the industrially produced goods and services we consume every year. Data generated by the US Department of Energy's CDIAC for 2011 shows that the most efficient economies among developed nations are located in the European Union, as their populations only average 8.6 metric tons of CO₂ equivalent emissions per capita per year while having some of the highest standards of living in the world. Japan, in turn, averages 9.3 MT CO₂ e per capita per year, while Russia is at 12.6 MT CO₂ e. Canada, Australia and the USA all are among the largest polluters in the world with 14.1, 16.5 and 17 MT CO₂ e per capita per year respectively. The Arab petroleum exporting countries have the least efficient economies in the world in terms of production to emissions, with all of them averaging significantly more than 20 MT CO₂ e per capita per year. India and China, which are the two countries with the largest populations in the world, are still far below this levels of emissions, with only 1.7 and 7.2 MT CO₂ e per capita per year respectively. 

 


Highly accurate estimates of the annual and cumulative historical emissions generated by any individual, household or corporation can be obtained at any of the myriad of carbon footprint calculators that are freely available over the internet. 

 


The city of Las Vegas and unsustainability

 

 

It is perfectly known and established that Las Vegas is one of the cities furthest away from financial and ecological sustainability in the history of the world. Las Vegas is one the largest desert cities in the world, it has a permanent population of around 2.5 million people and receives more than 40 million visitors each year. Food consumption is consequently huge, but local production in Clark County is practically nonexistent. USDA data shows that less than 1% of the edibles consumed in Las Vegas are produced locally as the city is instead supplied from distant places at a huge financial and ecological cost. Las Vegas's entire water supply is diverted a great distance all the way from the Colorado River and practically 100% of the products it collectively consumes are supplied from distant locations at a steep financial and ecological cost . Las Vegas also consumes energy and electricity nowhere near the levels of what it could produce sustainably from renewable sources on its own.

 


– greening Las Vegas – is a project about ecosystem regeneration and the USA is the perfect country to start regenerating ecosystems in. The USA is the biggest originator of greenhouse gases emissions in world history and the USA also has the largest current emissions of all countries at both an aggregate and per capita levels.

 

 

Destruction of forested areas is another one of the main causes of anthropogenic global climate disruption and the USA is also among the countries that have degraded the most land in history. From approximately 1600 to 1920, the immigrants of European origin who colonized the land that eventually became the USA caused the permanent deforestation of around 30% of the forested area in the territory (122,000,000 hectares or 1,220,000 km² of forests were lost) and destroyed 90% of what previously had been virgin forests.

 


Methodologies and impact

 


– greening Las Vegas – would be a demonstration site for the USA that would aim to prove to an audience as wide as possible that it is perfectly feasible to sustainably and productively regenerate ecosystems in large scale anywhere in the world. The principal objective for this project is to sustainably afforest 8 hectares of land that are currently permanent desert, permanently sequester more than 4,000 metric tons of CO₂ and sustainably and locally produce tens of tons of superior quality organic food in Las Vegas. All this would be achieved by increasing the biomass on the site to the maximum levels at which the regenerated ecosystem can be self sustaining and self sufficient. Carbon is the main building block in biomass, constituting 45% of the dry mass of plants in average. Humus, or topsoil, is an even more concentrated deposit of carbon, with 58% of its its mass being carbon in average.  Therefore, forests act as carbon sinks with up to 50% of their total biomass and humus being made up of carbon. 

 


The designed forests that this project would establish would utilize no agrochemicals, no motorized irrigation from the city's water supply, would need no agricultural machinery to do work on them and their yields would require no processing or long distance transportation to reach their destination. These systems would be truly sustainable as they would rely only on naturally occurring local resources like: naturally occurring sunlight incidence, rainfall and condensation, natural fertilizers like compost and plant nutrients that are freely available in the atmosphere. As sustainable designed forests rely exclusively on renewable energy and resources, make no use of fossil fuels or external inputs once established and the amount of CO₂ / C they sequester can exceed the amount of CO₂ that is emitted to set the whole system up by a factor of more than 30 times, these setups are heavily carbon negative.

 


In our selected location, the first operations would be to carry out earthworks on the plot to improve the landscape's water retention and storage capacities. Hardy plants that are adapted to the local conditions would then be distributed throughout our setup to support the establishment of the similarly adapted productive species that would also be present. Another important factor to note is that collaborative plants would be selected so that competition for resources is minimal and species instead complement one another. Progressively, zero runoff landscapes with total ground covers will become established and ecosystems will be regenerated. Other elements like seedlings, saplings, compost, mulching material, plastic sheets, shading cloth, tubing, rainwater storage tanks, fencing, and other infrastructure would also be deployed as was necessary.

 


The systems, techniques and methodologies used to regenerate ecosystems and set up designed forests are perfectly known and established by science and previous experience. Ecosystem regeneration has been successfully carried out in small and large scales; with two of the most decisive and well-known extensive large scale examples being the reclamation of the Les Landes de Gascogne former desert in France and the Huangtu Gaoyuan (Loess Plateau) Watershed Rehabilitation Project in China.  Other similar projects to regenerate degraded ecosystems have been carried out in Zimbabwe, as well as in other places in Africa. These regenerative systems, techniques and methodologies are also adaptable to completely different locations all over the world; whether they have temperate, humid, boreal, tropical or any other kind of local climate. The following is a merely illustrative list of the very diverse locations where designed forests have been successfully established in the USA:  Asheville, North Carolina; Boston, Massachusetts; Los Angeles and San Francisco, California; Austin, Texas; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Glendale and Youngstown, Ohio; Viola and Madison, Wisconsin; Tacoma and Seattle, Washington; Bloomington, Indiana; 2 sites in Chicago, Illinois; Moretown, Vermont and many more. Around the world, designed forests have been set up in the Lungau Region in Austria; New South Wales, Australia; Waiheke Island, New Zealand; London, England; Calgary and Edmonton, Alberta; Cowichan Valley, British Columbia; Toronto, Ontario, all these in Canada and some of the most studied and modeled after designed forests were set up in Iyo, Ehime, Japan.

 


Many regeneration projects like the ones included in my illustrative videos have been successfully carried out all over the world with good results even when they were severely underfunded. Such lack of funding has meant that even though biomass at the locations was successfully increased and ecosystems were indeed regenerated, these projects ended up not being as productive as they could have been. At the – greening Las Vegas – location, once the designed forests that would be set up had reached maturity, this regeneration project over its 8 hectares could be annually producing more than 11 metric tons of tomatoes, 12 tons of potatoes, 5 tons of grapes, 16 tons of lettuce, 6 tons of cantaloupe, 5 tons of maize, 13 tons of hot peppers, 14 tons of onions, 16 tons of squash, 8 tons of eggplant, 5 tons of okra, 1 ton of capsicum, and 7 tons of cucumber. In turn, once the perennial systems that would be established had matured fully, they could annually yield more than 1 metric ton of figs, 5 tons of pomegranates, 13 tons of oranges, 6 tons of apricots, 2 tons of tangerines, 10 tons of apples, 16 tons of pears, 4 tons of olives, 6 tons of dates, 8 tons of mangoes, 10 tons of guavas and 23 tons of lemons.

 


Ecosystem regeneration transformations like the one proposed for the – greening Las Vegas – project are far superior in terms of efficiency and effectiveness and are not at all equivalent to the mere planting of tree saplings. The first consideration is that it would be necessary to plant at least 23 tree saplings to sequester 1 metric ton of CO₂ in two years. Additionally, tree saplings plantations in arid regions / drylands commonly suffer from very elevated mortality rates, that can range anywhere from 70 to 95% of plantings dying before 5 years. Therefore, it would be necessary to plant as many as 80 to 460 tree saplings to sequester 1 metric ton of CO₂ in two years in comparable locations to – greening Las Vegas – (while our project would capture 4,000 MT CO₂ over 8 hectares). The survival rates for ordinary plantations can only be increased by expending large amounts of energy and irrigation water on the saplings (which imply higher greenhouse gases emissions), and this also makes those kind of plantations unsustainable as the vegetation is completely dependent on those outside inputs and has no chance of surviving on its own when human intervention is halted. Even when some trees manage to survive on their own, a small number of sparsely interspersed trees on their own will have a very limited beneficial impact on the ecosystem in the short- and medium-term, and consequently, the amount of biomass that would be created from rudimentary tree plantations would be far smaller even in the best case scenario. Designed, integral ecosystem regeneration projects, on the other hand, can afforest land that is currently a permanent desert in 3 to 5 years or less with passive technologies and methodologies that help establish self-sustaining, self-sufficient and self-replicating ecosystems.

 

 

Funding target

 

$ 400,000 USD would be a nice funding target. The main elements of the project and their  preliminary estimated proportions of the total expenditure are as follows:  

            
land                                                                                                                                            15%
all research and design costs  *                                                                                       20%
earthworks and all other structural work                                                                        7%
planting and all other transformation related costs over 20 acres                     30%
legal, logistics and other miscellaneous expenses                                                      8%
operating costs for 6 months                                                                                            15%
indiegogo and payment services fees and costs                                                    6 - 8%

* the research and design costs would cover a master design that could, with minor modifications, be applied in any location around Las Vegas and Clark County.

 

 

There definitely will be other additional costs like permits, fees, applications, commercial, fiscal and legal expenses, etc. Also, a temporary drip irrigation system and other equipment could represent a sizable expenditure but it can't be designed or projected before the location has been secured (an atmospheric water condenser might be necessary, or not). A building on site could also become necessary as well.

 


We would offer only one class of rewards: proportional credit for the carbon / CO₂ captured by the regeneration project according to the sum donated by each contributor. A third party would be asked to verify that the biomass and carbon in the location have been increased and by how much. This project is all about sustainability, ecology and local consumption, therefore, sending cheap mementos around the world as rewards for contributors would defeat its purpose and would be a waste of resources.

 


Risks & Challenges

 


The methods and techniques to set up productive designed forests are well researched and established. Given the appropriate conditions plants will grow, zero runoff landscapes with total ground covers will become established and ecosystems will be regenerated. Effective, top level design and sufficient funding can ensure the regenerative transformations are successful.

 

The only possible obstacles could be laws and regulations that restricted this kind of projects. The solution would be to adapt as was necessary to the legal requirements of each location.

 


Other Ways People Can Help

 


Well, yes, any and all publicity and social media promotion would be great.

 


Also, if someone with legal expertise would know of cheaper ways to procure vacant land in the metropolitan area of Las Vegas and Clark County that could be used to plant trees and designed forests, that would be hugely helpful. Maybe there could ways to secure long term leases or donations for idle public lands. Reducing the cost of land would help the project cover more hectares and have a greater impact.

 


Everybody can also help global ecology by growing their own food, consuming local products, adopting an ecologically and financially sustainable lifestyle, reducing waste, and reducing their greenhouse gases emissions.

At the – greening Las Vegas – location, once the designed forests that would be set up had reached maturity, this regeneration project over its 8 hectares could be annually producing more than 11 metric tons of tomatoes, 12 tons of potatoes, 5 tons of grapes, 16 tons of lettuce, 6 tons of cantaloupe, 5 tons of maize, 13 tons of hot peppers, 14 tons of onions, 16 tons of squash, 8 tons of eggplant, 5 tons of okra, 1 ton of capsicum, and 7 tons of cucumber. In turn, once the perennial systems that would be established had matured fully, they could annually yield more than 1 metric ton of figs, 5 tons of pomegranates, 13 tons of oranges, 6 tons of apricots, 2 tons of tangerines, 10 tons of apples, 16 tons of pears, 4 tons of olives, 6 tons of dates, 8 tons of mangoes, 10 tons of guavas and 23 tons of lemons.
 
Ecosystem regeneration transformations like the one proposed for the – greening Las Vegas – project are far superior in terms of efficiency and effectiveness and are not at all equivalent to the mere planting of tree saplings. The first consideration is that it would be necessary to plant at least 23 tree saplings to sequester 1 metric ton of CO₂ in two years. Additionally, tree saplings plantations in arid regions / drylands commonly suffer from very elevated mortality rates, that can range anywhere from 70 to 95% of plantings dying before 5 years. Therefore, it would be necessary to plant as many as 80 to 460 tree saplings to sequester 1 metric ton of CO₂ in two years in comparable locations to – greening Las Vegas – (while our project would capture 4,000 MT CO₂ over 8 hectares). The survival rates for ordinary plantations can only be increased by expending large amounts of energy and irrigation water on the saplings (which imply higher greenhouse gases emissions), and this also makes those kind of plantations unsustainable as the vegetation is completely dependent on those outside inputs and has no chance of surviving on its own when human intervention is halted. Even when some trees manage to survive on their own, a small number of sparsely interspersed trees on their own will have a very limited beneficial impact on the ecosystem in the short- and medium-term, and consequently, the amount of biomass that would be created from rudimentary tree plantations would be far smaller even in the best case scenario. Designed, integral ecosystem regeneration projects, on the other hand, can afforest land that is currently a permanent desert in 3 to 5 years or less with passive technologies and methodologies that help establish self-sustaining, self-sufficient and self-replicating ecosystems.
 
 
Funding target
 
$ 400,000 USD would be a nice funding target. The main elements of the project and their  preliminary estimated proportions of the total expenditure are as follows:  
            land                                                                                                                                            15%all research and design costs  *                                                                                       20%earthworks and all other structural work                                                                        7%planting and all other transformation related costs over 20 acres                     30%legal, logistics and other miscellaneous expenses                                                      8%operating costs for 6 months                                                                                            15%indiegogo and payment services fees and costs                                                    6 - 8%
* the research and design costs would cover a master design that could, with minor modifications, be applied in any location around Las Vegas and Clark County.
 
 
There definitely will be other additional costs like permits, fees, applications, commercial, fiscal and legal expenses, etc. Also, a temporary drip irrigation system and other equipment could represent a sizable expenditure but it can't be designed or projected before the location has been secured (an atmospheric water condenser might be necessary, or not). A building on site could also become necessary as well.
 
We would offer only one class of rewards: proportional credit for the carbon / CO₂ captured by the regeneration project according to the sum donated by each contributor. A third party would be asked to verify that the biomass and carbon in the location have been increased and by how much. This project is all about sustainability, ecology and local consumption, therefore, sending cheap mementos around the world as rewards for contributors would defeat its purpose and would be a waste of resources.
 

Risks & Challenges
 
The methods and techniques to set up productive designed forests are well researched and established. Given the appropriate conditions plants will grow, zero runoff landscapes with total ground covers will become established and ecosystems will be regenerated. Effective, top level design and sufficient funding can ensure the regenerative transformations are successful.
 
The only possible obstacles could be laws and regulations that restricted this kind of projects. The solution would be to adapt as was necessary to the legal requirements of each location.
 

Other Ways People Can Help
 
Well, yes, any and all publicity and social media promotion would be great.
 
Also, if someone with legal expertise would know of cheaper ways to procure vacant land in the metropolitan area of Las Vegas and Clark County that could be used to plant trees and designed forests, that would be hugely helpful. Maybe there could ways to secure long term leases or donations for idle public lands. Reducing the cost of land would help the project cover more hectares and have a greater impact.
 
Everybody can also help global ecology by growing their own food, consuming local products, adopting an ecologically and financially sustainable lifestyle, reducing waste, and reducing their greenhouse gases emissions.

story:
Summary

I'm Bryan K. Sutton of Omni Concepts, for 30 sum years, at various levels, I've worked in the construction industry and have obtained a patent on concrete that melts snow and ice which is being developed by D. J. Construction, LLC. This journey has led me to study more about pollution and its causes which led me a problem that we specifically have in Detroit and Chicago, it's pet coke, a by-product of the oil industry, stock piled in the neighborhoods of these two cities.

Petroleum Coke or petcoke, is a by-product of producing gasoline from oil refining.  Petcoke has little value, is toxic, and as a result has potential for being upgraded to a more usable fuel.  The proposed project could find a way to treat petcoke into something more usable that can be burned for energy while reducing the environmental issues with disposing of petcoke.

It concerned me so much that I began researching this problem to find a solution and along with Jonathan Wenzel, PhD of Kettering University, have developed a testing protocol to determine how much it will lower carbon emissions,  ash production, sulfur dioxide emissions, and increase btu's, when burned for energy at production plants. 

The Impact

This is a major development since most of the pet coke produced in the U.S. is shipped out of our neighborhoods, overseas to countries like India and China. Lowering the greenhouse gases is a priority of all nations and we think we have the solution.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The monies raised will go towards experimentation and provisional patent. The testing will cost $6,850.00 and the provisional patent will be $3,000.00.

Risks & Challenges​

If we are able to raise $2,500 to $3,000 then we'll pay for the provisional patent, to secure the intellectual property for one year while we continue to fundraise.

If we only raise $5,000 to $6,000, we'll pay for the testing and will attempt to raise the difference through other avenues.

What You Get

 By donating to the prototyping of this desulfurization technology, you are contributing to the advancement of innovative green technology and moving this project one step closer to global distribution. This means you can breathe easy knowing you helped create a world with less carbon emissions.

story:
Desde sus inicios en 1974, el Día Mundial del Medioambiente se ha convertido en una plataforma global que fomenta la toma de conciencia y la acción con respecto a temas cada día más urgentes, como la contaminación marina, el calentamiento global, el consumo sostenible y los delitos contra la fauna y la flora silvestres, entre otros. El «Día de las personas» ha movido a la acción a millones de personas de todo el mundo que, entrelazando un número creciente de actividades, han dado lugar a un movimiento mundial organizado a través del sitio web en expansión WED y los medios de comunicación social.

1972-1982

En 1972, la ONU establece el 5 de junio como el Día Mundial del Medioambiente (WED, según su nombre en inglés). Dos años más tarde, el Día Mundial del Medioambiente se celebra por primera vez, con el eslogan «Solo una Tierra».
1972 La Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas designa el 5 de junio como el Día Mundial del Medioambiente, en recuerdo del primer día de la Conferencia de Estocolmo sobre el Medioambiente Humano. Mediante otra resolución tomada el mismo día por la Asamblea General, se crea el Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Medioambiente (UNEP).

1974 El Día Mundial del Medioambiente se celebra por primera vez, bajo el eslogan «Solo una Tierra».

1977 El Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Medioambiente (PNUMA) aprovecha este día para subrayar la preocupación por la capa de ozono. De esa forma, establece la tendencia de que el Día Mundial del Medioambiente ayude a generar de forma temprana apoyo vital para problemas medioambientales críticos. Diez años después, se firma el emblemático Protocolo de Montreal, relativo a las sustancias que agotan la Capa de Ozono.

1979 El eslogan del Día Mundial del Medioambiente «Solo un futuro para nuestros hijos» coincide con el Año Internacional del Niño. Por primera vez, el Día Mundial del Medioambiente se hace eco de un año internacional designado por la ONU. Este patrón se hará habitual, a medida que el número de problemas medioambientales aumente en la agenda mundial.

1981 El Día Mundial del Medioambiente centra su atención en la influencia de los productos químicos tóxicos en las aguas subterráneas y en las cadenas alimentarias. Al año siguiente, el Consejo de Gobierno del PNUMA para el Medioambiente establece el Programa de Montevideo, en el que se definen las prioridades para el desarrollo del Derecho Ambiental. Como consecuencia, se firman diversos acuerdos internacionales para restringir o eliminar diversos productos químicos y contaminantes peligrosos.

1983-1992

El perfil del Día Mundial del Medioambiente crece a medida que impulsa campañas sobre problemas mundiales prioritarios, como el cambio climático y el desarrollo sostenible. El Día Mundial del Medioambiente empieza a celebrarse de forma rotativa en todo el mundo.

story:
M3 Renewable Energy

 Hi there!

My name is Felipe Lima, I am 31 and I am from Brazil.

I am an economist and entrepreneur since I was in college.

By my own experience, one of the main hurdles to operate a business here in Brazil is the feeling that everything is expensive. In fact, when compared to the USA, it usually is.

One of the costliest thing here in Brazil, when talking about small and medium businesses, is electricity.

The M3 Renewable Energy project aims to reduce the cost of electricity for small businesses in up to 40%!

And your contribution goes directly to that!

In numbers:

We are looking for US$ 300.000,00 dollars in total.

Each solar system costs approximately US$15.000,00. This money sums up the equipment and personnel costs. US$12000,00 goes to buying the equipment and US$3000,00 goes to paying personnel.

Brazilian law requires that one electrical engineer designs and installs the systems.

So, even if we don’t get the full amount we need, there will be people getting cheaper power bills!

And that’s why we need all the help we can get!

Please help us, share our idea! Show your friends our videos and please feel free to ask us any question you may have!

Thanks a lot for your support!

story:
Save the woods on the beach

The woods on East Beach are home to beautiful well established Oak trees right on the beach. The land is approximately a third of an acre but it's now up for sale, as with most of the surrounding areas it will most likely be bought by a developer that will pull all the trees out and put up a really flashy modern beach house that will probably be a second or third house for someone very well off.

The land has been empty for over 20 years after a previous development application was refused. I'm sure they will eventually change the planning policy as more new housing is needed.

I enjoy walking along the beach with my family and dog and if the weather is good, we go swimming in the sea. Unfortunately the woods have always been fenced off with razor wire on the top so no one enjoys them. I think this is quite sad as the atmosphere under the canopy of oak trees on a sunny day is magical. I want to save the trees from future development and create a space that can be enjoyed by people that love being in nature.

The location is on the sunny UK south coast in Selsey on East Beach next to a site of special scientific interest & Ramsar nature reserve.

Create - Oak Wood Beach

A space to take a break from technology and enjoy nature, relax and reflect whilst enjoying the sea views. Low impact sustainable huts / domes / tree houses, or even a tree tent. No Electricity or WIFI. A community that lives the values of low impact enjoyment of the environment whilst experimenting and educating.

Setting the site up as a holiday park is not my intention and planners would probably object but with the right backers and controls in place we can truly make Eco beach a magical place. Funding that you support the project with will secure the woodland as a sustainable space that you will be able to enjoy and share with your friends and family.

You will be able to say to future generations, "Look what I did!"

Here is the Tree Tent that I've been telling everyone about. It is a fantastic product and would work really well in amongst the trees. The guys at www.treetents.co.uk have been really supportive of the Oak wood beach campaign and I would really like to work with them. We definitely have to have one!

What support we need

The first step will be to buy the land before a developer does and after this we will also need volunteers to help design and build a space that works with its natural environment. This will involve an environmental impact assessment and a phase 1 habitat survey if you have the skills please get in touch. I already have some experts onboard to help us design low impact structures. The trees on the site will need management and your sponsorship will ensure their long term survival.

I need your support to make this dream happen! I hope you will feel the same about it.

What you get

  • You get to influence what we do and how we do it. I want the project to be a learning opportunity for everyone that want to be involved.
  • You can choose one or more of the perks that we listed the main idea is that you to spend time enjoying the completed project.
  • The perks on offer are a choice of 1 week stay or weekend at Eco beach it has to be a first come first serve or choose from a selection of other perks like a Kids rainbow yoga class.
  • An opportunity to learn about everything that we do to create Eco beach.

Long term benefits

The experimental nature of this project will show the way to other people to do the same for the pockets of natural space around them.

Trees support a huge amount of life and balance our ecosystem, if you've ever hugged a tree you know..

Other ways you can help

Please get in touch and let me know your thoughts and ideas, the more knowledge the better.

Also please share this campaign and our website www.oakwoodbeach.co.uk
