story:
This is a story of struggle against the changing climate and the dissapearance of the foundation of life in Sahara, and hope, the hope of green up in an arid place.

 

Abdoul is a Saharan nomad, born and raised between the dunes of Southern Morocco. His family had to forsake their native surroundings and settle in the small town of M’Hamid El Ghizlane as their nomad life became impossible due to the increasing aridity.

As a young man Abdoul started his big venture: to create his own oasis in the desert. Together with his brother he dug a 13m deep well by hand, he planted native trees, like acacia, tamarisks and palm trees and began to build a guesthouse in his oasis.

As the trees grew up, he was unable to supply them with the source of life. The well gave less and less as the water supply level dropped, rain was not coming as it had in the past and a barrage prevented the Oued Draa river from supplying the area.

 

Many trees died, but other had flourished under the care of the family.

 

Four years ago Abdoul found a companion in his struggle. He met Nana, by now his wife, who gave up the comfort and security of an European life to join Abdoul in his fight for his dream: trees to give shade and to stop the ongoing desertification.

Together they raised the money to dig a second well in a more promising spot. The hole is there, but no possibility to buy a pump, as funds are empty like the old well.

Now this is where you can help: the old diesel pump, which Abdoul and Nana named "The Old Lady" beside being unecological, is not reliable, breaking continually.

To supply the thirsty trees without causing emissions that will in the end hurt them, they want to raise the money for a solar pump with appliances. All in all, this will cost around 4000 euro.

 

If each of us would contribute with only a small amount, we could raise this reasonable sum of money in no time.

 

In exchange, Abdoul and Nana would be happy to have you as guests in the desert camp.

And if you don’t see yourself getting there too soon, I am personally happy to give something in exchange for your donation.

You can choose between:

  • a printed set of film photography postcards from the desert camp and surroundings.
  • a HQ image file for you to print as small or as big as you desire.

Thank you for helping us keep the desert alive!

story:
Short Summary

The IE Homestead is launching our first agricultural project on a bit earlier timeline than expected, beekeeping. These tiny critters are some of the hardest and most important workers in nature. 

This project is important to us to strengthen the land that we are homesteading on. We've recently joined the Texas Beekeeper's Association and are working with experienced beekeepers to properly work with our bees.

While the home site isn't complete - the colonies will be placed in areas that will not be disturbed by the building process. By supporting us, you are investing in Texas AG, local farming, and your friends. 

We think you'll enjoy supporting us and the fun donation tiers that we have created. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign is asking for a total of $4000. We plan to start with 8 colonies.

The cost breakdown is roughly, 2650 for 8 double hives+ super, 160 for hive placement materials, and 675 for basic beekeeper supplies for the family. The remaining 500 is buffer & tangible items from this promotion. 

We're asking for support because the beekeeping timeline and costs have cut into the home-site budget. Your donations will 100% go to our bee-keeping endeavor. Any unused donations from this campaign will be donated to the local chapter of the Texas Beekeeping Association. 

We will be completely transparent by sharing updates through our vlog, e-mails from this platform, and a final cost sheet of where all monies were spent.

As a contributor, some fun perks include custom T-shirts and even naming the colonies!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are little risks to donating to our bee-launch project. The funds will be used 100% towards our beekeeping efforts on the homestead & any unused funds are going to the local chapter of the Texas Beekeepers Association.

We've sourced bees from a farm about 40 minutes north of us and are working with the local beekeepers association to learn proper bee-handling techniques. Due to COVID-19, we may or may not get to work hands-on with a beekeeper prior to picking up our own bees (mid-April). These are all measures we've taken to overcome the challenges of being new beekeepers.

The bee colonies are on order & we're excited to share this project with you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? No problem! We could always use a share & shout out on your social media platforms. Thank you for checking out our campaign!

 

*** PLEASE CHECK OUT OUR FAQ FOR MORE INFORMATION ***
story_txt:
Short Summary
The IE Homestead is launching our first agricultural project on a bit earlier timeline than expected, beekeeping. These tiny critters are some of the hardest and most important workers in nature. 
This project is important to us to strengthen the land that we are homesteading on. We've recently joined the Texas Beekeeper's Association and are working with experienced beekeepers to properly work with our bees.
While the home site isn't complete - the colonies will be placed in areas that will not be disturbed by the building process. By supporting us, you are investing in Texas AG, local farming, and your friends. 
We think you'll enjoy supporting us and the fun donation tiers that we have created. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
The campaign is asking for a total of $4000. We plan to start with 8 colonies.
The cost breakdown is roughly, 2650 for 8 double hives+ super, 160 for hive placement materials, and 675 for basic beekeeper supplies for the family. The remaining 500 is buffer & tangible items from this promotion.

story:
21st CENTURY CAR CARE

is debuting the latest in waterless technology with our Waterless Wash and Wax. Founded on our passion for clean cars and fueled by the ever growing need for clean water. You can your vehicle anywhere!

                      

 

PROBLEM SOLVING

WATER ISSUES

Water concerns nationwide and globally are continuing to grow, with car washing being sited as a major contributor to water use and pollution. With approxitmaly 304 MILLION GALLONS used daily just to clean cars in the US, it is no longer a small issue! Utilizing our Waterless Wash and Wax the typical family sedan can be cleaned with around 16 ounces. Compared to over 100 gallons used in your typical home car wash. This is a MASSIVE difference, that can really make an impact!  products will save millions of gallons of water every year.

CONVENIENCE

Beyond water savings is convenience. Traditionally washing and waxing a vehicle takes hours and requires multiple products. Now in minutes using an single product you can wash and wax your vehicle anywhere! During our testing phase we had a customer who detailed his car with our Waterless Wash and Wax at a restaurant while waiting on his food! You can now wash and wax your ride inside your garage, out on the street, at a car show, while getting fuel, rain or shine. 

 

OUR DIRTY SECRET

Here at we have spent the last year and a half developing and perfecting our Waterless Wash and Wax. Once applied to the surface it will lift and suspend the dirt allowing it to be safely wiped away. The lubricating properties in our blend of natural carnauba wax, hyper-surfactants, and emulsifiers protect your paints finish from scratches and leave you with a beautiful shine. The UV inhibitors provide that extra layer of protection to ensure that your vehicle continues to look its best for years.

 

Thanks to our marketing partner:

instagram.com/createwfu/

What We Need & What You Get

Product launches aren't cheap, even if the product helps our future:

  • $9,500 will cover the cost of our first production run
  • We have a first class manufacturer that is as excited about this product as we are!
  • Any additional funds over our target will help cover marketing and operating costs
  • We already have the funds for bottles, labels, and boxes
  • Once this project is close to funded we will announce our STRETCH GOALS!

Risks & Challenges

We are confident that we can have the product manufactured in time for shipments to begin in Sept. 2016. Our only hurdle other than funding is sourcing a bottle manufacturer. We have bottle resources available but are working to source a manufacturer that offers eco friendly plastics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are as concerned about the future of our water situation as we are, go tell everyone you know about our project!
  • Share with everybody! Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign! You can share our social media post too - find us on Instagram @get_gowash

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Léo's journey - Journeo 

__________________________________________

I'm going to Stockholm from Briançon. I'll do 4500km and my goal is to live in the cities on my  itinerary.

 

How.

___________________  Recumbent bike with solar panels.

 

Where.

___________  Briançon

___________  Montpellier

___________  Valence

___________  Lyon

___________  Genève

___________  Zurich

___________  Mulhouse

___________  Strasbourg

___________  Beaune

___________  Paris

___________  Normandie

___________  Londres

___________  Dublin

___________  Cambridge

___________  Brussel

___________  Antwerp

___________  Rotterdam

___________  Amsterdam

___________  Brème

___________  Copenhague

___________  Oslo

___________  Stockholm

 

Time.

___________________ 6 months minimum.

___________________ 10 years maximum.

 

Why.

___________________ I'm making future with others.

 

Sleep.

___________________ Hamac or everywhere. 

 

Who.

___________________ Léo Durand

 

Need.

___________________

I'm a homeless photographer. You'll discover my passion on Ig   @Leodurand_   or on Fb @Leontheroadagain

I will photography the world and I'm sharing my eye with you.

You can support me without giving numbers. You can offer me a drink, food, buy a photo, make the world better, speak with me, follow me, host me,  message me, whatever.

With your contributions, I will not use this money for my own purpose. I will pay food to migrants, homeless people, poors etc. I will buy clothes for them.

Giving their own needs. To illustrate, Rafaël will have a guitare and with this good and his talent, he'll receive number in the street. In babylone, number is life and with his music he'll be normal as you & me.

I want to rent some appartments to host some travelers (musicians, artists, migrants, homeless etc.). They will pay their rent back after some time. 

More number.

More help.

 

The Impact.

___________________ Photos, vidéos, clip making, film making, documentaire, journalism

 

Risks & Challenges.

___________________  Help me to survive in Babylone.

 

My eye.

___________________

story:
Short Summary

Photo (CM Images): The recycling process beginning in Cambodia, separating absolutely everything by hand!

I’m an individual with 15 years experience in recycling and an interest in helping the local environment. I grew up in England working for my family’s recycling business but I’ve now been living in Siem Reap, Cambodia for the last 4 years.  During this time, I’ve seen a real need for a similar recycling system to be set up in the local community. 

Through the approximate 250 tonnes of rubbish discarded and collected for landfill daily, a large proportion of this will contain various materials such as paper, plastic bottles, cans, and numerous other recyclable materials. Instead of having the potential to be created into new products, they will simply be buried under the earth, discarded on the street or burnt by locals (a common practice found out here).

Being able to recycle is a brilliant way for businesses to reduce their environmental impact, the amount of poisonous gases being created through the rubbish being burnt, and to protect environmental habitats for local flora and fauna.

What We Need & What You Get

To do this, I am looking to raise $150,000 for the construction of a warehouse and purchase of a machine that will compact and bale the different materials. The baled materials will then be sold and profits made will be re-invested back into the local community. The land is purchased and ready to be utilised!

As I initially offered 20% to potential business investors, I will donate 20%-30% of what the project makes on a yearly basis to community projects that provide clean drinking water for impoverished villages and free schooling for local children.  

Depending on the size of contributions from our generous donors, we will look to offer meaningful 'perks' that will show the difference your donation has made. 

I will provide project updates through the funding page, social media, and meetings to keep everyone interested up-to-date. I’ll try my best to provide details around materials collected and how much is prepared for recycling on a monthly basis - just so everyone out there knows what a huge difference their support is making! 

So, to break it down, the money raised will get the bare basics of the project going.

  • A warehouse for storage, delivery of materials to be sorted and protection for staff from mother nature.
  • A fence to enclose the project site.
  • The baler / machine needed to compact and bale the various materials.
  • Set up and maintenance of utilities, such as electricity and running water.
  • Running costs to remove the materials once they are compacted and baled.
  • The employment and training of local staff to support the delivery of the recycling project. 

In return, the team will offer small rewards and perks on the successful running of the campaign!

  • Good karma!
  • A clean city when you decide to come and visit!
  • Donations made on your behalf to properly run charities and NGOs.
  • Hand painted pictures of the city and its iconic landmarks.
  • More to come as we think of them!

Please feel free in asking any questions you may want answered through the crowd funding page!

The Impact

Being so close to the Angkorian ruins, tourism in Siem Reap has expanded at an enormous rate. Huge expensive, lavish, as well as budget hotels have popped up everywhere, with tourism becoming a vast and lucrative industry. To meet the demand, local business, bars, restaurants, and cafes continue to open up to feed the increased number of visitors to the city every year.

Photo (CM Images): Siem Reap is a gateway to the amazing temples, visited by millions of tourists every year.

As a result of this tourism boom, the amount of rubbish generated has also increased to alarming levels in a community that is not familiar with the term 'recycling'. Rubbish is discarded in a number of ways in the city, as many can not afford to have the rubbish collected. You can find bottles and cans littered on roads and footpaths, while plastics can be found in the city's rivers and waterways. A common practice also used by locals is to burn household rubbish out in the open, this results in poisonous gases entering the atmosphere. 

Due to high levels of poverty in the area, many have no choice but to go through rubbish bags and waste sites to collect cans, plastic bottles and other materials of value. These loose materials are then transported 5 to 7 hours away for little reward to those who collected it. Children are especially made vulnerable as they are exposed to dangerous situations and unhealthy environments as a means to support their struggling families. 

To prevent this, we want to recycle as many materials as possible, regardless of value, to prevent adults and children from wandering the streets and entering waste sites. While this can not be stopped from day one, we will look to offer a profitable, safer and easily accessible means for individuals to deposit any materials they do collect, which will hopefully include materials considered of lesser value. The purchase of the machine will allow us to take all materials that people bring us. While we have begun working with a couple of businesses in the area with their recycling, we aim to expand this further as the project goes on. 

Photo (CM Images): An example of how much recycling a bar in Siem Reap generates in one night. 

We look to offer initiatives similar to those found in the UK where rebates are given to charities for the collection of bottle tops. An example of this initiative can be found through GHS Recycling based in the United Kingdom.

Photo (CM Images): Separating everything! Plastic cups and straws, bottle tops, cans and plastic bottles.

I think everyone will agree that recycling is an important part of any community, so the money raised will be used to set up the recycling project and awareness programs for the local area.

Using my own experience, I’ll be setting up a western standard sorting facility for all recyclable materials that will then be baled and exported to reliable recycling facilities around Asia. The project will start with a dry waste recycling system before hopefully expanding into glass and polystyrene foam, 2 major problems found in Siem Reap.

The city of Siem Reap and Cambodia as a whole has a lot to offer to everyone around the world. There is beauty, there is history, there is culture and a population of people that continue to smile despite a troubled past. 

This project will educate, provide jobs for local staff, keeping children safe, and the city clean for many that call it home and to the many tourists that will continue to visit every year. 

Risks & Challenges

There will be risks faced along the way, some known and may unknown too! It is hoped that with my experience, knowledge and contacts in this area, any obstacle can be overcome. 

The first main obstacle once we get the facility up and running will be to educate the community about how to separate materials that can be recycled from general waste. Then it will be to get them into a habit of actually doing it. 

What We Know

  • There is limited to no resources.
  • Limited to no knowledge about how and why recycling is important.
  • There no known local facility for community members to take their recycling. 
  • Locals have used a common practice of burning rubbish for a long time - breaking this habit is a must!
  • Adults and especially children scour landfill sites for materials of value, exposing them to dangers.

We hope to train like minded local staff to be our recycling promoters, who can convey the recycling message to the local community. These initial steps can help overcome and break the current cycle of poor waste disposal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I have been working on this project for the past year and I hope that through the generosity of others, I’ll be able to share the benefits back to a well-deserved community. Even if you are unable to contribute financially, we would still appreciate if everyone can spread the word of this project through out the various social media platforms!

Help me demonstrate a better way and make enormous community change!

**I am extremely determined and passionate about making this project work, this is why I have set a fixed target campaign. This is the amount of money we need to get the project off the ground, otherwise there is no reason to do things half hearted and without the appropriate resources. If we can not reach our intended target, everyone's generous donations will be refunded (minus the transaction fees). **

story:
Background

My name is Diana-Valeria Vacaru. I'm currently a senior at the Lyceum of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova. Now, I work as a member of the team: Candles for MOLD(OVA). Since I was a little girl, I remember that my family combated mold. Everywhere was that unpleasant smell and breathing it in caused me to feel nauseous. Considering that mold is a toxic fungus which grows via spores and affects our health as an indoor pollutant, the first thing that we need to do is to remove it from our house. Unfortunately, there are two other problems derived from the main one: a lot of people don't know how dangerous it is to breathe and moreover, after removal, it develops again. So, our solution is a social campaign which includes an online platform where information will be provided about natural ways to remove mold and where candles capable of preventing the mold will be sold. These candles are made of 100% natural wax and tea tree oil, which is toxic for all types of fungus and other pathogens. With these Candles my house is mold free, is yours?

Purpose of the Campaign

Online platform

An user-friendly platform will be a big step towards our goal of having as many visitors as possible on the website. I am a beginner in web development. Though I can program a basic website it is not enough. I asked a friend to help us, and I wish to compensate him.

Production of candles

Our biggest goal is to sell at least 1000 candles by the end of summer 2017, but before selling, we need to have the candles produced. We need funding for labor, wax, tea tree oil and other ingredients. Candles for MOLD(OVA) are very good air cleaners, easy to use and not expensive. Using them will minimize our health risks by improving indoor air quality! It will help people who can't afford air conditioning which is expensive, works only with energy and needs to be installed by someone because they can use candles to clean the air!. Our health and environment are most important and I would be thrilled if our goal of eliminating mold from people's houses could be achieved!
So join us in our fight to keep houses mold free and improve people’s health! Raising money through Indiegogo will help us to pay for candles production and for website development.

Why is this important?
1. It is a product capable of killing all types of toxic fungus which exist in people's houses.
2. It has a good impact on people's health.
3. It reduces the number of people suffering from diseases caused by mold.
4. It is a solution for minimizing the loss of energy by airing rooms during winter time.

Mold spores exist everywhere. There is a fact that in one m2 of air exists 5000 spores and only 5 spores to get people sick.

YOU BREATHE IT NOW, THINK ABOUT IT!

The Impact

When I think of mold, the image of a bathroom curtain comes into my mind. Why a bathroom curtain? Because this is a material which mold "likes". Considering that mold is the most common in bathrooms, we thought that people can light the candles during showers. Thus, there will be a romantic atmosphere and moreover, the mold will cease to grow.
In clarify, I want to stress out that tea tree oil candles can have effects only if the mold was firstly removed. They cannot remove the mold, they only prevent its development!

HOW IT WORKS?

Step 1  Join the community
You get informed about the dangers of mold, and information about different ways of mold removal.
Step 2  Remove mold
You remove the mold from your house with natural substances.
Step 3  Prevent mold
You decide to order a candle. You receive the candle, you light it and the quality of air in your house improves!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word about this campaign and about the dangers of mold.
story_txt: BackgroundMy name is Diana-Valeria Vacaru. I'm currently a senior at the Lyceum of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova. Now, I work as a member of the team: Candles for MOLD(OVA). Since I was a little girl, I remember that my family combated mold. Everywhere was that unpleasant smell and breathing it in caused me to feel nauseous. Considering that mold is a toxic fungus which grows via spores and affects our health as an indoor pollutant, the first thing that we need to do is to remove it from our house. Unfortunately, there are two other problems derived from the main one: a lot of people don't know how dangerous it is to breathe and moreover, after removal, it develops again. So, our solution is a social campaign which includes an online platform where information will be provided about natural ways to remove mold and where candles capable of preventing the mold will be sold. These candles are made of 100% natural wax and tea tree oil, which is toxic for all types of fungus and other pathogens. With these Candles my house is mold free, is yours?Purpose of the CampaignOnline platformAn user-friendly platform will be a big step towards our goal of having as many visitors as possible on the website. I am a beginner in web development. Though I can program a basic website it is not enough. I asked a friend to help us, and I wish to compensate him.Production of candlesOur biggest goal is to sell at least 1000 candles by the end of summer 2017, but before selling, we need to have the candles produced. We need funding for labor, wax, tea tree oil and other ingredients. Candles for MOLD(OVA) are very good air cleaners, easy to use and not expensive. Using them will minimize our health risks by improving indoor air quality! It will help people who can't afford air conditioning which is expensive, works only with energy and needs to be installed by someone because they can use candles to clean the air!. Our health and environment are most important and I would be thrilled if our goal of eliminating mold from people's houses could be achieved!So join us in our fight to keep houses mold free and improve people’s health! Raising money through Indiegogo will help us to pay for candles production and for website development.Why is this important?1. It is a product capable of killing all types of toxic fungus which exist in people's houses.2. It has a good impact on people's health.3. It reduces the number of people suffering from diseases caused by mold.4. It is a solution for minimizing the loss of energy by airing rooms during winter time.Mold spores exist everywhere. There is a fact that in one m2 of air exists 5000 spores and only 5 spores to get people sick.YOU BREATHE IT NOW, THINK ABOUT IT!The ImpactWhen I think of mold, the image of a bathroom curtain comes into my mind. Why a bathroom curtain? Because this is a material which mold "likes". Considering that mold is the most common in bathrooms, we thought that people can light the candles during showers. Thus, there will be a romantic atmosphere and moreover, the mold will cease to grow.In clarify, I want to stress out that tea tree oil candles can have effects only if the mold was firstly removed. They cannot remove the mold, they only prevent its development!HOW IT WORKS?Step 1  Join the communityYou get informed about the dangers of mold, and information about different ways of mold removal.Step 2  Remove moldYou remove the mold from your house with natural substances.Step 3  Prevent moldYou decide to order a candle. You receive the candle, you light it and the quality of air in your house improves!Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word about this campaign and about the dangers of mold.

story:
Premises and principles

The project concerns the ethical sector of safeguarding the natural heritage.

In particular, the focus is on the figures: more than 15 billion trees a year are cut down in the world, often without any preliminary dendrological evaluation.
This means, for example, that the criterion for the selection of trees to be cut takes into account maximum economic yield and minimum effort, therefore relying to prefer the older trees strongly involved in preserving the forest balance.

A WWF alert since 2015, to give an idea of ​​the phenomenon: https://www.wwf.it/news/notizie/?15340

However, limiting the situation to an ecological issue could be misleading.
It is woth to notice that the structure that until now has characterized many of the "green revolutions" has miserably failed getting their bearings reabsorbed into the system.
Aware of this, the ARGO Project does not therefore only advance an ecological proposal, but aims to give voice to the ever more emerging need of an anthropological revolution.

The sociologists, in fact, has noticed that the new generations are investing a large part of their efforts in trying to create new social models, where they can find a satisfying relational environment, also with regard to work and professions. 
In this way, phenomena such as coworking, coliving, teamworking, ecovillages and digital nomads are becoming more and more frequent.

These new models are rediscovering and re-identifying in nature a substantial factor for psychophysical rebalancing, recognizing it as the elective habitat for the general well-being of the individual, if only for necessity.

The principle from which the ARGO project proposes to leave is to "restore freedom" to trees [and extensively to the whole nature] which, like slaves, belong to the owner of the land that hosts them. Their life belongs to a master, who for his maximum profit prevents trees from living and prospering freely.

More extensively, ARGO aims to make Nature obtain the right to be recognized as a legal entity and thus to have a legal personality.
A pioneer in this sense is New Zealand where the original population of the Mahori in 2017 get this credit on a sacred river, thanks to the promulgation of a law that recognizes the deep connection between the people and its land, creating something strong for the future we have born in mind.

Although it may sound a little theatrical, the evaluations supporting this principle are, on the contrary, decidedly mathematical. The survival habitat of our species is progressively getting smaller under our astonished and confused gaze. The state of the art in the sector, in fact, is detecting alarming statistics and exponentially expanding charts, and the international community is constantly involved in buffer-solutions to the most known eco-sociological problems: deforestation, intensive agriculture, irreversible loss of biodiversity, electromagnetic pollution, urban social alienation, technology pervasiveness in everyday life, suicidal instincts downed on the new generations, old people abandoned to vices, drugs and television, children offered in feed to the vacuum of identity.

Each of us knows well what is happening to our Home.

It is necessary, as soon as possible, to create a mechanism of inversion of tendency: this is what the ARGO Project proposes for attributing to nature its role of primary human necessity.


 

Mission

The ARGO Project therefore proposes a patented model of transversal protection, which allows the collective participation in the purchase, so liberation, of vast areas of land, and of consequent ecological and social rehabilitation of the liberated lands, with attractive crypto-speculative repercussions for the public, which so incentivized makes itself a supporter of the whole virtuous mechanism.

Argo looks towards the rebirth of big trees, surface waters, and a new and more evolved ecological compromise.

It briefly includes:

-GAIAN: the name of the ICO, and consequently of the first legalized cryptocurrency, designed to "free the land".

-ARGOLANDS: areas of "free land and human preservation" where to flourish better ideas for our future, protected for 99 years (foresting).

-ARGO.BASE: a Protection Body, with blockchain-based transparent administration, set up to protect the Argolands in the form of a non-profit Trust according to Anglo-Saxon Law.

 

The main accessory projects are:

- QEVA: the first earthship in a mounting box, designed to be printed through 3D technologies using rapid geopolymer mortars (totally biocompatible, studied with Gilberto Quarneti).

- ADAM: the centrifugal permaculture model applicable in Argolands (similar to the Demeter model, but characterized by the adoption of the Distributed Land Clustering).

- GLIV: an innovative E-CO-Living model on the Argolands border-limits, for digital nomads and more, adjacent to:

- JURASSICS: nurseries and forests highly characterized by flora-fauna biodiversity.

- SHINING CAMPS: training and socialization areas for young people.

- VERTICAL RETREATS: places dedicated to spiritual retreat, meditation and well-being.

- JOURNEISM: a travel "guided by Kairos", timeless, through the Argolands.

- IAD (Internet Addiction Disorder) detox protocols: to come back from the depersonalizing effects that technology has generated on us

- BLOCKSTONE®: an exclusive and patented validation procedure for legal blocks (AgID and equivalent territorial authorities), with smart-contracts maintained according to the international standard of notary level.

Within the Argolands, however, technology is not present, much less money. Anthropization is extremely sweet and rarefied, and will therefore be constituted oases for retreats, trials including experiments of metaculture, pilgrimages, excursions, as well as of course tje presence of those who will live there.

Safeguard is entrusted to all of us, as the foundation will assign the "Essent" (minimum units of land per person) in custody to volunteers whose whish is LIVING NATURE in friendship with it: the Custodians.
Within the limits of the strict preservation and surveillance protocols provided by Argo.Base, they will be able to experiment new and free forms of anthropization.

The time schedule provides, as early as the 12th month after the ICO, the establishment of a ranking and so the selection and training of Custodes for the assignment of the liberated lands.

The Argo.Base trust device includes the White-paper of the ARGO project, which contains the philosophical cornerstones offerred through the translation in its operative focus, including each metric.

Among other things, it defines in detail the safeguarding constraints and the measures of the penetration of the communities in the territories, but maintains maximum respect towards individual freedom, creativity and cooperation initiatives.

The Trust therefore administers the economic assets so that they reach their maximum valorization in compliance with the aims set out in the Device Act.


 

How does it work:

The proposed dream is to allow the main public to invest in the liberation of the earth; to gain and at the same time "going to heaven" by ensuring future generations better corners of the world.

What does it mean to invest in the Argo project?

Investing in Argo means investing in the most revolutionary ECO-ICO of this century, that is a cryptocurrency of the latest-generation, consolidated by an innovative method of legalization of the contents referred to in the hash-code inside any node of the “blockchain” chain used, which is called Blockstone.

In addition, the use of Blockstone allows to link a real estate value to the currency, ensuring stability.
The “countervalue in lands” allows to connect the public's need for a safe and high-yield investment, to the "liberation of the land", in a mechanism of exponential growth, by making sure - why not? - that the speculative anxiety inherent the human being can become a lever of radical changes, rather than a destructive engine.

The Argo.Base Trust therefore supervises the liberated areas (Argolands), to allow them to experience a slow process of biological reactivation, so that no one will take over the next few years the elements that could perhaps represent a possibility of survival in the future.

The last century has seen the overcoming of many scientific boundaries. Among the emerged awareness, there is the direct dependence of human well-being on the quality and congeniality of the habitat that hosts it. This, translated in terms of ecological balance and sustainability, leads to the definition of the measure of the Essent:

1 E = 100,000 square meters

ESSENT is therefore the measure of natural soil necessary not only to feed and drink physically, but also to nurture and support psychophysiologically an individual, in respect of all its basic needs, to be understood in the broadest and most comprehensive meanings, to arrive at a harmonic and fulfilling health and balance condition.

The Essent is therefore the existential unity sufficient to the passive sustenance of an individual.

ECONOMIC VALUE which a single ESSENT is composed by:
€ 15000: maximum purchase cost per hectar (ha), multiplied per 10
€ 8000: administration costs, outsourcing, taxes, brokerage, power of attorney
€ 2000: reinvestment in new lands to issue additional currency
€ 100: G reserve for re-use in transverse labs

Total: 25.100 euros

Obviously they must be NATURAL soils, or free from abuse and irreversible speculation, or vegetative sourcless such as deserts, pantanal, etc. Building lands, or characterize by strong construction susceptibility, or limited by historical constraints, high agricultural productivity lans, high tourist attractiveness land, etc., are also excluded.

Each Essent is therefore equal to 10 ha, 100,000 square meters.
The Essents in the Argo model are then divided into small units of 100 square meters, called Argo-cluster.
The ARGO-CLUSTER (Acl) are therefore small patches of land, indicative extension 10 x 10 m, digitally identified by means of georeferenced planialimetric coordinates.

1 E = 1000 Acl

 

The GAIAN (G) token

Token in the language of ICO means “item of currency other than coins and paper money”, in this case it is digital.

The Argo token, which will be issued and offered for purchase during the ICO period, is called GAIAN.

Each token (Gaian) issued corresponds to an Acl. As we told, an Acl (Argo-cluster) is a clustered fraction of an Essent, equal to 1/1000th part of its extension.

1 Acl = 0,001 E = 100 square meters

The value of the token G can therefore be calculated as a thousandth part of the value of an Essent:

25.100 / 1000 = € 25.1

Thetotal supplyof tokens, which represents the amount to be reached through the ICO, is fixed on the basis of a pre-set target of 100 Essent to be released, about 1000 hectares, for a total of 100,000 Gaian, 2,510,000 euros.

The time-lasting of the ICO is ment to be of about 4 weeks.

The ICO is approximately scheduled for March 2019, and will be preceded by a few months of auditing and pre-ICO.
During these preliminary phases it will be possible to obtain friendship-bonuses by actively participating in the project start-up, convertible in Gaian after the consolidation of the currency on the exchanges.


 

The counterpart of the token

The user, by purchasing a G, acquires the Bare Ownership of the Acl unit of land, in order to protect it. This Right is obviously also a guarantee that, like a mortgage, allows the investor (Argo Angel) to have a recourse in the event of non-compliance by the obligations of Argo.Base, and a rescue-solution in case of more serious problems.

At the same time as the purchase, the Argo Angel grants the Leasehold estate of the corresponding Acl, and therefore the physical availability, to the Argo.Base.

The non-profit Argo.Base Trust is designed to minimize the costs of maintaining the ArgoLands, including taxes, only and exclusively for the 99 years of its Mission of Safeguarding; at the end however, if the Uses and the legal guidelines will be evolved, the land will be formally released, returning it to earth itself.
If this won’t be the case, it will be necessary to provide otherwise, primarily by perpetuating the protection.

 

Legalized Smart-contract

The platform (Argolands.com), through IT systems and proprietary applications, distributes the land to be safeguarded - whose Property was previously acquired by the Argo Trust.Base - in Acl (Argo-cluster 10x10 mt), assigning and legalizing an ID-code per Acl.

When issuing the currency token G (Gaian), the smart-contracts, generated by the back-end of the Argolands.com platform, certify 3 consequential transactions:

- Irreversible association between the ID-code and the G-token.

- Association between the G-token and the User.

- Transferring the Bare Ownership of the Acl from Trust Argo.base to the User, but withholding the Leasehold estate.

The contract, which is stipulated through the smart-contract modalities, includes binding references to the safeguard clauses detailed in the White-paper, and also limitations on the possibility of legal registration of the Right, or of holding its availability.

These limitations represent the guarantee for our eco-investors that the project retains a high degree of authority, transparency and credibility; this preserves both the value of their heritage in Gaian and the pre-established ecological and philanthropic objectives.

 

Summary of values

The G token offers to:
- create the first "ECO (ethernal coin offering)" guaranteed by countervalue in lands.
- activate a virtuous incremental mechanism that compensates for the serious damages inflicted daily on nature.
- create the first cryptocurrency consolidated legally by means of substitutive storage (Blockstone), making it comparable to a nominative credit instrument.
- visit, live or eat food, from the Argolands.
- invest with excellent possibilities of return.



 

Required resources

ICO development and support systems: € 150,000

Economic and financial planning: € 30,000

Mktg and crowdfunding campaign: € 100,000

Compensation and salaries: € 50,000

Real-estate purchase options: € 150,000 [for a purchase value of 1,500,000]

The total costs for the Argo project to start are therefore around € 480,000.

The project is already indeed started. It is carried on through the pro-bono work of professionals from various sectors and countries: volunteers choose a battle-name and become Argonauts!
We are organized in agile-working, and we share chores as micro-tasks, in order that it naturally emerges the Argonauti team that will support the launch of the ICO Gaian.

With the achievement of the ICO's objectives, the project will also require the structuring of the Argo.Base trust administration team, and related local departments, with indicatively proportional costs to the size of the land acquisitions.


 

Timing

Construction time is the following, shown beginning from the start and in sequence:

5/6 months: development and pre-ICO.

1 month: intermediate strategic analysis and probable starting of the real estate consolidation.

1 month: ICO.

3 months: introduction of the Gaian and study optimized lucrative mechanisms.


 

Company structure

The "ICO" phase sees as actors the Legalizer startup, promoter, supported by already consolidated legal advisors. It is under study the use of a guarantor (eg Notary) and / or the establishment of a Startup (potential offices in: IT, EE, BR, CH).

Partnerships and brand sharing mechanics with other active and aligned operators are widely agreed.

Given the non-profit nature of the Argo.Base trust, the formalization mechanism of corporate agreements could require a cross-boarding formulation, also exploiting outsourced contracts ad hocstipulated by the trust.

 

Intellectual property

The concept presented here is subject of Copyright, consolidated through digital legalization, as well as patents of invention and trademarks, regularly claimed.
Any use or disclosure is forbidden unless explicitly consented by the author, who transmits the present in a confidentiality, or by empowering the recipient to dispose to any information inherent by Due diligence.

 

Many thanks!
 

Eros Poeta
[Legalizer Srl- CEO]


 

* The value of € 1500 / ha has been deduced from real proposals related to grazing land, ascertained with inspections in southern Sardinia, southern Chile, Catalonia (SP), Greece, Canary Islands (SP). Very low cost land has also been identified, in more remote and exotic areas (Thailand, Mexico, Argentina, Costa Rica, Brazil, Uruguay, USA, India). Among these, there are also those notoriously raped by deforestation (Congo, Borneo, Amazonia, etc.).
This means that they are low-cost land, whose value is often calculated "by weight" of timber supplied. Trees alive, secular, are cut to make money, or better to enrich the multinationals unable to control the harmful effects of their activities.

Buying these lands at low cost, freeing them, and keeping them, represents a hope for present and future generations.

Mktg and crowdfunding campaign: € 100,000
Compensation and salaries: € 50,000
Real-estate purchase options: € 150,000 [for a purchase value of 1,500,000]
The total costs for the Argo project to start are therefore around € 480,000.
The project is already indeed started. It is carried on through the pro-bono work of professionals from various sectors and countries: volunteers choose a battle-name and become Argonauts!We are organized in agile-working, and we share chores as micro-tasks, in order that it naturally emerges the Argonauti team that will support the launch of the ICO Gaian.
With the achievement of the ICO's objectives, the project will also require the structuring of the Argo.Base trust administration team, and related local departments, with indicatively proportional costs to the size of the land acquisitions.
 
Timing
Construction time is the following, shown beginning from the start and in sequence:
5/6 months: development and pre-ICO.
1 month: intermediate strategic analysis and probable starting of the real estate consolidation.
1 month: ICO.
3 months: introduction of the Gaian and study optimized lucrative mechanisms.
 
Company structure
The "ICO" phase sees as actors the Legalizer startup, promoter, supported by already consolidated legal advisors. It is under study the use of a guarantor (eg Notary) and / or the establishment of a Startup (potential offices in: IT, EE, BR, CH).
Partnerships and brand sharing mechanics with other active and aligned operators are widely agreed.
Given the non-profit nature of the Argo.Base trust, the formalization mechanism of corporate agreements could require a cross-boarding formulation, also exploiting outsourced contracts ad hocstipulated by the trust.
 
Intellectual property
The concept presented here is subject of Copyright, consolidated through digital legalization, as well as patents of invention and trademarks, regularly claimed.Any use or disclosure is forbidden unless explicitly consented by the author, who transmits the present in a confidentiality, or by empowering the recipient to dispose to any information inherent by Due diligence.
 
Many thanks! 
Eros Poeta[Legalizer Srl- CEO]
 
* The value of € 1500 / ha has been deduced from real proposals related to grazing land, ascertained with inspections in southern Sardinia, southern Chile, Catalonia (SP), Greece, Canary Islands (SP). Very low cost land has also been identified, in more remote and exotic areas (Thailand, Mexico, Argentina, Costa Rica, Brazil, Uruguay, USA, India). Among these, there are also those notoriously raped by deforestation (Congo, Borneo, Amazonia, etc.).This means that they are low-cost land, whose value is often calculated "by weight" of timber supplied. Trees alive, secular, are cut to make money, or better to enrich the multinationals unable to control the harmful effects of their activities.
Buying these lands at low cost, freeing them, and keeping them, represents a hope for present and future generations.

story:
Waste as a source of health and environmental threat to the poor people of Eastern Nigeria.

We are Enviro clean face ltd, we are team of three and we studied facility management in the University.

We are here to source fund in order to enable us start our waste management and recycling facility in Nigeria basically the eastern part of the country. We have lived in Europe and we have seen how clean and healthy the environment can be and we also know the health benefit of a clean environment and also the health risk and environmental hazards associated with waste littered environment. We have gathered experience in waste management by working in some of the reputable waste management companies in Europe.

Looking at what waste can do and what can be done with waste in terms of recycling and knowing fully well that many people are not aware of the danger that locks behind every waste littered on the roads, rivers, dumpsites and every nook and cranny of the environment. It is difficult to control and manage the level of waste being dumped on every road side you walk by. This waste has grown to the level of blocking all the drainage systems and rivers in the city and states thereby causing unseen harm to the people and the environment at large.

Many people are yet to know the extent these wastes can go in endangering their lives and the natural environment due to their lack of knowledge on how to manage waste, so our aim is to educate and create awareness on how to handle waste and manage it effectively. In the villages and local areas where the poor people and uneducated once are living is where this danger locks the most. This people don’t have enough to eat not to talk of knowing what to do or how to keep the environment clean in order to avoid diseases and other sickness that comes with unclean environment there is need to educate those at the rural areas.

How can someone whose daily lively hood is below $2.00 afford to pay for hospital treatment when he or she is ill, they simply keep quiet and die slowly in pains? We weep for them and we believe that when the environment is cleaned up the less privileged even without money to feed can still survive and live long in a cleaner environment.


Our goals:

Creating awareness on the hazards and harmfulness of unclean environment

Eliminating waste on the roads, rivers, lakes and through rivers to avoid contamination

Reducing environmental pollution which is the originator of some health issues facing us today

Creation of job opportunity for the local people and the poor masses that can barely feed

Installing a deep waste collection container in every area of the states

Providing a regular waste collection services all over the state

Set up waste collection center in every local area of the states

Generating revenue into the states purse through waste collection, sorting and recycling.

WHAT WE NEED:

Not to mince words, we need money:

We are upcoming company and we need financial support to carry out our project

We need money to pay wages to employees who are going to put in their hearts and body to clean all the wastes off the roads and river side and every dump areas that are posing threats to lives

We also need infrastructure support.

What we will do with the money:

Buy lots of deep waste collection containers and install them in every local areas, market places and city centers of every state in the eastern part of Nigeria.

Buy also a small waste collection container for every residential building in the states

Buy waste collection vehicles or trucks that collect waste from every municipality in the states

Educate the people on the benefit and usefulness of clean environment and also on how to use the deep waste collection containers (how to separate waste and putting the waste in the right container).

Train the employees on how to collect and transport waste and also how to separate or sort wastes.

Purchase few acres of lands in every municipality for the setting up of the waste collection center.

Build a recycling facility in a separate but not too distant location where all the collected and sorted recyclable items can be recycled and bagged for further use

Lease a vast land for dumping non recyclable waste thereby inviting expert in energy plant building to come in and create energy from the waste for the locals living close to the area.

Purchasing standard collecting and processing infrastructure with any leftover fund.


Recycling as a future project:

Our company is a diversified one; we are also going into recycling of all the recyclable materials ranging from: plastics, paper, cardboards and metals. The company intends to open a collection centers all over the states where all the recyclable items can be collected bagged and transported to the recycling plant in future.

We will appreciate the little you are able to donate but if you can not help us financially we will also appreciate if you can help us to tell your friends and families to support us in starting this company which will help to creat jobs for the less privelege

thanks

story:
About Kim- The Wildlife Protector

 

I want to dedicate one whole year of my life to working at the Amazon Shelter animal sanctuary and release center.

I have always loved animals and from a young age, I wanted to go to the Amazon rainforest. In 2015 I finally made it to the Peruvian Amazon, where I volunteered at a research station and discovered how amazing the forest is and how important it is to protect the animals and plants that live there. I have travelled to Peru every year since, each time learning more and more about the wildlife, but it wasn’t until mid-2017 that I volunteered at Amazon Shelter and finally found a place where I felt I could really make a positive difference to protecting the wonderful Amazon wildlife I had encountered.

There and then I made a personal decision to be a wildlife protector and help Amazon Shelter in all that I could. Since last summer I have been helping with fundraising, communications and improving the animal’s enclosures and the general upkeep of the sanctuary. It’s a lot of work to keep this beautiful place running and to rehabilitate and release the animals we rescue. Over the months I've seen how much hard work pays off and what having strong determination can do for you. Now I want to go all in and spend a whole year living and working at the Sanctuary full time - dedicating my life to this cause.

My goal is to raise $6,000 to help cover a year's stay at the shelter. This amount will cover my cost of living such as accommodation, food, transport, jungle clothing and equipment.

As well as working every day for the care and release of these animals I also want to tell my story through blogs, photos and films and will post regularly throughout my time there to show how the work we are doing is really making a difference.

For me, this would be a dream come true. Not only will I be helping rehabilitate animals, but I will help educate volunteers, students, tourists and locals about animal trafficking and the importance of the rainforest. So far I've had the opportunity to work closely with Sloths, Capuchins, Peccaries, Toucans, Woolly Monkeys, Red Howler Monkeys and Macaws. They all have great personalities and stories to tell. I want the world to know about the issues affecting these animals and to show them how they can help by getting involved with Amazon Shelter’s work.

The Amazon Shelter has changed my life and I now want to give my all to helping rescue and release more beautiful wild animals than ever.

Your support will help this dream to become a reality. Huge Thanks!

 

About Amazon Shelter

 

Amazon Shelter is a wildlife rehabilitation and release center, in Puerto Maldonado, Peru. Situated on the Tambopata river in the lowland Amazon rainforest, the shelter takes in animals who have suffered from deforestation, animal trafficking and hunting. They take in dozens of animals each year, rehabilitate them and release them back into the wild. It's run by founder Magali Salinas, a woman who 14 years ago left her life in Lima in order to follow her passion for wildlife.

Amazon Shelter's purpose is not only to rehabilitate but to educate people about the importance of environmental and animal protection. It’s a place of hope and it gives animals another chance at life.

 

Challenges Of The Amazon

 

In our region, the biodiversity is threatened by illegal logging, mining, agriculture and hunting. All of these actions affect the forest greatly, causing animals to flee their homes or are forcefully taken by animal traffickers. One of the greatest issues Amazon Shelter faces is the lack of awareness of illegal animal trafficking.

 

How Amazon Shelter is making a difference

 

By taking in animals that have been captured, sold as pets or left for dead, Amazon Shelter is providing a safe haven for wild animals to recuperate before being reintroduced into the wild. Their education outreach programs are teaching people in Peru and beyond the importance of the rainforest and its wildlife. Only if people know about the issues affecting the rainforest and the importance and beauty of these animals can they change their behavior. Magali and Amazon Shelter have worked tirelessly for 14 years to make a difference. Now I want to help take their work to the next stage, increasing their capacity to house and release animals, and growing their educational programs to reach more people around the world and show how important it is to conserve the forest and the animals who live there.

 

Thank you, from one animal protector to another.

 

Want to know more?

My wild story: https://medium.com/@kim.cruz94/wildlife-protect...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ONGAmazonShelter/

Website: http://amazonshelter.org/

story:
Introduction

I am Sande Allan, a graduate of IBA  from Unites states International University.  I am a hustler, seasoned businessman, business development consultant and a firm believer in social enterprise.

This campaign comes as an opportunity to enable us engage marginalized members of our community into gainful employment, wealth creation and community economic transformation using simple low cost technologies.

This is after over 3 years effort seeking local funding to move our concept to reality.

We already have over 500 youth organized under a local community based organization engaged in waste collection to the dumpsite. We wish to build their capacity and transform them from scavenging into value producers of quality commercially viable products which they will sell and earn value income.

Our model avails a total solution to all solid waste generated in our households while engaging members of the community in the entire value chain.

As a funding partner, we seek both cash and physical equipment to achieve our goals and being the founding funders we shall travel the entire journey together and ensure a full update of the entire project.

We need around usd 55,000 to carry out the first one year phase of the project after which the project can sustain itself as we engage into the growth stage. All activities have been thought through to have a commercial value and hence sustain themselves.

This is the first private total waste recycling solution engaging local community in the value chain and already had received local acceptance and ownership.

Whatever little fund we manage to secure on this platform will go towards moving the project forward even if its purchase of one item. We believe every step, is a step forward.

The Impact

This project first will use the funders support to contribute towards a better leaving environment where what we call waste is converted into permanent value thereby improving the social economic lifestyles of the community members we engage.

As a business development consultant i have so far contributed to the success of two social enterprises engaging the girl child in low cost sanitary pad manufacturing, marketing, distribution and mhm capacity building training.

This project is a continuation of my passion towards collective efforts to achieve the much needed economic transformation across africa.

In its first year of operation this project will directly impact 500 community members among women and youth which will grow as we scale up.

Most importantly, we want to create a feeling of ownership for the project among the citizens, whose waste is managed and whose local environment is improved by the Project. Our Youth will be collecting waste from community homesteads at a maximum of 1.5 to 2.0 usd per month. We also seek to engage the community to participate the waste segregation at site program to make the recycling process easier.

MEASURABLE IN NUMBERS

• 300 full time employment opportunities;

• One decentralized SWM project covering 5,000 people, or 2,000 households and commercial premises;

• 400 grams of biodegradable waste per household per day to be composted into organic manure;

• 600 grams of non-biodegradable waste per household per day to be recycled or reused.

Risks & Challenges

One such risk is linked to the hand-over of the project to the community. There is a risk of the community not prioritizing the project after it has been handed over to them.

We hope to mitigate this risk by creating a solid support for the project among various Community actors, e.g. the public government officials, private corporations, school pupils, volunteers, employees, and etc, and thereby increasing the expectations on the community administration.

As projects are handed over to the NSSWM, they also run the risk of becoming politicized and the Self Help Group members risk being used to gain political sympathies in different groups. It is important that all parties are aware of this risk and that it is reduced as

much as possible through community participation, transparency, and local ownership.

The household collection fee of USD 1.5-2 per month is another obvious risk factor. Since government budgets for SWM systems generally are covered by the overall property tax, there will most probably be an initial resistance towards the monthly fee to be paid by the Households from the current 0.5-1.5 usd.

It will take some time to convince the public of the project benefits. Hence, in order to get the project rolling, the first months of waste collection will be at the same fee with some subsidy coming in to support from the county government and other project promoters.

Finally, SSWM projects in Kenya run the risk of bypassing and disregarding those people who are already engaged in waste management in the informal sector (i.e. the so-called rag pickers or chokolas). We are fully aware of this risk and will do our uttermost to firstly identify these individuals and thereafter motivate them to join the SWM project as full time employees.

We therefore believe in this project and ask all reading our pitch to help pass word around to all those who could be interested in partnering with us to make this dream a reality.

Any for of contribution is welcome even if its just a website sponsorship or some word of advise. We honored to share our idea and look forward to partner and make it a reality.

We much obliged to be part of this campaign platform.

I can be reached on dreamteamug@gmail.com or +254708157713.

story:
Do Something Beautiful for the Ugly

  • The role of the ugly animals is crucial for the planet, the ecosystem, and ultimately, our survival. That is why we have stepped forward to work towards saving ugly animals that are in danger of extinction and that need our help.
  • We want to reach millions of people throughout the world and create awareness about the importance of the ugly animals, and saving them, as we would also be saving our planet.
  • We are two animal lovers committed with the environment and we want you to join the movement and save the ugly.
  • We invite you to take action now by contributing to our campaign. 

 

Save the ugly, get beautiful perks

  • We need the resources to create and promote awareness campaigns to change the mindset about ugly animals -some of them in the brink of extinction- and create the sense of urgency about saving them.
  • For your contribution, we will thank you with our perks, including t-shirts, caps, mugs, and water bottles. 

 

The Impact

  • Your contribution will help animals, the ecosystem, and ultimately YOU.
  • We are award-winning advertising creative directors with several years creating and launching successful campaigns for multinational brands. 
  • We are convinced that our most successful campaign is the one that makes our world a better place for all of us!

 

TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you don't want any of our perks you can still contribute to save the ugly. Any amount is welcome! 
  • You can also help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends and contacts, or in your social media.

You can also help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends and contacts, or in your social media.

story: Ben family wish to solicit for your support in other to meet the needs and goal towards this campaign. story:
The Enviro Paint Tray 

                                  The worlds first Eco friendly painting system. 

                                      

The Enviro paint tray will save water and reduce toxic waste water

 by 70%


                                  

                                                  Aluminium Premium Model 


How it Works

The paint and the roller are enclosed inside the Enviro paint tray. The tray has unique internal humidifying features that create a terrarium effect. 

               

This stops the paint and roller from                             drying out! 

                            Advantage

 With the paint and the roller protected there is no need to wash the roller or tray at the end of the day.

 

Its so easy 

I just close it up and that’s it! I can lock it up and leave it on site or pop it in the van and go home.  It can be left over night, a couple of days or a week for that matter and the paint and the roller are still  good to go.  


If you are a a painter you will know just how 

cool that is!

 


Productivity

   The Enviro Paint Tray doesn’t eliminate cleaning rollers and trays, but not having to wash them up every day and then set up again the next day has 

increased the productivity of  my business. 


Not washing up and setting up rollers and paint trays has saved my business $5000 AUD per year per painter.  



Less Time Cleaning = More Time Painting

 

 More Importantly 

The Enviro Paint Tray will reduced 

water usage and toxic waste water by 

70% per year!   

 

   

                           Capacity                                                        

The Enviro Paint Tray can hold up to six litres of paint


 


 

The Enviro Roller 230mm 270mm 360mm 


Goal

My goal right now is to produce the Enviro Paint Tray by injection molding and make the worlds first Eco friendly painting system more affordable and available to everyone.

  

Ready to Go.

I’ve been working with a first class Australian company to converted my designs from costly aluminium to injection molding. Their high tech plastic is as tough as nails and will stand up to the rigors of any heavy handed painter. The mold designs, CAD drawing, branding, packaging, costing and production time line have been completed and the project is  

on track and ready to go.  


Your Help 

The tooling and set up required for injection moulding is incredible expensive and that is why we are asking for your financial support through  crowd funding. 


The Enviro Team are Ordinary Working People 

 Over the last 8 years we have invested our own money and countless hours,                         after work and on weekends to develop the world’s first                            Eco friendly painting system

Our Contribution

Enviro Paint Tray


Design and Registrations $6,000.00

International Patent Cooperation Treaty  (PCT) application  $18,600.00

Trade mark design and registrations  $4,000.00 

Material and prototyping   $12,000.00  

Testing assessment and development  $2,000.00  

Environmental impact assessment   $ 1,500.00  

Production prototyping  $7,000.00  

Mould design and CAD application  $3,000.00 

 Enviro Paint Roller

Material and prototyping   $1,000.00  

Production prototyping  $1,000.00  

Mold design and CAD application  $3,000

Campaign Investment


Funding campaign video and web page  $8,000.00  

Digital PR and campaign development  $5,000.00

Our Investment $71,500.00 AUD


Your Contribution

 Reaching the funding goal will guarantee this water saving painting system becomes more affordable and available to everyone.

Enviro Paint Tray

Moulding Components, Paint tray external paint tray housing, Hinge pin, Production soft ware, Pre production run, Quality control inspection and sign off.  Budget  $94,000.00   

Ship and delivered moulds,   Install moulds and production soft ware,  Install tooling and soft ware to brand and packaging all components,  Conducted pre production run.   Budget  $6,000.00   

Enviro Paint Roller 

Moulding Components;  Handle, rollers and thumb screw,  Production soft ware,  Pre production run,   Quality control inspection and sign off. Roller frame and  cage. Tooling,  Steel Dies, Steel press,  Production soft ware, Pre production run,  Quality control inspection and sign off.  Budget  $12,000.00   

Ship and delivered all paint roller components, Install moulds and dies,  Install production soft ware,  Conducted pre production run,  Install tooling and soft ware for branding and packaging all components.  Budget  $6,000.00   

This is the big day we have all been working for! 

The First Production Run  

Supply production material, Warehousing,  Install warehousing and stock control soft ware,  Install clear and simple administration soft ware, Employ staff to guarantee supporters perks and rewards are delivered on time,  Install and maintain accessible communication pathways to inform and engage all our supporters in every stage of this project. Budget   $17,000.00   

Total Funding Goal  $135,000.00 USD

Right Now

Our contribution is to manage this campaign with the utmost integrity and complete the project.


The Enviro Paint Tray  

 Is the most water efficient painting system that has ever been on the market.

With your help we could save a billion litres of 

water per year.


More Importantly

 with your help we could stop over a billion litres of toxic waste from ever harming the environment.

                                                                    Please support this campaign 

by

making a pledge or selecting a perk.



Frequently asked Questions

                                                                                                                                                             Q: Why does the Enviro paint tray close up and stand in a vertically position?  

A: A standard paint tray is filled with paint and laid on the floor. The open configuration of the tray dries the paint and the roller out and exposes the paint and roller to airborne debris. The enclosed nature of the Enviro paint tray eliminates that problem.

Work Place Hazard 

An open tray of paint and a roller laid on the floor of a busy work site is an obvious hazard for passing foot traffic. Securing the paint and the roller, vertically within the Enviro paint tray eliminates that problem.


Q: What stops the paint and the roller from drying out?  

A: The Enviro paint tray has unique internal features that create a terrarium effect; this stops the paint from skinning over and the roller from drying out.


Q: How long can I leave the paint and the roller in Enviro paint tray before they dry out?  

A: The paint and the roller can be left over night, a couple of days or a week depending on conditions etc.   NB: Store The Enviro paint tray inside out of direct sun light and strong wind!


Q: Can I use any paint roller frame with the Enviro paint tray  

A: No! The Enviro paint roller frame must be used to complete the system.


Q: Can I transport the Enviro paint tray in my vehicle with paint in it?  

A: Yes, make sure it is firmly secured in a fully protected position in the vehicle out of direct sun light and strong wind


Q: What type of paint can I use in the Enviro paint tray?  

A: For best results I recommend quality water based paints and coatings.  NB: Oil or solvent based paints and coating may be used but have limited storage time.   2Pack paints and coating are not recommended at this time.


Q: Do I have to put 6 litres of paint in the Enviro paint tray every time?   

A: No you can put as little as 1 litre of paint OR whatever is required to a maximum of 6 litres.


Q: What size roller sleeve can I use?   

A: The Enviro paint tray will accommodate 230mm 270mm or 360mm roller sleeves.


Q: Can I use an extension pole with the Enviro paint roller?  

A: Yes, if required.


Q: What size extension poll can I use?  

A: The Enviro paint tray is very stable and you can use fixed polls from .5m/ 2Ft up to 1.8m/ 6Ft and extension polls form .5m/ 2Ft right up to 3.6m/ 12Ft. 


Q: How do I clean the Enviro paint tray?   

A: The paint tray detaches from the external housing for easy cleaning access.  

Q: Is the Enviro paint tray hard to lift and carry around a work site like open paint trays?   

A: No it’s easy; just secure the roller in the slot on top of the housing. Close up the paint tray, grab the handle and off you go.


Q: Will the plastic model of the Enviro paint tray work as efficiently as the aluminium premium model shown in the video?   
A: Yes, and it will perform to the highest possible standard faultlessly every time.
