story:
Save Australia's Wildlife during this Wildfire Catastrophe

The current fire season is the worst on record in Australia, with millions of hectares of bushland destroyed, dozens of people killed or missing, and reports of up to a billion animals dead and injured. Koalas are one of Australia's most beloved animals, but are now critically endangered native animals.

When you back this campaign, 100% of the profits will go towards the WIRES Australian Wildlife Rescue Organisation (www.wires.org.au).

I designed this #SaveKoalasPin pin as a perk to specifically to help raise awareness and urge everyone to take action in contributing donations to save the animals impacted by this catastrophe in Australia. 

Important! To contribute & claim a pin, make sure to select the #SaveKoalasPin perk on the right hand side. Do not directly enter your own amount to back the campaign, otherwise I cannot give you the pin!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least 100 pins to meet the minimum production requirement from the supplier so this is a Fixed Funding campaign and will only kick off once we meet the goal; if we don't meet the goal, all of the funds will be refunded as per Indiegogo's rules. This campaign will be activated for Indiegogo's InDemand function, so that you can still claim the #SaveKoalasPin perk after the first 100 goal is met, to generate as many donations as possible. Production takes about 1 month, and approximately 2 weeks for delivery after the campaign ends. However, all profits after expenses will immediately go to WIRES as soon as the goal is met.

To give full visibility into how where your money will go, see this estimated expense break-down per pin:

  • Koala Pin Price for Indiegogo backers: US$15 (US$21 after shipping costs)
  • Estimated factory cost to produce: ~US$1.25-1.85 per pin
  • Estimated shipping cost: ~US$5-6.50
  • Indiegogo platform cost: US$1.05 (5% of the funds raised)
  • Indiegogo payment processor cost: US$1.32 (3.9%+USD$0.50)
  • Estimated Proceeds to WIRES Australian Wildlife Rescue: ~US$10.28-$12.37 per pin; total US$1,028~$1,237 for first 100 pins.

Pin details:

  • 1" Width
  • Gold Metal Plating
  • Hard Enamel
  • Including backing card 
  • Produced in 1 month after the campaign finishes & ~2 weeks to deliver

When you back this campaign, feel free to also comment with your social media handles so I can give a public thank you from my IG as well.

The Impact

As reported by CNN here, Australia is being ravaged by the worst wildfires seen in decades, with large swathes of the country devastated since the fire season began in late July.

A total of 27 people have died nationwide, and in the state of New South Wales (NSW) alone, more than 2,000 homes have been destroyed or damaged. State and federal authorities are struggling to contain the massive blazes, even with firefighting assistance from other countries. All this has been exacerbated by persistent heat and drought. New South Wales has been hit the hardest.

WIRES Australian Wildlife Rescue Organisation (www.wires.org.au)'s mission is to actively rehabilitate and preserve Australian wildlife. They have been rescuing and caring for wildlife for over 30 years and is the largest wildlife rescue organisation in Australia. They have a strong reputation in Australia to support the current wildfire catastrophe and in the past, they have responded to more than 90,000 rescues each year.

With a focus on New South Wales which is the area that's being hit the hardest, that's the reason I've chosen to start this campaign & donate all the profits from this campaign to WIRES.

Below is a rough calculation of amount of money raised to WIRES below based on amount of pins backed:

  • 100 pins ~ US$1,237 in proceeds to WIRES
  • 200 pins - US$2,474 in proceeds to WIRES
  • 500 pins -  US$6,185 in proceeds to WIRES
  • 1000 pins - US$12,370 in proceeds to WIRES

Risks & Challenges

Production will kick off as soon when campaign finishes at 45 days assuming we meet the 100 pins goal ($2,100 USD or $16,500 HKD). As I haven't produced any of the pins yet and it’s my first time, the production & shipping costs may fluctuate, but through my extensive research and contacting multiple suppliers, I have confidence in the reasonable estimation of the amount of money that can directly go towards WIRES with each Koala Pin backed. As well, since it will take time to produce the pins, please expect around 1 month for production and 2 weeks for shipping, however all of the proceeds received after expenses (at least the US$11.60 per pin) will be donated as soon as the first 100 pins goal is met.

I will also try my best to ensure that the actual pin looks exactly like the design of the  mock-up but please be mindful that there may still be discrepancies after actual production due to the that handmade items may still have minor imperfections. In addition the mock up is not to scale, actual size of pin will be 1” in width. 

Since this is a Fixed Funding campaign type, If we don't meet the 100 pins goal, all amounts will be refunded 100% as per Indiegogo's guidelines.

I will make sure to keep updating the progress on this page on donations to WIRES, actual costs of the expense,  as well as the fulfilment timelines.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to donate directly to the cause, you can check out WIRES website below as well as other charities in Australia that's supporting the relief efforts:

  • WIRES (https://www.wires.org.au/blog/emergency-donatio...)
  • Australian Red Cross (https://www.redcross.org.au/news-and-media/news...)
  • RSPCA New South Wales (https://www.rspcansw.org.au/bushfire-appeal)
  • WWF (https://gifts.worldwildlife.org/gift-center/gif...)

If you're an enamel pin producer yourself and you're willing to provide your service at a lower than your normal charge for this particular Australia wildfire relief charity purpose, please connect with me & I will also highlight you as an campaign team member of this campaign. 

If you know enamel pin producers that are good quality and charge less than what I've quoted in the cost break-down section, please connect them with me. 

If you can't contribute, at least spread the news! Share news articles on the Australian wildfires, share donation websites, and share this Indiegogo campaign so more people are aware.

Frequently Asked Questions

Why are you doing this?

The fires in Australia is entirely devastating and we can all do our part to help out. Aside from donating money, I hope I can also make others contribute by 'donating' my drawings skills for free as a Koala Pin design & use that as an incentive to influence people to be more aware & take action to donate and scale more impact.

Do you make other pins or artwork?

I haven't made any other pins and don't currently commercialise my artwork in any way, but if you're interested in following my artwork creations, I post regularly on Instagram, my handle is @friendlyfishie (www.instagram.com/friendlyfishie).

Why is the campaign in HKD currency?

As I’m a Hong Kong based artist with a Hong Kong bank account, Indiegogo’s rules dictate that this campaign needs to be in HKD currency.

Can I donate directly?

Absolutely! Donate directly to WIRES at https://www.wires.org.au/blog/emergency-donations-to-help-wildlife or the other charities listed in Other Ways You Can Help written above.

Is there shipping cost?

Yes, shipping cost is at a flat rate of HKD$50 but if it costs less to ship to your location,  the unused amount will be donated to WIRES.

If I have more questions, can I contact you?

Yes. For backers, you can read the Indiegogo article here for how to contact me. If you're not a backer, you can direct message me on Instagram at instagram.com/friendlyfishie

WIRES Australian Wildlife Rescue Organisation (www.wires.org.au)'s mission is to actively rehabilitate and preserve Australian wildlife. They have been rescuing and caring for wildlife for over 30 years and is the largest wildlife rescue organisation in Australia. They have a strong reputation in Australia to support the current wildfire catastrophe and in the past, they have responded to more than 90,000 rescues each year.
With a focus on New South Wales which is the area that's being hit the hardest, that's the reason I've chosen to start this campaign & donate all the profits from this campaign to WIRES.
Below is a rough calculation of amount of money raised to WIRES below based on amount of pins backed:

100 pins ~ US$1,237 in proceeds to WIRES
200 pins - US$2,474 in proceeds to WIRES
500 pins -  US$6,185 in proceeds to WIRES
1000 pins - US$12,370 in proceeds to WIRES


Risks & Challenges
Production will kick off as soon when campaign finishes at 45 days assuming we meet the 100 pins goal ($2,100 USD or $16,500 HKD). As I haven't produced any of the pins yet and it’s my first time, the production & shipping costs may fluctuate, but through my extensive research and contacting multiple suppliers, I have confidence in the reasonable estimation of the amount of money that can directly go towards WIRES with each Koala Pin backed. As well, since it will take time to produce the pins, please expect around 1 month for production and 2 weeks for shipping, however all of the proceeds received after expenses (at least the US$11.60 per pin) will be donated as soon as the first 100 pins goal is met.
I will also try my best to ensure that the actual pin looks exactly like the design of the  mock-up but please be mindful that there may still be discrepancies after actual production due to the that handmade items may still have minor imperfections. In addition the mock up is not to scale, actual size of pin will be 1” in width. 
Since this is a Fixed Funding campaign type, If we don't meet the 100 pins goal, all amounts will be refunded 100% as per Indiegogo's guidelines.
I will make sure to keep updating the progress on this page on donations to WIRES, actual costs of the expense,  as well as the fulfilment timelines.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to donate directly to the cause, you can check out WIRES website below as well as other charities in Australia that's supporting the relief efforts:

WIRES (https://www.wires.org.au/blog/emergency-donatio...)
Australian Red Cross (https://www.redcross.org.au/news-and-media/news...)
RSPCA New South Wales (https://www.rspcansw.org.au/bushfire-appeal)
WWF (https://gifts.worldwildlife.org/gift-center/gif...)

If you're an enamel pin producer yourself and you're willing to provide your service at a lower than your normal charge for this particular Australia wildfire relief charity purpose, please connect with me & I will also highlight you as an campaign team member of this campaign. 
If you know enamel pin producers that are good quality and charge less than what I've quoted in the cost break-down section, please connect them with me. 
If you can't contribute, at least spread the news! Share news articles on the Australian wildfires, share donation websites, and share this Indiegogo campaign so more people are aware.
Frequently Asked QuestionsWhy are you doing this?The fires in Australia is entirely devastating and we can all do our part to help out. Aside from donating money, I hope I can also make others contribute by 'donating' my drawings skills for free as a Koala Pin design & use that as an incentive to influence people to be more aware & take action to donate and scale more impact.Do you make other pins or artwork?I haven't made any other pins and don't currently commercialise my artwork in any way, but if you're interested in following my artwork creations, I post regularly on Instagram, my handle is @friendlyfishie (www.instagram.com/friendlyfishie).Why is the campaign in HKD currency?As I’m a Hong Kong based artist with a Hong Kong bank account, Indiegogo’s rules dictate that this campaign needs to be in HKD currency.Can I donate directly?Absolutely! Donate directly to WIRES at https://www.wires.org.au/blog/emergency-donations-to-help-wildlife or the other charities listed in Other Ways You Can Help written above.Is there shipping cost?Yes, shipping cost is at a flat rate of HKD$50 but if it costs less to ship to your location,  the unused amount will be donated to WIRES.If I have more questions, can I contact you?Yes. For backers, you can read the Indiegogo article here for how to contact me. If you're not a backer, you can direct message me on Instagram at instagram.com/friendlyfishie

story:
Problem-solvers With a Purpose

No fancy credentials here. Just two sustainably-minded graduate students finishing up their journeys with the VCU da Vinci Center. While this idea first developed as our capstone project, we quickly saw a strong potential to change the urban landscape of our city as we have all come to accept it.

Green Wheels' founders, Ian Ragland and Alan Vollmer, both have ambitions of a greener future for generations to come. We notice wasteful practices, and a severe lack in sustainable infrastructure all around us every day. More specifically, we've come to recognize the void of agricultural knowledge among children born into the digital era, especially those living in urban areas. 

We think the best way to revitalize earth-consciousness is to collaborate with their school teachers, and develop an agricultural learning experience that caters to the needs expressed by their academic advisors. To do this, we've developed a mobile greenhouse capable of being easily transported to, from, and around schools and other areas throughout Richmond.

As accessibility to fresh food seems to be a common major issue in most urban settings, we believe this product could even become a sustainable solution that will help combat food deserts once we can scale up our operations.

And that's where you all fit into this.

We are calling on the good faith of our community to make this program a reality. We've developed one prototype for a proof of our concept. So far, schools love it. Binford Middle School and Patrick Henry School of Science & Arts want to partner with us! However, we have met the limit of our development budget and now we are at a standstill until more sufficient funding starts to come through. We want wheel more of these things out all across Richmond, and we want to perfect our design in the process. We're finally in a great spot to make this thing happen.

 

Our Immediate Goal

 

To make this happen, we want to develop five complete mobile greenhouses (this includes the GreenWheelBarrow and the detachable greenhouse) over the next couple months.

Our first prototype turned out great! But we're perfectionists and want to keep making tweaks until everyone thinks our design is flawless. 

To meet our next milestone, we're setting a fundraising goal of $10,000 over the span of two months. This will be enough to entirely cover the development, experimentation, and material cost of five mobile greenhouses.

If we do not reach our goal by that set time, all of our backers will be refunded their money and our project will not commence as expected. Tragic.. but true. 

 

Tiers of Sponsorship

Tier 1: Green Thumb
$5 - A single plant is purchased for a greenhouse. You get updates on the plant’s growth over its lifetime.

Tier 2: Gardener
$10 - Two plants purchased for a greenhouse. You get updates on the plant’s growth over their lifetime.

Tier 3: Grower
$20 - Four plants purchased for a greenhouse. You also get to choose from a selection of plants to install in one of our greenhouses. Your voice matters!

Tier 4: Farmer
$50 - Four plants, the option to choose what kind of plants, and a bag of Green Wheels swag.

Tier 5: Agriculturalist
$100 - Eight plants (an entire shelf in one of our greenhouses), a choice of plants, a T-Shirt, and your name on the shelf with your plants.

Tier 6: Earth Mother/Earth Father
$500 - Not only do you get everything from the previous tiers, but you get your name fabricated into the GreenWheelBarrow itself! Totally in honor of your generous contribution. This option will allow us to manufacture a complete GreenWheelBarrow and greenhouse for a school of your choosing! Pick from our selection of schools, and we will make sure that your GreenWheelBarrow is made to your liking! Pick the colors, the plants, how you'd like your name displayed so everyone knows how amazing you are!

Tier 7: World Builder
$1,000 - All the same as Earth Mother/Earth Father, but you get TWO GreenWheelBarrows with your name on it!!

Tier 8: Universal Donor
$5,000 - This is enough to have us install five mobile greenhouses in schools or areas of your choosing. You can pick from our list of connected schools, and support extra curriculum in that school for an entire year! Or, if you have an area you'd like to impact otherwise, let us know and we will build the bridge for you. Together, we can make anything happen.

Along with the gifts of every other tier below it, we want you to become a partner in building out our program. We’d love to consult with you to see how you want this implemented and what you’d like to see going forward. Your donation goes above and beyond anything we could ever dream. You are truly a benefactor of the world and you want to see it grow greener. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

 

Anything counts

If you're not in the position to help fund our campaign, we get it. That's why we're here. That being said, even you spreading word of our cause will help us out so much! Please, share our link with anyone and everyone you know who might want to get involved. There's a real power in numbers, and if we want to make this happen, that's exactly what it's going to take!

Let's grow together.

story:
Summary

Hello, we are Sanae from Canada, Julian from Germany, and Haseen from Indonesia, interns at Yayasan Green Books Indonesia (Green-Books.org), and this crowdfunder is our project.

Green-Books.org is a grassroots non-profit promoting environmental education for teachers and children in Indonesia, focusing on waste management, biodiversity conservation, and climate change.

 Why is this crowdfunder so important? Well, the success of this campaign determines if we can carry on with our mission for another year to educate millions of children, or if we will have to give up on our goal. Due to the pandemic, we lost most of our corporate sponsors, so now it is time to ask for YOUR support.

Luckily, we have some awesome rewards for you like beautifully designed hi-tech nano-filter face masks made from eco-friendly materials. We also have other rewards if you donate extra.

In order to reach our goal, we need YOU to help us raise 20,000 Euros with this campaign!

 

 

What we need

The funds raised from this crowdfunding campaign allow us to continue for another year training teachers and develop and implement curriculums for students. These initiatives include:

  • Biodiversity Conservation Program for classes 1-3 of elementary schools
  • Zero Waste School Program  for classes 4-6 of Elementary schools
  • Single-Use Plastic Free School Program for classes 4-6 of Elementary schools
  • Climate Change Education Program for high school schools. 
  • Online teachers course introducing Education for Sustainability 
  • Online Eco-Activities curriculum for distant learning for elementary school students

The funds raised from this crowdfunding campaign will also allow us to motivate teachers, students, and schools with the following eco-friendly rewards:

  • Tasini reusable eco-bags
  • Nazava XL water filters
  • Stainless steel Zero Waste Lunch Kits
  • Binoculars
  • Organic seeds and tree seedlings
  • Current, colorful, and engaging kids’ books in the Indonesian language on topics like fauna, flora, ecosystems, and the environment

 

Distribution of the funds raised through this crowdfunder:

What you get

To encourage your donations we offer Nanogaitors - high-performance face masks featuring nano-filter technology that is able to filter more than 99.9% of airborne particles and contaminants up to 0.4nm. The mask filters:

  • 99% of allergens
  • 99% of dust particles
  • 100% of PM2 and 10 dust particles
  • 99.9% of viruses

 

 

Nanogaiter is an extremely eco-friendly brand. It’s reusable and washable for up to 30 times (though it still maintains a 99% efficiency). It’s also made up entirely of recycled PET bottles and equipped with HeiQ Smart Temp, Anti Odor & Anti Bacteria Technologies. In an attempt to bring awareness to Indonesia’s deforestation and destruction of coral reefs the mask's design illustrates these ecosystems and their endangered species.

By donating extra, you and your group of friends can get a free sunset cruise aboard Black Pearl Jimbaran Bay, here in Bali. Or if that isn't really your thing you can stay at our base, Pondok Gede Eco-Lodge for a couple of free nights with a friend, and also spend the day with our founder, who'll show you all the hot spots in Canggu, take you surfing, and introduce you to some eco-living tips! 

 

 

The impact

Indonesia’s unique natural environment is considered one of the most biodiverse on the planet and provides its services far beyond Indonesia's borders. Unfortunately, it is in conflict with the world demand for resources and a domestic economy driven by a growing population of 260 million — including 85 million children lacking environmental education. Here are some issues that we tackle with our programs:

High rates of deforestation

  • In Indonesia, massive tracts of rainforests the size of 76 football fields are cut down every hour. The enormous ecosystem disruption is accompanied by increased flooding and forest fires while driving endemic species like orangutans, tigers, elephants, and rhinos to the verge of extinction.

Pollution that poisons our food chains

  • Java’s Citarum River, lined by 2,000 factories, is one of the most polluted rivers in the world. Life-threatening mercury from gold mining in Papua, Sumbawa, and Kalimantan leaks into the surrounding watersheds. After China, Indonesia is the 2nd largest polluter of oceans with plastic, which is mistaken as food by marine animals.

Devastation of marine ecosystems

  • High demand for Indonesian fish leads to unsustainable overfishing. 82% of Indonesia’s coral reefs along its 17,000 islands have been damaged or are at risk as a result of dynamite and cyanide fishing, trawling, sedimentation, agricultural and industrial effluents, bleaching and ocean acidification.

Exploitation of endangered species

  • The popularity of oriental medicine and demand for pets push already endangered species to the brink. Among these species are the Sumatran tiger, Bornean elephant, Bali starling, Green sea turtle, and the Bornean orangutan which are all featured on our masks.

Education gap

  • Indonesia’s education system is failing to deliver knowledge on key subjects like the environment and sustainability. As a result, children have little understanding of the natural processes around them and have no role models who promote eco-awareness.

 

 

Green-Books.org is proud to say that since 2014 we have reached 5,235 individuals in the following educational programs: 

  • Biodiversity conservation includes creating eco-activities such as interactive games, quizzes, storytelling, upcycling, and arts and crafts! This raises awareness on the need to save ecosystems and endangered species. 
  • Zero waste school program that educates children about the problems that occur due to plastic waste and microplastic being dumped in the sea. With this program, students learn to reduce their use of plastic and switch to more sustainable products. 
  • Online eco-activities that help families tremendously after the closure of schools to learn about how to live in a sustainable and eco-friendly way and why that is so important.
  • Environmental books have been donated to thousands of children. We have given many current, colorful, and engaging books for kids on topics like fauna, flora, ecosystems, and the environment to numerous schools across Indonesia. 
  • Single-Use Plastic Free School Program that is specifically meant for children in Lombok and Malang area to educate them about the importance of refusing single-use plastic as much as possible. 
  • Climate Change Education Program designed for high school students. They’re taught about the dangerous impacts CO2 and other greenhouse gasses can have on our environment and what lifestyle changes need to be made.
  • Online teacher's courses on education for sustainability. The goal of this online training is to introduce local educators to the foundational concepts of education for sustainability that will enable students to adapt to new challenges in the 21st century and to inspire them to live in harmony with nature.  

 

 

Other ways you can help

We appreciate any donations or support towards our mission. If your current situation doesn't allow you to donate, you can still support us by sharing our campaign on your social media and with your family and friends! Any attention to our campaign is a warmly welcome! 

It's an easy way, using the Indiegogo share tools. Also, Green-Books.org is happy about any volunteer work or promotion in any form! For further information about volunteering just send us an email to volunteer@green-books.org

We would like to give a quick shoutout to our friend Tomas and his NGO, myelen.com for their help in setting up this campaign!

story:
Canada is geographically the second largest nation in the world. A vast country with a low population, much of it is a wilderness, host to boreal forests spanning to the Arctic Circle, Acadian forests at its eastern Maritime and southern temperate regions, and rainforests along the British Columbian coast. The forest seems to go on forever, endless and beautiful.

If only it were so.

Over the last two decades Canada has devolved to be the world's leading deforestation nation. Loggers in British Columbia push into protected old growth rainforest and even attempted to clear cut the ancient trees of near legendary scale at Castle Grove on Vancouver Island. The huge province of Ontario has less than .07% forest over one hundred twenty years of age remaining in any accessible southern region, yet loggers have pushed heavily into what little remains, going after the Temagami and anything else they can reach by road or water. In the Atlantic provinces, there is virtually no old growth forest remaining. Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island have less than 1% of their original Acadian forests, and while New Brunswick sports a bit more, it is under constant threat. Indeed, in the past twenty years, a quiet environmental holocaust has begun in the Maritime provinces, with government consistently catering to the demands of Big Industry for wood pulp and more recently for the biofuel fiasco.

Mills like Northern Pulp, in Pictou County, Nova Scotia, are operated by parent corporations such as Asia-based Paper Excellence, a company with a substantial history of environmental abuse around the world. To feed the pulp mill, the forests of the region are being cut at an impossible-to-sustain rate in order to satisfy investors' desire for cheap pulp and easy profit. No one outside the mill can say quite for certain exactly what the market is for this pulp, though suspected uses range from paper to pelletized fuel for overseas power plants.

The demands of the pulp mills alone were unsustainable. In December, 2014, retired Natural Resources biologist Robert Bancroft wrote in Halifax's Chronicle-Herald that the government is turning Nova Scotia forests into an over-harvested pulp farm. But about that time, other forces of Big Industry--operating behind closed doors--created the biomass power plan. The idea they pandered was that the forests of Atlantic Canada could be cut and burned to produce cheap power. A great deal of backroom dealing went on between Big Industry and political circles, conservation science was dismissed, and ultimately the Nova Scotia government bought into this idea, allowing biomass companies to raze forests to the ground for a mere $8 and change per ton of wood fiber.

Not a decade ago, the world tried an experiment: turning crops into oil for cars and industry.  Ecologists had long warned the biofuel experiment would end in failure. And that it did, and hugely so.  Earth's thin zone of topsoil could not possibly produce energy sufficient to feed the population while also powering cars and heavy machinery. The biofuel experiment caused food prices to skyrocket globally, and most adversely affected the poor who already could barely afford to eat, as well as decimating land that served as major carbon sinks, i.e., encouraging clearing of rainforest for room to grow cheap biofuel crops.

Nova Scotia's biomass experiment will burn the forest itself to run major power plants, and it is resulting in the same fiasco. The thin biosphere of topsoil cannot possibly regenerate the forest faster than it is destroyed. And though vast swaths of woodlands have been razed right down to the roots in the ground in an attempt to get every last bit of burnable material, the hunger of the power plants is insatiable. Last year, investigative reporters learned the biomass plants had quietly been importing some 25% of their timber to feed their impossible demands.

The forest of Canada stretches far and wide. Canadians live with it and tend to see it as an immutable part of life. Beyond their cities they have a distant awareness of a vast expanse of green. They drive highways and byways and see it rising on either side of the road. It is a comforting sight, that beautiful wood that seems to go on forever.

But it doesn't, and that it seems unscathed is a carefully orchestrated deception. No place that can be reached by road or water is safe from the depredations of loggers in service of Big Industrys' pulp mills and biomass power schemes. Most anywhere you travel, just beyond sight and hidden by cleverly placed cosmetic hedges, are devastated forests, cut to the ground. Other clear cuts--more than you can possibly imagine--have turned back country, highlands and any place else off the beaten path into a patchwork of dead fields of jagged stumps, hidden by thin hedges of trees left to hide the environmental holocaust. But when companies get reputations for environmental abuse, it hurts public perception, and that hurts investment, so Big Industry has learned to avoid public outcry by keeping its activities on the down low.

This documentary in the making will tell the story of Canada's beleaguered forest. Focusing especially on the damage done to the unique Acadian woodlands of the eastern provinces, a genetically rich region where temperate and boreal biomes meet, we will explore the hidden damage Big Industry doesn't want you to see or know about. We will delve into a decade of backroom deals that have allowed an ecological holocaust in Canada's three Maritime provinces. And we will explore the dirty politics that have been used to silence the scientists, naturalists and environmentalists who would speak out against this.

This will be the untold story of Canada's forests under siege.


This documentary in the making will tell the story of Canada's beleaguered forest. Focusing especially on the damage done to the unique Acadian woodlands of the eastern provinces, a genetically rich region where temperate and boreal biomes meet, we will explore the hidden damage Big Industry doesn't want you to see or know about. We will delve into a decade of backroom deals that have allowed an ecological holocaust in Canada's three Maritime provinces. And we will explore the dirty politics that have been used to silence the scientists, naturalists and environmentalists who would speak out against this.

This will be the untold story of Canada's forests under siege.

What We Need & What You Get

Funds raised will provide travel and production costs to obtain on-site footage and interviews, as well as post production costs to create and master the documentary, and any fees necessary for archived footage or music bites.

A number of unique perks are available to donors.  Signed copies of Cliff Seruntine's popular books on the spirit and joy of living well with nature, Seasons of the Sacred Earth and The Wildwood Way, are available, along with limited edition art, production T-shirts and opportunities to appear in the credits.

This campaign is flex funded, meaning if the full goal is not reached, those funds raised will go toward the making of the documentary.  Canada is in the midst of an environmental holocaust--the worst deforesting nation in the world and the leading polluter among G-20 nations--and we are committed to bringing this to light.  We will launch new fund raisers, pursue grants, and do whatever is necessary to inform the world about Canada's quiet environmental holocaust.

The Impact

The environmental holocaust can only occur because it is kept on the down low.  News of it appears here and there in the media, but no one has put together all the pieces.  Government downplays it.  Canada's current PM has established a reputation for suppressing scientists and interfering with the work of environmental investigators.  And government and business have become adept at obfuscating the facts.  It is our hope to let the world know, to make people angry, and incite people to work toward change.  But that all starts with telling the real story . . .

Cliff Seruntine, the creator of "A Forest Under Siege" is a quiet figure who is nevertheless known internationally for his books on living well with nature.  A certified psychotherapist and lifelong naturalist, Cliff operates a large farm on principles of sustainabiliy, deep ecology and permaculture and continues to write and teach on living in balance with the natural world.

You can learn more about Cliff's work by visiting his YouTube channel at:

https://www.youtube.com/user/TwaCorbiesHollow

Or by visiting his website at:

https://cliffseruntine.wordpress.com/

Risks & Challenges

There are several kinds of challenges in creating such a documentary. Many of the woodcutting sites are difficult to reach. Documenting the destruction of these forests will require a considerable amount of time in the bush getting through challenging terrain. It will wear on both people and equipment. But the biggest problem point will be Maritime Canada's fickle weather. It can rain for weeks at a time, turning back roads and trails into impassable muck. At most, that will only somewhat slow the progress of this documentary. Those involved in the making of this documentary have many years of experience in back country, and we'll manage despite whatever the weather throws at us. It is possible we'll meet up with hostile persons. Canada has a long history of opposing environmentalists, to the point the RCMP has even tried to frame dirty oil protesters ( www.cbc.ca/news/canada/rcmp-bombed-oil-site-in-dirty-tricks-campaign-1.188599 ), but the risk is manageable and barring locking us in a cage forever, the documentary will still be made. I've been involved in environmental issues for a long time, and I've developed an incredibly hard head.

The other great challenge to the production of this video is Canada's long history of political and Big Industry opacity. Back scratching and backroom dealing are common. Burying information is almost a time-honored tradition. Fortunately, we have good resources to help us navigate the the obfuscating white noise of corruption and get to the heart of the matter.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money's tight and times are tough.  If you can't contribute and want to help, let others know about our work.  Link this page or the video, "A Forest Under Seige", and share, share, share . . .
story_txt:
Canada is geographically the second largest nation in the world. A vast country with a low population, much of it is a wilderness, host to boreal forests spanning to the Arctic Circle, Acadian forests at its eastern Maritime and southern temperate regions, and rainforests along the British Columbian coast. The forest seems to go on forever, endless and beautiful.

If only it were so.
Over the last two decades Canada has devolved to be the world's leading deforestation nation. Loggers in British Columbia push into protected old growth rainforest and even attempted to clear cut the ancient trees of near legendary scale at Castle Grove on Vancouver Island. The huge province of Ontario has less than .07% forest over one hundred twenty years of age remaining in any accessible southern region, yet loggers have pushed heavily into what little remains, going after the Temagami and anything else they can reach by road or water. In the Atlantic provinces, there is virtually no old growth forest remaining. Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island have less than 1% of their original Acadian forests, and while New Brunswick sports a bit more, it is under constant threat. Indeed, in the past twenty years, a quiet environmental holocaust has begun in the Maritime provinces, with government consistently catering to the demands of Big Industry for wood pulp and more recently for the biofuel fiasco.

Mills like Northern Pulp, in Pictou County, Nova Scotia, are operated by parent corporations such as Asia-based Paper Excellence, a company with a substantial history of environmental abuse around the world. To feed the pulp mill, the forests of the region are being cut at an impossible-to-sustain rate in order to satisfy investors' desire for cheap pulp and easy profit. No one outside the mill can say quite for certain exactly what the market is for this pulp, though suspected uses range from paper to pelletized fuel for overseas power plants.

The demands of the pulp mills alone were unsustainable. In December, 2014, retired Natural Resources biologist Robert Bancroft wrote in Halifax's Chronicle-Herald that the government is turning Nova Scotia forests into an over-harvested pulp farm. But about that time, other forces of Big Industry--operating behind closed doors--created the biomass power plan. The idea they pandered was that the forests of Atlantic Canada could be cut and burned to produce cheap power. A great deal of backroom dealing went on between Big Industry and political circles, conservation science was dismissed, and ultimately the Nova Scotia government bought into this idea, allowing biomass companies to raze forests to the ground for a mere $8 and change per ton of wood fiber.


Not a decade ago, the world tried an experiment: turning crops into oil for cars and industry.  Ecologists had long warned the biofuel experiment would end in failure. And that it did, and hugely so.  Earth's thin zone of topsoil could not possibly produce energy sufficient to feed the population while also powering cars and heavy machinery. The biofuel experiment caused food prices to skyrocket globally, and most adversely affected the poor who already could barely afford to eat, as well as decimating land that served as major carbon sinks, i.e., encouraging clearing of rainforest for room to grow cheap biofuel crops.
Nova Scotia's biomass experiment will burn the forest itself to run major power plants, and it is resulting in the same fiasco. The thin biosphere of topsoil cannot possibly regenerate the forest faster than it is destroyed. And though vast swaths of woodlands have been razed right down to the roots in the ground in an attempt to get every last bit of burnable material, the hunger of the power plants is insatiable. Last year, investigative reporters learned the biomass plants had quietly been importing some 25% of their timber to feed their impossible demands.


The forest of Canada stretches far and wide. Canadians live with it and tend to see it as an immutable part of life. Beyond their cities they have a distant awareness of a vast expanse of green. They drive highways and byways and see it rising on either side of the road. It is a comforting sight, that beautiful wood that seems to go on forever.
But it doesn't, and that it seems unscathed is a carefully orchestrated deception. No place that can be reached by road or water is safe from the depredations of loggers in service of Big Industrys' pulp mills and biomass power schemes. Most anywhere you travel, just beyond sight and hidden by cleverly placed cosmetic hedges, are devastated forests, cut to the ground. Other clear cuts--more than you can possibly imagine--have turned back country, highlands and any place else off the beaten path into a patchwork of dead fields of jagged stumps, hidden by thin hedges of trees left to hide the environmental holocaust. But when companies get reputations for environmental abuse, it hurts public perception, and that hurts investment, so Big Industry has learned to avoid public outcry by keeping its activities on the down low.

This documentary in the making will tell the story of Canada's beleaguered forest. Focusing especially on the damage done to the unique Acadian woodlands of the eastern provinces, a genetically rich region where temperate and boreal biomes meet, we will explore the hidden damage Big Industry doesn't want you to see or know about. We will delve into a decade of backroom deals that have allowed an ecological holocaust in Canada's three Maritime provinces. And we will explore the dirty politics that have been used to silence the scientists, naturalists and environmentalists who would speak out against this.
This will be the untold story of Canada's forests under siege.

Other Ways You Can Help Money's tight and times are tough.  If you can't contribute and want to help, let others know about our work.  Link this page or the video, "A Forest Under Seige", and share, share, share . . .

story:
Resumen

 

Los colaboradores financian ideas que los apasionan y a la gente en la que confían. Estas son algunas cosas que puedes hacer en esta sección:

 
     
  • Preséntate y cuenta tu historia.
    •  
  • Describe brevemente tu campaña y explica por qué es importante para ti.
    •  
  • Expresa la magnitud de lo que logrará la ayuda de los colaboradores.
    •  
 

Recuerda, sé breve pero personal. Pregúntate: si alguien dejara de leer aquí, ¿estaría listo para colaborar?

 
 
 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Presenta más detalles:

 
     
  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
    •  
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
    •  
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.
    •  
 
 
 

El impacto

 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

 
     
  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
    •  
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
    •  
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.
    •  
 
 
 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Las personas valoran la transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al ofrecer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

 
     
  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
    •  
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.
    •  
 
 
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

 
     
  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
    •  
  • Recuérdales que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
    •  
 
 

Y eso es todo.

story:
A little about me

My name is Jake Walker, I am currently a one-man team, with my wife and dog cheering from the side-lines. I’m originally from Huddersfield, and have just moved back here after living the city life abroad for the last two years. I have grown tired and frustrated with my own wasteful way of shopping, and want to offer myself, and the entire Kirklees district, a much-needed alternative.

What's the issue?

Plastic is the issue.

If you haven’t heard or seen the media campaigns surrounding plastic pollution recently, you must have been living under a rock. It is very much an ‘of the moment’ topic, but please don’t be fooled into thinking this is just a passing fad. This is a real issue that everyone should be concerned about because it affects every single one of us.

How does it affect me?

Every single piece of plastic ever made, still exists somewhere. Just think about that for a moment. That means every plastic bag you’ve used, every straw, every toothbrush, every water bottle – they’re all still here in one form or another.

The best case scenario is that plastic is re-purposed or recycled and we can use it again as something else, but unfortunately this is only a small percentage – it is estimated that only around 29% of plastic in the UK is recycled.

Well, where does the rest go?

The majority of thrown away plastic will make its way to landfill, but at any time during that journey, or even once it’s there, it can be washed or blown into our streams and rivers, which ultimately carry it to the oceans.

It’s estimated that around 8 million metric tonnes of plastic enter the oceans from land each year.

Plastics in the water soak up pollutants very quickly. Larger plastic items are mistaken as food by fish and birds and are easily ingested. Their stomachs become full of plastic which they cannot digest, and they starve to death.

Over time, big plastics are broken down into microplastics and they enter the food chain. First being eaten by smaller fish and birds, and then subsequently by animals further up the food chain, and eventually ending up on our plates, full of toxic, hormone disrupting chemicals.

How can we make a change?

Scientist are taking on the very daunting task of trying to figure out how to reverse the damage we have already caused, and how to get rid of the plague of plastic in our oceans. What I can do is try to slow down the production and circulation of plastic.

I plan to open a Zero Waste shop in Huddersfield, the first of its kind in the area. The shop will offer ambient food products (anything that can be stored at room temperature, so pasta, rice, spices, herbs, flour, coffee, cereal etc) on a packaging free basis.

This means you will bring your own containers, or buy from our range of biodegradable and reusable packaging, and you will be able to choose exactly how much, or little, of each product you want to buy.

We will also offer beauty and cleaning products with no plastic, reusable coffee cups, water bottles, sandwich boxes, and much more. I think our customers will be surprised at the range of products available without any plastic packaging.

What I’m asking for

I need help with the initial set up costs of the business. This is what it's going to cost - 

  • Initial outlay of products, including both food and non-food items: £4,500 
  • Weighing and till system (this has to be a very accurate system, we don’t want our customers to pay more than they should): £1,700
  • Shop fit, this includes dispensers, containers and the labour of fitting the shop (all of our containers and dispensers will ensure that your food is safe and stored in the correct way): £9,300
  • Total estimated cost – £15,500

To show a little thanks…

A contribution of any size will receive my eternal thanks and appreciation, but I’d like to offer a little something else too –

  • A donation of £10 will receive a hand written thank you note on seeded paper – just a little something extra for our precious bees and butterflies.
  • A donation of £50 will receive a ‘Zero Yorkshire’ cotton tote bag with our logo on it and a hand written thank you note on seeded paper.
  • A donation of £100 will receive VIP membership for a year (from date of opening) which includes a 10% discount, a ‘Zero Yorkshire’ cotton tote bag with our logo on it and a hand written thank you note on seeded paper.

Ask me anything

This project is very close to my heart, not only because I believe this work to be vitally important, but also because I'm opening the shop within a community that means so much to me.

Huddersfield, and the wider district of Kirklees, is an area of outstanding beauty. I have been lucky enough to travel and live in a number of countries, but the green rolling hills of Huddersfield always call me home. 

There is a reason that the slogan for 'Zero Yorkshire' is 'Preserving what we're proud of', because I am proud to live here, and I do want to preserve what we have. 

So please, if you have any questions, or need some more information before you're happy to donate, don't hesitate to contact me. I will be very happy to hear from you. 

Thank you.

 

I would like to say a huge thank you to those who contributed to the £220 raised on the original Go Fund Me Page - that money has gone into the pot towards the opening costs of the shop. The perks available on this page apply to everyone who has already donated and we will be in touch once the campaign is over to arrange collection/postage of your perk.

story:
The Honest to Goodness Farm Co. has partnered with MacInnes Farms to dedicate land to a pollinator conservation.  In the coming year we will have fundraisers and scout out a buzzing team of volunteers to build and maintain a space for the community to enjoy and learn about pollinators.  

The area is located on 248th & 72nd in the Township of Langley, on the Historic Otter 248th Trail and will open to the public for set viewing and visiting times and days in 2019.

MacInnes Farms is providing the land.

The Honest to Goodness Farm Co. is donating the plants, trees, and nesting areas.

Volunteers are donating their time to make it all happen!

Now we need YOUR help for the finishing touches!  Your donation will be used for:

A Gazebo surrounded by a pollinators dream garden, creating the perfect community space, imagine a picnic lunch after a day of enjoying a space dedicated to biodiversity.

An education station with an eye spy list of pollinators and good-bug related stuff to spot on your visit.

Benches along the circle path to rest and enjoy the sounds of nature.

Information plaques along your walk so you can leave with a greater understanding of how our pollinators thrive!

With our rapidly growing community and production intense farming style its crucial we leave safe spaces for native pollinators to thrive and survive!

We, our community, and our pollinators thank you! 

Everyone can contribute by donating or by sharing and telling the World about what we are doing. As well we can all look around us at the critters we see and wonder if they might be a pollinator, helping our whole food production system.  Planting pollinator friendly flowers and plants or just walking in nature and appreciating.  You can also sign up for volunteering for events and/or work parties at http://eepurl.com/b1YvyX ...
story_txt: The Honest to Goodness Farm Co. has partnered with MacInnes Farms to dedicate land to a pollinator conservation.  In the coming year we will have fundraisers and scout out a buzzing team of volunteers to build and maintain a space for the community to enjoy and learn about pollinators.  The area is located on 248th & 72nd in the Township of Langley, on the Historic Otter 248th Trail and will open to the public for set viewing and visiting times and days in 2019.MacInnes Farms is providing the land.The Honest to Goodness Farm Co. is donating the plants, trees, and nesting areas.Volunteers are donating their time to make it all happen!Now we need YOUR help for the finishing touches!  Your donation will be used for:A Gazebo surrounded by a pollinators dream garden, creating the perfect community space, imagine a picnic lunch after a day of enjoying a space dedicated to biodiversity.An education station with an eye spy list of pollinators and good-bug related stuff to spot on your visit.Benches along the circle path to rest and enjoy the sounds of nature.Information plaques along your walk so you can leave with a greater understanding of how our pollinators thrive!With our rapidly growing community and production intense farming style its crucial we leave safe spaces for native pollinators to thrive and survive!We, our community, and our pollinators thank you! Everyone can contribute by donating or by sharing and telling the World about what we are doing. As well we can all look around us at the critters we see and wonder if they might be a pollinator, helping our whole food production system.  Planting pollinator friendly flowers and plants or just walking in nature and appreciating.  You can also sign up for volunteering for events and/or work parties at http://eepurl.com/b1YvyX ...

story:
Our full draft business plan will be available on our website www.nims.club, we are in the process of building this site. We hope by reading this that we will have impressed upon you that we are aware of the gravity of being a custodian of this lease, and that we truly have the best interest of the island and its surrounds at the core of our business strategy.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds in order to build the best retreat possible that includes sustainable solutions such as a renewable energy battery bank supported by wind, solar and tidal power versus a diesel powered generator.

As an early adopter we are offering significantly discounted accommodation and regular monthly progress updates. We are under no illusion that this will be a simple project and we hope that you can join us for the journey! There are four tiers of support listed and all will have access to updates.

The Queensland Government recognizes the challenges faced by our island resorts and are now offering incentives of $1 for $1 co-investment for projects that meet one of three criteria;

Rehabilitation of a resort area, Greening initiatives such as renewable energy and Building a public use asset such as the main administration, restaurant, bar, pool area we have allocated.

We meet all three criteria so with every dollar raised we should be eligible for co-investment of a dollar for that part of the project to help our cause!

The Impact

In order to protect the island, we need the general public to be aware of it. This awareness promotes stewardship, and this in turn promotes environmental caring, preservation and conservation. Hinchinbrook Island is a part of the World Heritage listed Great Barrier Reef and is adjacent to Wet Tropics World Heritage Area. It has an extremely high diversity with mountains, rivers, waterfalls, mangroves, beaches all with rare and endangered species such as the irrawaddy dolphin, mahogany glider or ground orchids. 2kms offshore are some of the largest and presumably oldest corals found anywhere on earth. We need more global awareness.

Our charter is to offer an island escape for everyone and support charitable causes. In building a low cost glamping style retreat we will make this affordable to the general public and provide accessibility for everyone. We aim to fund holidays for families with special needs adults in other states which have nothing like Hinchinbrook. We also hope to offer the local community significantly discounted pricing in the low season which is during the summer break, we are in discussions with council regarding this.

In building a centre of excellence for environmental studies we hope that we can have an impact on introduced pests such as the cane toad. If we can find a solution on Hinchinbrook, perhaps the island can save Australia from this plague.

There are many modern applications that we can introduce with our guests such as PlantSnap, FishTag and FrogID. There are so many species that will not be documented on these apps that it will be a veritable treasure hunt!

Risks & Challenges

We have considered all of the risks and ways of mitigating them. If the campaign doesn't meet our stated goal we will pursue commercial options and major investors. This may not suit our charter as most investors want a financial return.

We have significant challenges ahead in removing the damaged infrastructure back to the mainland, however we have innovative ways of removal. The new buildings need to be suited to the environment and we are expecting that we will have a non-traditional development for the main administration office incorporating biomimicry solutions.

There is a significant amount of rates, levies and interest owing to the local council and department of parks from the last ten years. We trying to negotiate a waiver of these fees as the council has provided no services during this time. These fees will impact our startup capital and delay the completion of the retreat.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to support financially, please share on all your social media! The only way to save this place is with your support! Follow our patreon account at NIMS. Raise awareness of the island follow www.hinchinbrookway.com.au or on Facebook!

Zoe Falls photo credit: @Mycolourfulworld

story:
Short Summary

Forests are home to 80 percent of the world’s terrestrial species of plants, animals, and insects. And 1.6 billion people depend on forests for their livelihood, including 70 million indigenous people. Forests supply water, mitigate climate change, and are essential for sustainable food production. Yet deforestation and forest degradation continue at alarming rates. Between 2015 and 2020, the rate of deforestation was estimated at 10 million hectares per year. And the area of primary forest worldwide has decreased by over 80 million hectares since 1990.

This month, Indiegogo donated $6,800 to support reforestation efforts to help make our planet a little greener, literally. The planet wouldn’t be able to survive without our forests, which is why we are excited to choose two incredible organizations dedicated to deforestation as part of our ongoing promise to support causes that matter to the Indiegogo community.

We want to thank the Indiegogo community for allowing us to make a difference and support causes that help the greater good. Last year, Indiegogo launched Tips for Indiegogo, a feature that allows backers to add a small additional donation to their campaign contributions. Indiegogo donates a portion of the money raised from Tips to important causes that need immediate attention. Earlier this year, Indiegogo donated $17,000 to the Asian Americans Advancing Justice – Asian Law Caucus, and we also donated 100% of the revenue raised from our March 15, 2021 newsletter to Stop AAPI Hate.

Supporting Reforestation

Since our inception, helping the planet has been a prime concern for Indiegogo backers and campaigners. Hundreds of ideas that aim to protect the planet have found their home on Indiegogo’s platform, and reforestation efforts are crucial to keeping our planet habitable. On September 15, 2021, we donated a total of $7K to the following 2 organizations to support reforestation:

One Tree Planted, a non-profit organization focused on global reforestation. Their mission is to make it simple for anyone to help the environment by planting trees. Indiegogo’s donation of $1,800 will be put into the reforestation efforts in North America, Latin America, Asia, Africa, Europe, and the Pacific. 

American Forest Foundation, a non-profit organization that works on-the-ground with families, teachers, and elected officials to promote stewardship and protect the forest heritage of the United States. Indiegogo’s donation of $5K will help deliver meaningful conservation impact through the empowerment of family forest landowners. 

Green Campaigns on Indiegogo

Indiegogo has been home to hundreds of innovative projects that protect the planet. Green projects like at-home composters, solar powered generators, and accessible eBikes have all found funding on Indiegogo. 

Check out these green campaigns that are currently live on Indiegogo:

Lomi: Turn Waste To Compost With A Single Button

Lomi makes it simple to turn your food scraps, organic waste, and compostable packaging into compost. It can even break down bioplastic into compost that’s safe to use in your garden, which is what sets this home composter apart. Simply put in your garbage, press a button, and out comes nutrient-rich compost for your plants. 

The Briiv Air Filter: Unlock the Power of Plants

Air pollution is linked to an increased risk of respiratory conditions, including asthma and even lung cancer. Meet Briiv. As the world’s most sustainable air purifier, Briiv works to remove pollutants from your home to help you live, work and breathe healthier, happier, and safer lives.

Want to explore more green campaigns on Indiegogo? Check out our collection of energy, green tech, and sustainability crowdfunding campaigns. 

Header image credit: Lukasz Szmigiel on Unsplash.

story:
AumiTao - Live from the Heart.

 

Intention - Statement - Intro

Serving millions of people!

With?

Raising human Consciousness, Health & Well being.

How?

We are community supporting a lifestyle with Pure Nature, creating a positive Evolution by living from the Heart.

Supporting every individual to be the greatest Best version of themselves.

Our heart base will be presented with Healing centre on the biggest festivals in the world. 

We share the Nature Wisdom in food & drinks, ceremonies, workshops & treatments.

The Gift - future Vision development into community restaurants, The Heart of diverse town centers World wide.

 

Introduction

I am living and working in a community that supports every individual to be the greatest version of themselves.

Working together with pure nature, mother Earth and father Sky,

our rainbow family flows as Fire & Water around the world creating a positive Evolution.

The intention is to support people holistically through personal development so they can live from the Heart.

By living a lifestyle from the heart my Soul is rising in love with the greatest energetic spirit from the Universe.

I am taking care of planet Earth to live in harmony with all of life.

With our community we share the God’s gift in a form of Positive energy, Organic food & drinks, Healing workshops, ceremonies, treatments & lifestyle for the highest good of all.

 

Principle - vision statement

Shining bright as the stars we are, with focus in places where we can share the God’s Gift Love to it's highest potential.

Our vision is to radiate with a great energetic team in the biggest conscious festivals in the world.

The heart base will be presented with a stall & food bus, here we share medicine foods, drinks, healing ceremonies, workshops & health treatments.

 

"A example of what we do is sharing pure cacao."

Cacao is a great medicine that energises the Body, and supports connection with the Heart , emotions & each other.

Our family is blessed with sacred  worldwide native cacao experience.

We are connected  with organic native resorses in Guatemale, Mexico & Philiphines. 

We feel motivated to share the medicine and wisdom in diverse ways over the festival world, in gifted samples, ceremonies, workshops, drinks & snacks.

 

Our concept is to inspire with a diverse Menu ''the most famous foods in the world'' usually unhealthy meals like burgers, fries, pancakes & snacks transformed into a healthy version: Organic, Vegan & Glutenfree.

Creating Consciousess for a healthy Mind, Body, Soul & Earth.

We inspire holistic eco friendly living with biodegradable utensils and biological car gas.

The aim is to leave no unnatural carbon and footprints.

Our resources come from network connections that is full Counsious people that work with pure nature, permaculture communities, organic farms & beautifull induvidual souls.

We are presenting the whole package to live with pure nature, this is our vision to support a healthy and positive environment.

 

The Gift

The future plan is to develop into community restaurants in diverse town centers world wide.

Integrating our concept with focus to bring people together, enjoying and growing in the best version of them self.

We experienced our potential as being the Heart of a town, supporting an energy flow to live from the Heart.

 

Bio

We have 6 years experience in the smaller festival scene as eco friendly biodegradable food stand named vegev. The diamond wasn’t complete to shine with full potential, lacking some important skills, network & direction.

"I cannot do everything alone", Josh the creator of vegev has experienced.

When the time arrived that Josh was totally drained and wanted  to give up vegev, divine aligned Gigi was at the right place at the right time to connect and direct from the heart with Josh & vegev.

Gigi is a holistic healer, with intention to heal thy heart.

She travels with this mission around the world creating healing spaces and supporting self sufficient communities.

Gigi has a great world wide network of beautiful souls, and also has experienced the work in healing spaces of diverse world wide conscious festivals.

From her background running one of the most successful  stores  in Amsterdam, she has  great management abilities with loving people skills.

It was clear to us that we had a mission together and opened ourselves up for the magic to unfold. In a short time we created AumiTao Dream team, and completed the perfect foundation.

 

Donations - funding

We will be using your gift to have a new fresh start.

“ AumiTao - Heart base stand", bus, recipes & concept is already there :).

The diamond is shaped, the community is ready to take it to the next level !

Big festivals are there for us to share radiance on an optimal level.

We set your gift in to renew and start up on bigger scale, in the festival scene we pay on forehand with booking the spaces beginning 2019. The spaces are around 2000 € each festival.,We like to do at least 2 every month from april to october.

We also like to create a new ceremonial & workshop healing space, renovate and update the kitchen, stall and lounge.

Our team is full of heart loving and supporting volunteers.

The profit we create in the festival scene we set in for the Gift - future plan.

To start all this beauty your support is highly appreciated!

You will be part of the community and always welcome to join a great adventure with us.

 

Thank you very much! 

 

We deeply appreciate your support.

- Financial donations,

- Sharing of the Campaign with your Network,

- Being part of the DreamTeam AumiTao Community.

Together we can create a better world, 

If you like to see a change - Be the change! 

 

Much Love, Light & Prosperity,

Coordinator Gigi Indigo 

& DreamTeam AumiTao

followyourheart.itknowstheway@gmail.com

story:
Everyone has heard about the European refugee crisis. There are millions of refugees need to be educated thus a sustainable behavior. This is a uniquely awful predicament, one for which there is no panacea. Its effects are largely unavoidable, and all we can really do is ameliorate the symptoms.

That's what this campaign is all about. We want to launch a research project that will study the energy awareness among the refugee populations. We will then take the results of our research and pass them on to policymakers with our recommendations in the hopes that someday soon something can be done to improve the situation.

Right now, we are turning to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $ 3500. These funds will cover the costs of our research project, giving refugees a shining light to follow out of this darkness that has consumed them for so long already. Your contributions mean something here. We appreciate everything and thank you for your time.

Your kind generosity and donations will make it possible for refugees around the globe to be graciously admitted without fear or apprehension.

How can You help?

Please, donate in one way or another. You can choose from our amazing perks or just make a donation of your choice. We welcome people to bring additional ideas into the projects. Should your wish to volunteer, feel free to contact us.

story:
Hello, my name is Bryon I live in Colorado I am 24 years old. I have always loved gardening and taking care of living things, ever since i was a kid living in Missouri. I also love good food and care deeply for our planet. I went to college for zoo keeping so that I could learn more about animals and how to care for the more exotic ones. My greatest motivation is that I want my newborn son to be able to have a healthier planet to live on and flourish.

 

        My campaign is called the Sustainable Ag Project, I started it so that i could open a commercial size greenhouse so that I can grow tropical fruits here in Colorado. Growing fruit from the tropic regions here in Colorado would reduce the distance they have to ravel, it would also allow people to see the process of growing them and educate them on why sustainable farming practices are important, and why they should grow locally. One of my biggest personal goals for my project is to show people that there are other ways to do things, that they can themselves make this world a better place with a brighter future for all.

        You the contributors will be able to help get this business started, if i get the funding not only will I be starting this greenhouse, I will be using the profits from it to open more and more, so that one day every city will have one, that is my goal. They will be bigger and better with each one created. All of you, can help me achieve these lofty goals, this project of mine had the potential to change how things are done.

 

           As far as funding is concerned I set the goal to ten million, I can do the project for much less but such a high goal will help pay for higher quality materials and a faster construction time. I know its a lot of money, but I believe firmly that people will see it as a worthy cause and help with whatever they can.

               The perks for donating will be very variable, they range from a basket of high quality fruit all the way to having a personal tour of the place and lunch with me, maybe even let you help plan the future of the business and at the very least let ALL who donate have input on future expansions/business ideas.

              If I do not reach my entire goal, the funds will be used to at least start construction and get things going. I can at the very least downscale the facility to ensure that it does get built and start producing, then work on expanding it and adding new areas over time.

 

             My project if completed, will have a big impact on the world. Everyone's eyes will be opened up to new ways to do things and new ideas for ways to improve how our food is grown. The possibilities for improvement upon our current agricultural model are huge, and if my project is completed, businesses throughout the world would see that new ways of producing goods can catch on and effect not only the quality of peoples lives, but also the planets health.

 

             There are of course risks, and challenges just like every other endeavor. The greatest of which is finding suitable land for the project, Colorado has lots of hills and uneven land, ideally I would want a flat site that does not require heavy machinery to smooth it down. The second part of finding the land is that I believe something in the city would be best for visibility and awareness of the business.

        I am resourceful, smart and know many people who own businesses, and challenge or risk I encounter am sure I am sure I will be able to tackle head on and overcome.

    The land issue is a complex challenge, I will be searching while the campaign is going for the most suitable land for my purposes, if needed I can make less than ideal land work.
 

         You, the contributors can help besides donating you can help just spread the word, get it out there.  I am absolutely confident in you guys!!!  I know you guys can do it!! Also, remember to use the indiegogo share tools when your spreading the word.
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Bryon I live in Colorado I am 24 years old. I have always loved gardening and taking care of living things, ever since i was a kid living in Missouri. I also love good food and care deeply for our planet. I went to college for zoo keeping so that I could learn more about animals and how to care for the more exotic ones. My greatest motivation is that I want my newborn son to be able to have a healthier planet to live on and flourish. 
        My campaign is called the Sustainable Ag Project, I started it so that i could open a commercial size greenhouse so that I can grow tropical fruits here in Colorado. Growing fruit from the tropic regions here in Colorado would reduce the distance they have to ravel, it would also allow people to see the process of growing them and educate them on why sustainable farming practices are important, and why they should grow locally. One of my biggest personal goals for my project is to show people that there are other ways to do things, that they can themselves make this world a better place with a brighter future for all.
        You the contributors will be able to help get this business started, if i get the funding not only will I be starting this greenhouse, I will be using the profits from it to open more and more, so that one day every city will have one, that is my goal. They will be bigger and better with each one created. All of you, can help me achieve these lofty goals, this project of mine had the potential to change how things are done.
 

           As far as funding is concerned I set the goal to ten million, I can do the project for much less but such a high goal will help pay for higher quality materials and a faster construction time. I know its a lot of money, but I believe firmly that people will see it as a worthy cause and help with whatever they can.
               The perks for donating will be very variable, they range from a basket of high quality fruit all the way to having a personal tour of the place and lunch with me, maybe even let you help plan the future of the business and at the very least let ALL who donate have input on future expansions/business ideas.
              If I do not reach my entire goal, the funds will be used to at least start construction and get things going. I can at the very least downscale the facility to ensure that it does get built and start producing, then work on expanding it and adding new areas over time.
 

             My project if completed, will have a big impact on the world. Everyone's eyes will be opened up to new ways to do things and new ideas for ways to improve how our food is grown. The possibilities for improvement upon our current agricultural model are huge, and if my project is completed, businesses throughout the world would see that new ways of producing goods can catch on and effect not only the quality of peoples lives, but also the planets health.
 
             There are of course risks, and challenges just like every other endeavor. The greatest of which is finding suitable land for the project, Colorado has lots of hills and uneven land, ideally I would want a flat site that does not require heavy machinery to smooth it down. The second part of finding the land is that I believe something in the city would be best for visibility and awareness of the business.

        I am resourceful, smart and know many people who own businesses, and challenge or risk I encounter am sure I am sure I will be able to tackle head on and overcome.    The land issue is a complex challenge, I will be searching while the campaign is going for the most suitable land for my purposes, if needed I can make less than ideal land work.          You, the contributors can help besides donating you can help just spread the word, get it out there.  I am absolutely confident in you guys!!!  I know you guys can do it!! Also, remember to use the indiegogo share tools when your spreading the word.

story:
My name is John Magiro and I built a mini hydropower station from scratch for my village in Murang’a, Kenya. I have set up this fundraiser page to help me achieve my next goal which is to build another hydropower station in the next small village that is still without electricity.

My project seeks to empower the local communities to have better living conditions by increasing their opportunities for making productive economic investments while promoting a culture that uses eco-friendly power. To date, I have connected 350 households in my village to electricity. But this is not enough; there are many more households that still use lantern lamps for their lighting. These people live below the poverty line and therefore cannot afford to seek other alternatives. However, I do not have the funds to reach them all.  

It is for this reason that I appeal to you, seeking your help to transform the lives of those living in Murang’a and Kenya at large. I want to scale up my project to reach an additional 200 households (1,000 people) and also commence the construction of the next mini hydropower station. It is in this regard that am asking for your help in raising USD 150,000. This will be used to:

  1. Boost current production capacity to reach more homes
  2. Purchase necessary equipment and machinery
  3. Purchase and install power poles to reach 200 households
  4. Purchase and install power cable lines to reach 200 households
  5. Purchase safety gear for the Magiro team
  6. Set up a new power plant in a neighbouring village

My desire is to see each and every household lit up with clean, reliable and affordable energy. I want to see a world where even the rural poor are empowered to alter their realities. I want to see children read at night. I do not want to see trees cut and women and girls walk long distances in search of wood fuel. I want to see my village look like the big towns. I desire a world where energy poverty gap is so minimal it cannot form a statistic anymore. But to achieve this, I need your help.

I alone cannot change the world. Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the change that we seek and we must make our little footing in making the world a better place. I am already more than grateful for the support you have granted me so far, for I know, together we can change this world. I am however, kindly requesting for your help in sharing this campaign with your friends, family and networks. I will be grateful for any form of support you accord my team and I, be it monetary or technical.  Every donation counts!

Thank you for your donation.
